Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Struck flint, citrus and lemongrass start off quietly on the nose. A light yet smooth palate brings fleshy tones of yellow apple with a bit a spice. This well-balanced wine would be a welcome addition to the dinner table.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Description: The nose begins with candied lemon, ripe apple flesh, spring flowers and citrus pith, then the palate offers melon-syrup and orange-blossom flavors.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2017 Rava Blackjack Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Monterey)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of pollen, green-apple candy and white cherry grace the nose. This is tart in profile on the palate lead by a green-apple flavor, with rounder notions of citrus and stone. A savory yeasty tone lingers on the finish.
Name: Fulkerson 2017 William Vigne Grüner Veltliner (Seneca Lake)

Description: This Hungarian wine is light straw colored in the glass with aromas of lemon curd, white peach and Turkish delight. It is bright yet soft on the palate, with flavors of white peach, grapefruit pith, rose petal and apricot before the lifted finish.
Name: Count Károlyi 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Pannon)

Description: Wonderfully reductive notes of gunflint blend with aromatic notes of baked apple and citrus zestiness on the nose. The palate reprises these notes and adds a vivid, textured earthiness. At its core is a mouthwatering saltiness edged with pleasantly bitter pith and dusty sprays of white pepper. What concentration, what allure, what freshness, even with five years of maturity.
Name: Nikolaihof 2013 Baumpresse Im Weingebirge Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Both ripe pear and golden stone fruit beckon with their sunny juiciness on the nose. The palate then presents a tight, rich core of salty, spicy yeast, miso and pepper tones. The pithy texture and the lemony brightness are ideal counterweights in this compact, concentrated and complex wine.
Name: Josef Jamek 2017 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Earthy, juicy ripeness of Russet pear is evoked vividly on the nose, while white pepper and ground stone shimmer in the background. The palate is juicy at first, but soon the salty, yeasty, almost cheesy core spreads its savory magic, not without adding vivid apple notes. A very complex and deeply satisfying wine. The finish belongs to zesty, clean lemon.
Name: Nikolaihof 2010 Im Weingebirge Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Crushed sage, yarrow and mossy earthiness entice on the nose. On the palate, rich yeasty texture and fine, high-toned citrus freshness frame and embrace all of this savory charm. This is highly concentrated, tingling with pepper and sage, brimming with pear fruit and lemon freshness. Every molecule of fluid is crammed with sheer flavor, yet there is nothing fat about these wines.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Ried Renner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Notes of salty miso, celery, lemon and green pear unite into an intriguing nose. On the palate, it is ripe, juicy pear that takes the lead, but that salty zestiness, that edge of peppery savoriness is always present, adding freshness and allure to this fluid, slender, concentrated and zesty wine. The finish echoes with citrus and white pepper. It will take some time to come into its powerful own. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2017 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Lemon balm and nettle notes gently insinuate their savoriness into a fruity mix of ripe lemon and pear. This game of savory, almost salty fruitiness continues on the fluid body, which is tense and wonderfully taut with juicy freshness. Lemon and pear for now take center stage, but salty yeast informs that vivid zestiness at the core.
Name: Nigl 2017 Herzstück vom Kirchenberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Notes of ripe Russet pear on the nose have a pleasantly earthy edge. On the palate, the ripeness and juiciness of the pear fruit is enforced, while a high-toned, zesty lemon freshness underlines savory, salty and herbal notes of yeast. This is concentrated, mouthwatering and totally moreish, especially on that long, appetizing finish.
Name: Alzinger 2017 Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Aromatic notes of ripe pear flesh and peel have a yeasty, sonorous edge on the nose. The palate joins both fruit and yeast in a lovely, textured core that reveals salty, almost bitter miso and echoes of deep savoriness. Pithy citrus lends even more mouthfeel. A wonderfully concentrated, complex wine that deserves some bottle age. Drink 2020–2035.
Name: Alzinger 2017 Ried Steinertal Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Funky earthiness encounters the nose first. After that, supremely ripe pear fruit takes over. The palate adds cushioned, creamy yeastiness and a whole load of lemon-scented, salty but soft yeastiness. This is a wine about texture and depth, about earth and deep savoriness. This is fluid and rounded without an ounce of fat, simply flowing in its own, rounded creaminess. The finish is fresh and creamy.
Name: Loimer 2017 Ried Loiserberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The flinty whiff of reduction still plays promisingly on the nose. The palate then fans out into earthy pepperiness, pear-fruited creaminess and spiky lemon freshness. Both texture and freshness characterize the midpalate, while sage, pepper and dried sage shimmer around the edges. Lovely, unusual and very elegant.
Name: Bründlmayer 2017 Ried Spiegel Vincent Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Highly aromatic notes of glowingly ripe, juicy pear also have an edge of bergamot. This aromatic sophistication carries over onto the palate where pithy, zesty citrus provides lots of concentration. The result is totally mouthwatering in a salty fashion that is utterly moreish and very refreshing. This is racy, taut and packed with flavor.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2017 Ried Kellerberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Salt, pepper and lemon notes own the nose offer the promise of savoriness. The palate then wheels out all the salty concentration in full force. This tingles like lemon zest and has the texture of citrus pith. Concentration and savoriness are written all over it. This is compact, deeply savory and totally lip-smacking.
Name: Eichinger 2017 Ried Gaisberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A lovely green apple freshness streams from the glass before a fennel and yeast savoriness spreads out. The slender palate then regales us with utter lemony concentration that highlights pepper, pear, apple, sage and wet stone. Zestiness shimmers and is wonderfully pervasive, keeping this taut and wonderfully vivid.
Name: Josef Jamek 2017 Ried Liebenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The fragrance of crushed citrus leaves creates a heady opening on the nose before ripe pear and lemon balm follow. The palate presents a picture of concentrated zestiness with edges of white pepper, salty preserved lemon and arugula, all wrapped in pear-fruited richness. Zest also characterizes the finish of this wine, which carries its full-flavored richness lightly.
Name: Türk 2017 Ried Kremser Thurnerberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Yeast, wet earth and supremely aromatic pear notes make for an intriguing nose. On the palate it is lifted, fruity, fresh and almost passion-fruit-like juiciness that make this irresistible. The body is concentrated and fluid and for now showcases its brilliant, refreshing and exciting fruit, but underneath is a core of salty richness that makes this so very moreish. Fluid, salty, zesty, slender but rounded.
Name: Malat 2017 Ried Höhlgraben Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Soft green pear on the nose has edges of dried sage. The slender palate still seems tightly closed but its pithy, textured concentration promises depths of salty, yeasty, pear- and citrus-fruited pleasure. This will blossom with a little bottle aging and will definitely be worth the wait. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Eichinger 2017 Ried Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A lovely hint of green bergamot precedes the more customary notes of green and yellow pear on the nose. The palate is juicy and compact, presenting its pristine pear and citrus notes in a fluid, bulletlike fashion that explodes with zestiness and verve against a pithy, textured backdrop. The citrus notes fill the mouth and last all the way to a very mouthwatering finish.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2017 Terrassen Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A riper aspect of pear plays on the nose, but it is not until the wine reaches the palate that it comes alive. There is a still tight core that holds notes of yeast, shimmering white pepper, celery salt and wet earth, which unfold slowly with a bit of air. This is concentrated but not heavy, impressive but relaxed and simply balanced perfectly.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2017 Ried Sauberg Tradition Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A funky whiff hints at some promising reduction on the nose before savory notes of citrus, arugula and miso take over. There is a ripe core that adds juicy, rounded pear notes to the savoriness that goes well with the rich, smooth texture of the wine. The finish is lasting, salty and moreish.
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2017 Ried Loibenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Wet stone and freshly cut pear peel dominate the nose. The palate expands with fresh, ripe pear and more subtle Mandarin orange notes against a beautifully salty, pithy backdrop of yeast. This is concentrated, sassy and zesty.
Name: Türk 2017 Ried Kremser Frechau Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Green melon, citrus foliage and a lick of creaminess on the nose make for a winning, appetizing combination. The palate speaks of concentration, yeast and salty depth alongside the fresh green pear notes. This is both rich and slender, expansive and focused. Lovely.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2017 Ried Pankraz Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A little funky wilderness still plays on the yeasty nose and does not yet give much away. The palate, however, develops that textured, lemon-scented, yeasty game and gives full rein to a kind of celery saltiness. There is lovely midpalate grip, too, and ample concentration.
Name: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2017 Manila Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Description: A hint of earthiness precedes the notes of ripe, juicy pear on the nose. The palate switches into a savory mode that puts a salty yeastiness at the center, where creamy yeast and zesty pith combine into a wonderful texture, yet the finish shines with bright lemon and ripe pear. What a lovely mouthful.
Name: Proidl 2017 Ried Pellingen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: High-toned notes of freshly cut green pear expand on the nose. The palate then adds its creamy yeastiness and the texture of citrus pith, lending structure and a fitting backdrop to the salty, savory edge. Bright citrus freshness keeps this on a totally refreshing and even keel. Mouthfilling, concentrated and totally lip-smacking.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2017 Ried Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Subtle hints of mace and pepper give the nose a spicy frame. The palate then delivers Grüner's inimitable texture, enriched with savory, salty, herbal creaminess of yeast and gentle pear fruit. This is concentrated, complex and light, despite its undoubted body and oomph. Drink now–2028.
Name: Anton Bauer 2017 Rosenberg Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Yeast, celery and a hint of cream make for an intriguing nose. The palate brings yeasty, savory notes and provides distinct concentration on the slender palate. Lovely, spicy depth and moreishness reign on the salty finish.
Name: Anton Bauer 2017 Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Yeast, earthiness, ripe pear and saltiness on the nose find their full, rich expression on the expansive palate. Aromatic, ripe pear fruit pervades the creamy yeast and counters the wonderful pepperiness. Fruit and textured richness go hand in hand.
Name: Hirsch 2017 Ried Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A touch of baked pear blinks though the softer, pillowy yeastiness on the nose. It is on the palate that the yeastiness becomes pithy, while a creamy saltiness spreads with highlights of sage and fennel seed. A savory wine with immense fluidity, concentration and character.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Tradition Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A high-toned note of fresh, green pear appears before riper pear and sage take over on the nose. The palate adds zingy, fresh and tingling lemon peel to the salty yeast and savory, mossy herbal notes, lending slenderness to these enticing, pervasive and moreish flavors with their long finish.
Name: Steininger 2017 Ried Kittmannsberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Subtle notes of Russet pear peel and lime zest on the nose lead to a very concentrated body where the attractive zestiness combines winningly with notes of salty miso and hints of white pepper. It is citrus freshness that highlights the aromatic, savory nature of these flavors and gives this wine its racy, refreshing tension and utter moreishness.
Name: Georg Frischengruber 2017 Ried Kirnberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fully ripe and aromatic Williams pear shines on the nose. The palate comes in with immense concentration that brims with spiky citrus zest and a lovely, grippy, pithy texture. Lemon balm, white pepper and crushed verbena shimmer around the edges, but it is the lemon peel purity that radiates all the way to the lip-smacking finish.
Name: Malat 2017 Ried Gottschelle Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A touch of miso and earth clings to the pear peel note of the nose. The palate also presents these savory flavors, which are reminiscent of miso paste, soy and crushed sage. Lively lemon brightness highlights them all the more and provides a pithy texture. A lovely, savory and complex wine.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2017 Ried Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Notes of freshly cut apple and Conference pear peel dance on the nose alongside fresh lemon. The palate adds a textured backdrop to this fruity display, which features salty yeast and pithy, earthy depth. The finish is dominated by mouthwatering, refreshing lemon zestiness.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2017 Von Stein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Green Conference pear and earthy, salty yeast on the nose reappear with renewed vigor on the slender but buffered palate. White pepper and celery salt tingle while fresh lemon and moss notes persists.
Name: Steininger 2017 Ried Loisium Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Lemon zest, white pepper and soy savoriness on the nose promise spice and concentration. It is on the textured midpalate that the saltiness spreads, highlighting shimmers of white pepper, crushed sage and yeast. While the core is rich and buffered, the body of the wine remains fluid, slender and taut. A class act.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2017 Bergdistel Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Notes of superripe stone fruit stream from the glass, but the palate is a picture of savoriness. There still is the fluidity of the fruit, but this really is about salty, yeasty, savory texture with wonderful freshness and concentration. Tingling white pepper frames the long finish. Wonderful.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2017 Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Notes of freshly turned, wet earth attain an air of herbal savoriness, which finds its full expression on the slender and very juicy palate. Ripe yellow plum is joined by arugula, hay flower, crushed yarrow and wet moss. The finish is tapered to a long finish by spiky, fresh lemon.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2017 Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Notes of crushed celery, sage and fresh yeast on the nose already hint at the concentrated dose of savoriness that is to come. The palate presents this with a satisfying, lasting intensity. This is about texture and saltiness rather than fruit and deserves to stand on the very best tables. A deeply gastronomic wine of beautiful but light-footed eminence.
Name: Gruber Röschitz 2017 Ried Mühlberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A rather shy nose reveals nothing but slight notes of citrus. The palate then fills out with subtle but convincing notes of fresh sage, lemon pith, celery salt and yeast. Lemon highlights keep this on the ultrafresh side, but the savory yeastiness provides a lovely balance.
Name: Leindl 2017 Ried Seeberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A subtle nose reveals suspicions of yeast and lemon. The palate shows an intriguing edge of phenolics that unites yeasty texture with lemony pith. All this happens on light, delicate but very grounded feet. This is lovely now but will be even better with bottle aging. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Markus Huber 2017 Ried Berg Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Pear and salty miso on the nose already promise a dramatic clash of opposites. The palate presents these poles in exemplary fashion. The creamy, textured, pithy and pleasantly bitter edge of yeast and zest meet rounded, harmonious and ripe pear fruit. The long, lip-smacking finish makes you crave more.
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2017 Ried Kellerberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A rich, fragrant yeastiness, tinged with celery salt and sage shimmers on the nose alongside citrus and green pear. On the palate, the yeast pervades both texture and flavor, enhanced by new notes of hay flower and a distinct, moreish, tingling saltiness. So much flavor packed into a mouthful of wine.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2017 Ried Grub Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe stone fruit, juicy yellow pear and creamy yeast signal richness on the nose. The palate obliges with yeasty creaminess and a bold but fluid texture. The ripe and juicy pear notes, however, peep through in a joyful, almost cheeky fashion. A lovely, rounded, full-flavored wine with a peppery finish.
Name: Steininger 2017 Ried Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Freshly turned wet earth and pear peel on the nose promise richness and texture. The palate duly obliges and presents a concentrated core that unites salty yeast, lemon zest and savory miso notes. A slight but pleasant bitterness adds bite and counters the lovely fruit. This is complex and mouthwatering to the last.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2017 Ried Höhereck Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Lemon zest, creamy yeast and white asparagus combine into a most enticing nose. The palate brings yet more savoriness with its shimmering white pepper and gleaming ripe lemon notes. The concentration is made all the more palpable by wonderful yeasty note. It offers a lovely, satisfying mouthful.
Name: Allram 2017 Ried Renner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Pear peel, miso and yeast on the nose immediately promise a savory wine. The palate delivers with an almost fizzingly fresh zesty core and a yeasty, salty texture that is both fruity and spicy. There is concentration and strength despite the slenderness. The finish is lip-smacking and long and reprises that lovely pear note.
Name: Forstreiter 2017 Ried Schiefer Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The ripe headiness of juicy yellow plums is apparent on the appetizing nose. This is followed by far fresher notes of lemon. The palate then reveals a zesty, yeasty texture of peppery lemon. This is a perfect tease, revealing layer upon layer of flavor, yet there is nothing facile about it. Textbook Grüner with huge but unshowy allure.
Name: Gruber Röschitz 2017 Ried Hundspoint Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Green Conference pear on the nose sends a promise of freshness and vivid fruit. The concentrated texture is reminiscent of citrus pith, while the softening yeast has a salty, moreish aspect. The finish is totally refreshing and intense, with pear, yeast and salt.
Name: Hiedler 2017 Ried Kittmannsberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The nose tells of ripe Mirabelle plum and gentle creaminess. The palate then switches its attention to yeasty, salty savor and a pithy, moreish, tingling texture. The body is light and pleasantly slender but also utterly moreish with a beautifully long echo.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2017 Ried In der Schaublau Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Ripe Mirabelle plum shimmers gently on the nose. The palate counters this rounded gentleness with concentrated, zesty freshness that sweeps in and reveals a core of salty, savory yeastiness. Understated but effective.
Name: Markus Huber 2017 Ried Alte Setzen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Zest, pear, miso, pepper and fennel seed are all hinted at on the nose and appear inside a lovely, zesty frame on the concentrated palate. Yeasty texture amplifies the savoriness of the herb and miso notes, but lemon zest provides a lovely, full-flavored and refreshing finish.
Name: Türk 2017 Ried Kremser Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: White pepper, pear, miso and yeast on the nose promise freshness and texture in equal measure. The palate adds a good dose of tingling white pepper spice to the yeasty core. The body presents zesty, pithy concentration and plenty of mouthfeel with a lip-smacking finish.
Name: Fischer 2017 Ried Frauenweingärten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Very fresh pear and pear drop on the nose signal fruity freshness on the nose. The lively, slender palate adds zesty citrus and a slightly textured, yeasty core. But freshness, green pear and lemon reign joyfully on this refreshing, vivid wine.
Name: Forstreiter 2017 Ried Tabor Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A mossy, green freshness precedes ripe notes of Russet pear on the nose. The palate then spreads itself on the tongue in expansive, fresh, savory yeastiness. That mossy herbal note mingles with fresh citrus and packs a wonderfully textured mouthful of flavor. Light and balanced, but with lots of impact.
Name: Hiedler 2017 Ried Schenkenbichl Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The nose is a picture of zesty lemon and salty yeast. It is the savoriness of the yeasty core that takes over on the creamy yeast, zesty palate. This is fluid and compact, with an enticing, savory juiciness of green pear. The finish is lip-smacking and long.
Name: Hirsch 2017 Ried Gaisberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Gentle notes of blossom play around notions of Mirabelle plum on the nose. The palate, however, focuses on yeast and salty concentration. There is something of celery, lemon pith and salt that entices all the way to the finish.
Name: Markus Huber 2017 Ried Zwirch Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: A nose that combines Russet pear with lime zest promises concentration that promptly follows on the slender but bundled palate. Here, the salty yeastiness that pervades this wine becomes apparent with hints of green pepper. Lovely ripe pear notes counter the savoriness and combine into a very harmonious whole.
Name: Proidl 2017 Ried Ehrenfels Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Earth, yeast and celery salt promise a savory, textured wine, and the palate duly delivers: Yeast and texture have something of rich citrus zest. The palate tingles here and there with a little white pepper, while that celery saltiness echoes in the background.
Name: Allram 2017 Ried Gaisberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The nose suggests very ripe fruit, full-blown yeastiness and wet earth. The palate adds bright, fresh lemon notes to this earthy, intense mix and presents a very textured, concentrated midpalate. This is a wine that needs hearty food to do its muscular structure justice.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2017 Reserve Golden Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Something floral and summery hovers on the nose of this fresh but rounded Grüner. It is on the palate that it packs a punch with vivid and juicy notes of ripe pear and peach but above all with its yeasty, rich texture. Lemon brightness brings it all in line. The finish is long and salty.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2017 Reserve Hommage Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Pear peel, lemon zest and lemon balm combine into a nose of ripe greenness. The palate is concentrated and has that lovely edge of mandarin zest that enriches the yeasty texture with juicy, vibrant freshness. This is mouthwatering, tense and moreish.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2017 Ried Lindberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Beautifully aromatic notes of ripe Russet pear peel beckon on the nose. On the palate, this lovely fruit is joined by zesty pithiness with just an edge of pleasant bitterness that lends real grip amid the flowing, exuberant juiciness. It is the aromatic pear that owns the long finish.
Name: Stadt Krems 2017 Ried Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Floral overtones and hints of ripe Mandarin orange peel lend a summery vibe to this Grüner. Lovely hints of lemon balm lend even more freshness. The palate is full-fruited but has a lovely edge of white pepper and ripe citrus zestiness. A wonderfully concentrated, citrusy mouthful.
Name: Zahel 2017 Ried Kaasraben Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Aromatic notes of ripe Comice pear on the nose promise both freshness and fruit. The palate immediately adds an exciting sense of white pepper and lemon pith to provide structure and texture to the lovely, friendly and aromatic pear fruit. Both pear and pepper echo long on the slender, zesty body.
Name: Nigl 2017 Ried Pellingen Privat Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Freshly cut peel of ripe, juicy Russet pear is enticingly evoked on the nose. The palate is light but has that most pleasant, ever so slightly grippy texture. There is concentration and poise, but everything is subtle, quiet and all the more convincing for it.
Name: Sohm & Kracher 2015 Single Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Rounded notes of ripe pear on the nose already have an herbal, peppery edge, but that still does not prepare you for the explosion of concentrated flavor on the palate. Notes of ripe, juicy stone fruit, yeast and arugula overtones all play around a central shaft of bright, refreshing acidity. Lovely now, sure to evolve. Drink now–2025.
Name: Sohm & Kracher 2016 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A creamy hint of pear and green banana teases on the nose. A certain soft creaminess spreads across the palate and veers distinctly toward the ripe pear notes, buffered by yeasty creaminess. The fruity pear notes seem to become more intense with every sip, always bedded with this soft, springy yeast. Very fluid and elegant.
Name: Weszeli 2015 Ried Käferberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A really creamy note of oak and yeast hits the nose first and is then joined by mossy freshness. The palate, likewise, combines a creamy, oak-scented softness with Grüner's inherent savoriness. Lemon freshness brightens. This will benefit from some bottle aging. Drink 2020–2025.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2017 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Pear peel, yeast, miso and crushed sage make for an enticing, savory nose. The palate still tingles with freshness and presents ripe pear and aromatic citrus that centers on a firm, textured core of salty yeast and lemony pith. This is concentrated and long.
Name: Winzer Krems 2017 Edition Chremisa Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Yeast and crushed sage on the nose promise concentration and savoriness. The palate delivers with zesty brio that moves the yeasty texture center stage. The finish is lemony, long and salty.
Name: Ecker 2017 Ried Mordthal Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Notes of freshly cut Conference pear have hints of crushed sage, fennel seed and lime peel. The palate trumps with a similar array of flavors that unite citrus freshness and herbal, salty savor, all supported by finely textured yeastiness and that green pear note. Elegant and impeccably balanced in its full-flavored lightness.
Name: Leindl 2017 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The lively notes of oak on the nose almost have a pine resin headiness. Upon this follows creamy, almost emollient softness. The palate, right now, is still under the spell of the oak but has sufficient concentration to digest it with some more bottle age. Fruit, freshness and structure will all come through. Drink from 2022.
Name: Sohm & Kracher 2016 St Georg Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Russet pear peel and yeast are subtle on the nose. It is on the palate that the concentration becomes apparent: There is zesty lemon backed and countered by salty yeast. The pithy freshness and rich yeast echo till the finish.
Name: Fischer 2017 Privat Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Gentle notes of yellow plum promise softness and fruit on the nose. That softness expands further on the gentle, light-footed palate. There it is channeled into citrus freshness and white pepper spice. The body is slender, and the finish is clean and appetizing.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2017 Stein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Scented notes of pear almost have a hint of summer blossom on the nose. The palate complements this with yeasty, textured concentration that has something of citrus pith about it. A wonderfully balanced wine with a brisk, zesty citrus finish.
Name: Dürnberg 2017 Tradition Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Lemon, celery and miso on the nose present a very appetizing combination. The miso and yeast flavors become stronger on the slender but rounded palate. This is full of flavor and finishes with slight pepperiness.
Name: Winzer Krems 2017 Kremser Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Yeast, creaminess, moss, arugula and pepper all meet on the nose. The palate reprises these flavors and presents them in a fluid, compact, concentrated mouthful. The finish is wonderfully zesty and salty, and it is only on the finish that you realize what a little cracker this is.
Name: Setzer 2017 Ried Kronberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The merest whiff of gunflint on the nose gives way to subtle pear and lemon zest notes. The palate comes in with the animating juiciness of really ripe lemon and continues in this slender, juicy, refreshing and concentrated fashion. This is full of flow, ease and lemony joy and provides perfect refreshment.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2017 Ried Gott Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Ripe melon mingles with crushed arugula and yeast on the nose. The palate is light and adds bright lemon to proceedings, which helps to define that savory yeast core all the more. This is light, fresh and moreish with saltiness.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2017 vdR Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Rather heady notes of crushed citrus foliage precede the equally fresh and aromatic palate. This is unusually citrus-focused for a Grüner, but the texture and yeasty spice bring it back into the varietal fold. The finish still glows with zesty orange.
Name: Schödl 2017 Blumenthal Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Very subtle notes of pear play gently on the nose as a prelude to a lovely, creamy, understated palate that unites that gentle pear, bright lemon and subtle earthiness. This is light and elegant.
Name: Schödl 2017 In den Kreuthern Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Ripe yellow plum, zesty lime and wet moss create a fresh and appetizing nose. The palate packs a neat little yeasty punch, which accentuates the mossy notes. More zestiness and salty yeast define the finish.
Name: Schwarzböck 2017 Ried Sätzen Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Freshly cut green fruit sets the tone. Kiwi, greengage and Conference pear unite with herbal freshness and continue in this fresh, slender and brisk vein onto the slender palate. Bright lemon and white pepper do the rest and leave you totally refreshed.
Name: Fritsch 2017 Ried Schlossberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: The nose evokes the aroma of very ripe, golden pear. There even is a tropical edge of passion fruit. The palate tones this down into citrus freshness, bundled into a textured vein of yeastiness. The passion fruit stays until the finish.
Name: Setzer 2017 Ried Kirchengarten Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Gentle notes of Russet pear peel play on the nose and create a direct link to the flavors on the juicy palate, where ripe, almost luscious stone fruit joins in. Zesty lemon provides a refreshing counterpoint.
Name: Fritsch 2017 Ried Mordthal Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Aromas of pear and crushed sage start off the nose. The palate majors on the lemony side but gives some of that pithy saltiness that Grüner holds up its sleeve.
Name: Ecker 2017 Ried Schlossberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Young winemaker Gretchen Voelcker got her hands on some rare fruit for this bottling, which shows edgy aromas of crushed rock, flint, smoked apple and citrus peel on the nose. There is an immensely chalky tension to the palate, where yellow-apple and grapefruit-rind flavors wrestle for attention.
Name: Luna Hart 2017 Fiddlestix Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This new release is still a bit tight, so give it a chance to breathe. It's herbal and lightly peppery, as befits this variety. Highlights of lemon zest frame crisp yellow fruits, and the alcohol barely crosses 12%.
Name: Chehalem 2017 Ridgecrest Vineyards Grüner Veltliner (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: The purest scent of ripe apricot on the nose unfolds in even more spectacular fashion on the luscious palate. The flavors are carried by the immense, concentrated sweetness but are outlined and put into sharp focus by the crystalline acidity. This is sublimely pure and intense.
Name: Türk 2016 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: There is something brisk, lifted and lemony on the nose, framed with a herbal savoriness that recalls lemon balm and the ethereal headiness of freshly crushed wild thyme. The palate opens with supremely tart and lusciously sweet flavors at the same time, filling the tongue and mind with lemon freshness. The endless and rather tingling finish still echoes with peppery verve. This is concentrated, pure, precise and precious. Thrilling is the word. Drink until 2040, at least.
Name: Nigl 2016 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Gentle hints of ripe yellow apple and yellow stone fruit play amid hints of pastry. The palate is rounded with more hints of apple, cream and short crust, united by a central seam of lemony, bright and integrated freshness. There is something totally honest, disarming and fresh-faced about this yeasty, leesy and fruity pét-nat.
Name: Hager Matthias 2017 Pét-Nat Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Perlwein)

Description: A shy nose gives off just a little carbon dioxide from the fizz. The substantial palate, however, shows lots of yeasty roundness. This is mild but full bodied and leaves a long impression of lees and grapy freshness. Just a little pepper tingles on the finish of this Grüner Veltliner-based Sekt.
Name: Steininger 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Slightly floral, slightly melony notes hail bright freshness from the first sniff. The rather frothy, fizzy palate is easy, light and mild, with a rather generous dosage that bolsters the easy stone fruit and lemon notes. The finish is dry and fresh.
Name: Schlumberger Wein- und Sektkellerei 2016 Brut Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Crisp and creamy in Meyer lemon meringue and grapefruit, this lovely white also has flavors of red cherry and is acid-driven, with ample body to complement the freshness. It finishes in a lingering taste of wet stone.
Name: Belden Barns 2016 Estate Grown Grüner Veltliner (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: Nutty and dense on the nose and entry, this wine finds its rhythm with ease, showing a depth of grainy texture and focused flavors of citrus-fresh tangerine and Meyer lemon. It shows structure to age gracefully but is nearly impossible not to enjoy now.
Name: Carlisle 2016 Steiner Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This tastes like biting into a crisp green apple, with highlights of lemon rind and botanicals that adding depth to the engaging, dry finish. This winery leads the way in showcasing a New World spin on this Austrian variety.
Name: Reustle 2016 Estate Cuvée Grüner Veltliner (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a rich, ripe wine, moving the fruit flavors into the tropical spectrum, with peach, pineapple and papaya. A hint of honeycomb sneaks into the finish, along with palate-cleansing minerality.
Name: Reustle 2016 Smaragd Estate Cuvée Grüner Veltliner (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is one of a handful of offerings of this variety in the state. A new vineyard for this wine, aromas of lemon zest, lentil, talc and herb lead to zingy, drawn-out citrus-rind flavors that persist on the finish. Pair it with halibut with a lemon caper beurre blanc sauce.
Name: Syncline 2017 Bloxom Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though barely a half acre of Grüner is planted, it represents a lot for the Willamette Valley. This is thickly fruity, with grapefruit, pineapple and peach flavors, backed with plenty of tongue-tickling acidity.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: This wine's beatutifully aromatic notions of red-cheeked russet pear and autumn leaves create an intriguing, appetizing nose. On the palate, textured, spicy savoriness takes over, suggesting even more russet pear and salty yeast. It's intense, concentrated and utterly spicy, with the rattle and hum of white pepper throughout. Lovely now, it's sure to develop even more intensity. Drink now–2030.
Name: Mantlerhof 2016 Ried Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A touch of reduction plays on the nose, while the palate slowly opens into a wonderful display of pepper-spiced pear, yeasty apple and herb-scented lemon notes. The leesy texture lends mouthfeel and body while freshness lends drive. This is what Grüner Veltliner can do in talented hands. Lovely now, it's sure to develop. Drink now–2028.
Name: Eichinger 2017 Ried Hasel Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's Comice pear juiciness beckons from first whiff. On the palate, this vivid fruit notion is underlined by fresh lemon and salty, yeasty glimpses. It's concentrated, with ample freshness and the merest touch of creaminess. A complex, lovely and elegant Grüner Veltliner.
Name: Bründlmayer 2017 Ried Berg Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Gentle sage and moss notions play on the nose of this wine. They continue on the palate and meet fresh lemon notes, a riper, juicy pear aspect and a yeasty, miso- like savory backdrop. Though slender and light in body, it offers lots of subtle flavor and length.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2017 Ried Kreutles Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A flinty touch of reduction still plays on the nose of this wine. Underneath, a savory touch of fern and moss already promises aromatic enjoyment. The palate adds zesty grapefruit flavor, yeasty texture and ample lemony freshness.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2017 Ried Trum Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A touch of creamy pear entices on the nose of this slender but energetic wine. Lovely juicy pear notes intensify on the concentrated, streamlined palate. It's driven by a central vein of lemony freshness that lasts long into the finish.
Name: Fischer 2017 Rossatz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine's nose is rather closed, giving just hints of green pear. The palate is taut and tightly wound, but a little air reveals concentrated lemon notes and a core of leesy, salty savoriness recalling yeast and soy. The finish is clean and moreish.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2017 Peunt Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A ripe hint of Mirabelle plum plays alongside green pear and white pepper aromas on the nose of this wine. The palate carries these notes with bright, concentrated ease. It's mouthfilling, lip-smacking, exciting and delicious.
Name: Türk 2017 vom Urgestein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's lemon balm, fennel seed and pear scents create a savory yet fruity nose. The palate brings an extra dimenstion of texture created by yeasty, zesty notions. Though slender in body, it's full of flavor and nuance, as all elements come together with uncommon intensity on the finish. Lovely.
Name: Berger 2017 Ried Reisenthal Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's ripe apple, green pear and fresh yeast aromas carry over to the palate. Here, the fruit is even more rounded but also joined by vivid lemon freshness. It's concentrated and laden with beautiful, aromatic fruit. Lovely now but sure to last. Drink now–2028.
Name: Georg Frischengruber 2017 Ried Zanzl Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A touch of Irish moss plays alongside pear notes on the nose of this wine. The palate adds lemony verve and textured, yeasty notes as well as a touch of white pepper. The finish is clean and moreish, with that lemony savoriness lingering long.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2017 Dürnstein Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine's shy nose gives way to a still tightly wound palate. Its concentrated body holds ripe, bright lemon and salty sage flavors in a tight embrace. Driven and taut, it promises lasting refreshment.
Name: Eichinger 2017 Ried Wechselberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Faint hints of fern and lime appear on the nose of this toned wine. The palate is fresh with green pear and lovely white pepper notes. Yeastiness provides a lovely, textured backdrop.
Name: Eichinger 2017 Strass Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's aroma is a mix of herb and fruit notes, recalling fern, sage, lemon and pear. The palate follows suit with bright, vivid freshness while a yeasty backdrop adds an element of saltiness. The finish is lip-smacking, utterly refreshing and very moreish.
Name: Fischer 2017 Ried Zanzl Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The nose of this wine is shy at first, giving just a faint idea of yeastiness. As it opens, creamy green pear notes become apparent. The concentrated palate suggests pear and peppery herbs like arugula and watercress. It's all bundled in a lovely, svelte body.
Name: Josef Jamek 2017 Ried Achleiten Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Reduction and yeast vie for attention with rounded, ripe pear notes on the nose of this wine. The yeast wins out with its savory hints of soy, sage and salt. The palate is textured, concentrated and juicy, with lots of lemony freshness. A lovely, exciting and spicy mouthful.
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2017 Ried Klostersatz Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine's pear and yeast notes get an extra boost of ripeness from Mirabelle plum aromas. The palate is juicy, with a savory edge of yeast and a lovely hint of salt. It's slender in body yet conentrated, with a sassy, spicy finish.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2017 Franciscus Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Yeasty creaminess plays on the nose of this wine while leafy, herbal overtones create allure. The palate wraps this all into a concentrated, fresh, taut bundle of savoriness and lemon freshness. It has verve, drive and a wonderfully yeasty, peppery finish.
Name: Loimer 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe, aromatic pear notes are lifted by lime zest scents on the nose of this wine. The palate brings both juicy, tart pear fruit and a wonderfully herbal, sage-like edge. The finish is mouthwatering, juicy and moreish.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2017 Ried Superin Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A touch of reduction still clouds the ripe but tart red apple notes on the nose of this wine. With a little air, the fruit becomes more expressive, crescendoing into a savory core of yeast, flint, salty soy and sage. The finish brims with ripe lemon.
Name: Bründlmayer 2017 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's fern, soy and fresh yeast aromas promise an interesting palate. The palate continues in this fresh, savory fashion, adding bright lemon notes for freshness and poise. A slender, spicy, subtle wine.
Name: Forstreiter 2017 Kremser Kogl Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Soy, sage and miso scents show their savoriness on the nose of this wine. On the palate, they're joined by ripe pear and a lovely core of bright lemon freshness. A streamlined, spicy and utterly moreish Grüner Veltliner with lasting appeal.
Name: Schlosskellerei Gobelsburg 2017 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's wonderfully tart and leafy notions of green pear and green citrus zest make for an intriguing nose. The palate focuses on the zestiness, adding a little yeasty pepper spice. It's intense, taut, spicy and very refreshing, with a savory, enduring finish.
Name: Hager Matthias 2017 Mollands Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's shy nose offers mere hints of salty yeast. On the palate, the saltiness becomes more pronounced and is joined by white pepper and fresh lemon brightness. Ripe pear notes round it all out and let the pepperiness tingle on the finish.
Name: Hiedler 2017 Ried Thal Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Yeast and reduction give this wine's nose a raw but promising character. Yeast notes also envelop the palate, where ripe pear and bright lemon flavors add verve, roundness and freshness. A salty edge of soy emerges on the long, lemony finish.
Name: Hirsch 2017 Kammern Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's shy nose gives very little away, but the palate offers subtle Conference pear notes, made more precise by lovely lemon brightness. A touch of yeast lends texture. The finish is wonderfully lip-smacking.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Peardrop aromas dominate the nose of this wine, but a lovely, creamy fresh yeast aspect and bright lemon notes join in on the taut, slender and graceful body. It's lithe but full-flavored, hinting at fern, moss, green pear and lemon on the long finish.
Name: Markus Huber 2017 Obere Steigen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: This wine's shy nose favors savoriness over fruit with its hints of miso and soy. Riper fruit emerges as it airs, yielding two poles: white pepper and yeast on the one hand and rounded, aromatic pear on the other. The body remains slender and fresh yet concentrated.
Name: Nigl 2017 Piri Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A light hint of sage plays above pear peel notes on the nose of this wine. On the palate, a fresh streak of lemon unites rounded pear fruit and lovely herbal savor. It's fresh, concentrated and vivid, with a lovely long aftertaste.
Name: Georg Frischengruber 2017 Ried Kirnberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Russet pear peel scents are joined by zesty grapefruit notes on the nose of this wine. The same duo appears on the palate, made juicier by ripe pear notioins. It's hedonistic and serious at the same time, with a lovely, concentrated, dry finish.
Name: Geyerhof 2017 Hoher Rain Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's bright, citrusy nose has green pear, fern and white pepper nuances. The palate keeps that citric tone and adds a wonderful dose of tingling white pepper. It's lively, savory and lip-smacking.
Name: Hermann Moser 2017 Karmeliterberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Beautifully ripe pear aromas are enhanced by a rich creaminess on the nose of this wine. The palate is equally creamy, with a lovely yeasty dimension that brings out the pear flavor and bright, refreshing citrus. It's concentrated, taut and long.
Name: Weinrieder 2017 Ried Schneiderberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The faint notion of sage and moss on the nose of this wine turns into expansive, yeasty freshness on the palate. It's slender but mouthfilling, emphasizing texture over fruit. The finish shows lemony freshess.
Name: Weszeli 2017 Steingarten Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A slightly herbal note of sage accompanies this wine's lemon and green pear aromas. The slender, dry and vivid palate continues this bright lemon freshness. It echoes with yeast, miso, white pepper and that beautifully savory sage. An expressive, delicious and moreish Grüner Veltliner.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2017 Der Ott Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: This leads with sage, pear and white pepper hints. The palate flows with lightness and ease, but underneath it all is a core of pepper, herb and yeast. The flavors are long and subtle; the finish is dry and lasting.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2017 Fass 4 Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Creamy yeast and green pear notes dominate the aromatic nose of this wine. The palate continues with this fresh green but also balmy theme, adding lemon and juicy pear highlights. It's slender and sleek in body, concentrated yet creamy. A lovely, subtle wine with a delicious, lemony finish.
Name: Brandl 2017 Zöbing Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's closed nose reveals just a little hint of lemon for now. The palate is far more fluid, presenting juicy green pear flavors with intensely zesty lemon notes and subtle fern and moss suggestions. It's taut, slender and moreish, with a zesty, herbal finish.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2017 Liebenberg Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine's closed nose reveals just a little hint of lemon for now. The palate is far more fluid, presenting juicy green pear flavors with intensely zesty lemon notes and subtle fern and moss suggestions. It's taut, slender and moreish, with a zesty, herbal finish.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2017 Liebenberg Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine's nose as of now gives only gentle hints of yeast and red apple. The palate, however, brims with gloriously ripe but tart apple and lemon notes. It's fresh, concentrated, lip-smacking and driven.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2017 Loibner Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine's ripe pear and fresh yeast aromas have an almost green apple-like freshness. The taut, fruit-driven and lemony palate brims with fresh citrus notes. The finish is dry and refreshing.
Name: Geyerhof 2017 Rosensteig Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Aromatic notions of Williams pear stream from the glass. That same ripe fruitiness continues on the palate, where hints of yeast and lemon zest create a lovely texture. This is ripe but taut, fruity but layered—and simply lovely.
Name: Geyerhof 2017 Stockwerk Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's ripe, juicy green pear flesh and freshly cut russet pear peel scents are united in creaminess. On the palate, a salty, savory yeast element takes over the fruit notes, lending both flavor and texture. A beautifully weighty, rounded but fresh Grüner Veltliner.
Name: Weixelbaum 2017 Wechselberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Russet pear peel and heady yeast notes have quite an impact on the nose of this wine. Both pear and yeast notes create texture and flavor on the bright, fresh and concentrated palate. There's a shimmer of soy, cream and white pepper in the background.
Name: Winzer Krems 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's fern, white pepper, sage and pear aromas follow through to the pristine, taut palate that's textured with zesty grapefruit. It has a core of juicy pear fruit and a gloriously lip-smacking, lemony finish.
Name: Türk 2017 Kremser Weinberge Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This needs a lot of air before its shy, almost-closed nose offers up ripe red apple aromas. On the palate, concentrated, fresh apple and lemon strike. It's edged with white pepper, sage and fern notes, and a lovely fillip of zestiness marks the finish.
Name: Weszeli 2017 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's shy, closed nose leads to a subtle palate filled with Conference pear, lemon and creamy yeast touches. It's light bodied but concentrated, and a lovely dash of white pepper spices up the finish.
Name: Hermann Moser 2017 Gebling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Fern, pear peel and moss aromas create wonderfully green freshness on the nose of this wine. The palate adds subtle ripe pear notes packed in a slender, concentrated body that shimmers with white pepper zestiness.
Name: Berger 2017 Lössterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: An unusually floral hint precedes this wine's pear and cream aromas. The palate remains light and fresh, with a sonorous backdrop of yeasty texture. Bright lemon notes follow through to the dry finish.
Name: Hermann Moser 2017 Per Due Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's ripe pear fruit and leesy yeastiness make it seem like a raw tank sample. On the palate, the yeastiness expresses itself as savory texture, framing fresh lemon notes and peppery highlights. The finish is dry and long.
Name: Hirsch 2017 Hirschvergnügen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's ripe and green pear scents continue their gently-fruited game on the light, easy and dry palate. Pear fruit sets the tone all the way, with a little assistance from lemony brightness. Slender and fresh, it lingers long.
Name: Anton Bauer 2017 Ried Gmirk Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Shy on the nose, this wine opens into beautifully ripe, aromatic pear notes on the palate. It's slender in body, with a juicy and fresh nature resulting from a lovely streak of lemon at its core. The finish is refreshing and dry.
Name: Georg Frischengruber 2017 Ried Steiger Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The crushed sage and lemon notes that mark the nose of this wine attain a far riper aspect on the palate. Yellow Mirabelle plum flavors fill the mouth, rounded by yeasty richness and framed by lemon freshness.
Name: Hiedler 2017 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's ripe green pear, yeast, miso and arugula notes on the nose reappear on the light but aromatic palate. Subtle hints of yeast and salt accent its gentle pear fruit. It's light bodied and dry, with a totally refreshing finish.
Name: Anton Bauer 2017 Ried Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Green pear, sage and miso touches on the nose of this wine carry seamlessly over to the wonderfully expressive, textured palate. There's lemony brightness but also a midpalate core of yeast and salty savoriness. What a lovely Grüner Veltliner: dry, light but oh so expressive.
Name: Hiedler 2017 Löss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's nose offers a subtle hint of moss but nothing more. On the palate, yeasty, salty flavors appear alongside some pithy citrus zest notes. It's taut, textured and fresh, with a lovely dry finish.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2017 Wieden Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Grapefruit peel and yeast notes mingle with fresh Conference pear on the nose of this wine. The palate takes all this fruit and adds a salty savoriness reminiscent of white pepper and soy sauce. The finish is full-flavored, long and dry, with refreshing, savory moreishness.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2017 Am Berg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: A touch of reduction still colors the pear and yeast notes on the nose of this wine. The palate is dominated by leesy notes of yeast and the textural backdrop they create, framing some lovely bright lemon notes. That textural pleasure lasts all the way to the refreshing, dry finish.
Name: Mantlerhof 2017 Weitgasse Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A hint of salty yeast accents this wine's freshly cut russet pear aromas. The palate comes in with ripe, round pear flavors that swish beautifully around the salty yeast notes. Firm freshness keeps everything toned through the dry finish.
Name: Proidl 2017 Ried Hausberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's subtle but aromatic note of cut Conference pear makes for a fresh nose. The palate is full of riper yellow pear fruit. It's easy and juicy, with a lip-smacking, zesty, dry finish.
Name: Esterházy 2017 Estoras Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Yeasty scents accent this wine's lovely, bright lemon-like tanginess. The lovely lemon streak also comes through on the easy, light but beautifully textured palate. The finish is juicy and dry.
Name: Weinrieder 2017 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Miso notes mingle with ripe Conference pear scents on the nose of this wine. The palate adds a yeasty texture and lively lemon flavors, making it a very expressive, dry and totally refreshing Grüner Veltliner.
Name: Leth 2017 Ried Steinagrund Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: This wine's ripe Conference pear aromas get their full billing on the juicy, pear-flavored and wonderfully fresh palate. Lemony zestiness tingles along, with a little white pepper-like spice. The finish is lip-smacking, fresh and dry.
Name: Josef Bauer 2017 Katharina Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: This wine's ripe, juicy pear and fresh lemon scents create an appetizing nose. The palate is equally juicy, with more pear and tart lemon notes. It's easy, light, dry and totally refreshing.
Name: Brandl 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe, juicy, yellow pear aromas emerge on the nose of this wine. The palate follows with lighter, brighter juiciness, making it a light, easy, summery sipper.
Name: Aigner 2017 Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The nose of this wine offers ripe russet pear and a touch of zesty grapefruit. That zestiness continues on the slender, light, dry palate, where a bit of yeast makes for a lovely, savory texture.
Name: Martinshof 2017 Veltliner Friends Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A beautifully green touch of leaves and herbs gives the nose of this wine a creamy aspect. The palate is light, pear-scented and savory. A lovely, subtle, spicy summer white with a dry finish.
Name: The Dot 2017 Austrian Pepper Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of Anjou pear, wet cement, red apple and scratched guava skin show on the nose of this bottling. Rounded flavors of ripe pear and mandarin orange are framed by strong acidity and a chalky texture that goes deep into the finish.
Name: Zocker 2016 Paragon Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Edna Valley)

Description: This wine's yeast, miso and pear peel aromas create a lovely nose. The same pleasure can be found on the subtle, gently spiced palate, where this savoriness figures just as much as ripe pear fruit. It's light, dry and full of flavor.
Name: Diwald 2017 Grossriedenthaler Löss Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: This wine's savory touch of Irish moss and citrus foliage creates a refreshing and lifted nose. The palate continues in this fresh, light-bodied and citrusy vein and presents a lovely, light and savory summer wine for immediate pleasure.
Name: Esterházy 2017 Classic Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: A touch of juicy, yellow plum adds its ripe notions to this wine's savory nose of sage and pear. The palate is mellow but fresh, with a lovely, zesty hint of bright citrus and a tiny bit of residual spritz. Very lively and refreshing.
Name: Hiller 2017 Simone I Wine & Queen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's pear peel and yeast aromas open into lemony juiciness on the light, dry and easy-drinking palate. A perfectly refreshing summer wine.
Name: Proidl 2017 Freiheit Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The nose of this wine is subdued, but the palate presents a vision of fleshy, generous and ripe pear fruit. Lemony brightness reins these flavors in, leading to a clean, bright, juicy finish.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2017 Hochterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's ripe russet pear peel aromas have a yeasty tang. On the palate, riper aspects of yellow pear join the fray and play against the lovely phenolic texture. The finish is dry and zesty.
Name: The Dot 2017 Austrian Apple Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Both Conference and ripe yellow pear aromas appear on the nose of this wine. On the dry palate, they're met with lemony freshness and that peppery, herbal verve we all look for in Grüner Veltliner. It's dry, fluid and very refreshing.
Name: Josef Bauer 2017 Ried Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: This Grüner Veltliner's aromatic nose suggests arugula, lime and ripe lemon. The palate is juicy and easy, with lots of pear fruit and more fresh lemon. A summer wine par excellence with a refreshing, dry finish.
Name: Biokult 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: This wine's shy nose gives intriguing glimpses of peppery savoriness. The palate is fresh, easy and more fruity than the nose suggests. A lovely, light, dry and very refreshing summer wine with a touch of peppery spice.
Name: Domäne Baumgartner 2017 Batonnage A Musique Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This leads with shy hints of peardrop and lemon. The palate brings those notes out further, adding the merest touch of pepper. It's a light, easy-drinking, fresh and dry wine.
Name: Josef Bauer 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: This wine's fresh nose of green Conference pear leads to riper pear fruit on the palate, tempered by bright lemon accents. It's light, easy and beautifully pear-scented on the dry finish.
Name: Mehofer 2017 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: This wine's shy nose allows glimpses of lemon, which carry over to the easy, juicy, light and flowing palate. This is a fresh, easy summer wine with a dry, clean finish.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A lovely hint of freshly cut russet pear peel on the nose of this wine segues into full-flavored ripe pear on the palate. Juicy, light, dry and fruit-driven.
Name: Winzerkeller Andau 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: The bright, fruity hints of peardrop on the nose of this wine continue in the same easy, fruity vein on the palate. Light bodied and juicy, it's an ideal party or picnic wine.
Name: Weingut Groiss 2017 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: This wine's shy nose leads to a fresh palate with subtle pepperiness and green pear notes. It's dry, easy and just a little textured. Drink soon.
Name: Winzer Krems 2017 Kremser Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A ripe aspect of juicy pear shows on the nose of this wine. The light, dry, refreshing palate has some residual CO2. Drink soon.
Name: Winzer Krems 2017 Von den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The ripe, juicy pear notes on the nose of this wine continue on the appetizingly dry, easy and fresh palate. Lemony verve brings brightness to the ripe fruit. A light, lovely picnic wine.
Name: Weingut Groiss 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Description: This wine's fresh, lifted citrus aroma has a touch of lime. The palate is also totally bright with lemony freshness and summery ease. This is one for the picnic basket. Drink soon.
Name: Golser Wein 2017 Una Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: There is a faint touch of lemon on the nose of this wine. The neutral palate also shows off some lemony brightness and finishes clean and dry.
Name: Etz Wein KG 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's faint Conference pear scents follow through to the palate, where they are joined by bright, lemony freshness. It's easy, light and dry but utterly fresh and vivid. Drink soon.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Description: This wine's ripe pear and dried sage overtones continue on the easy, dry and fluid palate. The body is light and fresh; the finish is clean and refreshing.
Name: Winzer Krems 2017 Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose of this wine brims with cool-ferment peardrop notes. The palate follows with lemony freshness and a dry, easy-drinking style. It is made for uncomplicated but lasting refreshment.
Name: Forstreiter 2017 Grooner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose of this wine is restrained and has the faintest notes of reduction and yeast. The palate is light, with light lemon notes and easygoing, reviving freshness. The dry finish is wonderfully clean. Drink soon.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2017 Kies Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's very faint nose gives the merest hint of lemon. The palate is slightly dilute but therefore very light and easy. The finish is dry and clean.
Name: Martinshof 2017 Zum Martin Sepp Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This carries a whiff and a taste of sweet honeycomb and oak-softened caramel apple flavors. It's somewhat atypical for Oregon Grüner Veltliner, but it works well in its own way.
Name: Viento 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: A touch of ripe mirabelle plum has fern and lemon freshness on the nose. On the palate there is a miso-like yeasty undertone, adding a counterweight to the freshness. It's a very balanced, fresh but textured wine.
Name: Stadt Krems 2017 Ried Weinzierlberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Yeast, miso and green pear make for an appetizing nose. The evident spritz on the palate makes these flavors pop even more in the mouth where lemon freshness and white pepper frame the lovely pear fruit. This is slender, dry but very expressive.
Name: Schlosskellerei Gobelsburg 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Savory yeast and white pepper inform the pear and lemon notes on the nose. They carry through on the palate where their fluid unity, helped along the very slender dry palate by bright lemon freshness is most enticing. A rollicking, if light little wine with a lip-smacking finish.
Name: Nigl 2017 Freiheit Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A touch of ripe yellow plum mingles with the savory sage and yeast notes of the nose. These become more intense on the palate where they are joint by fresh gentle yellow-apple notes. Yeast and fruit seem to boost each other but a peppery savoriness wins in the end.
Name: Familie Zull 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Subtle notes of green and yellow pear appear on the nose. They are joined by a tangy lick of tart citrus and spicy white pepper on the light, dry but utterly moreish palate. This is zippy, appetizing and totally moreish.
Name: Sohm & Kracher 2017 Lion Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Aromatic citrus foliage on the nose turns into fuller-fruited tangerine on the palate. There is a yeasty edge of savoriness, too, all streamlined by lemon and lime zestiness. A friendly, if light wine with a very appetizing dry finish.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2017 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A slightly reduced nose leads onto a slender palate which has a concentrated vein of salty yeasty miso-like savoriness. Bright lemon freshness creates bite and nuance and turns this into a light but streamlined, exciting little number. Moreish with a lovely salty finish.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2017 Stein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Very appetizing, immediate notes of both fresh green and ripe juicy yellow pear make for an aromatic opening. They follow through on the light dry palate where a sage-tinged savoriness is joined by bright lemon. It is ideal aperitif material with its refreshing mouthwatering lightness.
Name: Weingut Frank 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Ripe pear and green moss notes combine on the nose. The very light palate has a salty miso-like backdrop of yeasty richness, cut by lemon freshness. This is dry, honest, refreshing and moreish.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2017 Haid Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Ripe pear has a lovely white miso savoriness about it on the nose. The palate, on the other hand, is far more fruity than savory. The pear fruit is edged by bright lemon on the light dry palate but on the finish that lovely miso tang reappears.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2017 Furth Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: An earthy touch blends in with very juicy pear notes on the nose. The palate counters this with ample vivid freshness that seems to unite white pepper, lime zest and green pear—a streamlined, slender but very refreshing proposition.
Name: Jäger 2017 Rid Klaus Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: And earthy hint of wet moss glosses over the pear fruit on the nose. On the light palate, a palpable spritz adds freshness while lemon notes reveal creamy plum notes: very refreshing.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2017 Zeisen Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Slight reduction on the nose gives way to very refreshing palate. Zesty citrus holds as much sway as green-pear peel and flesh. There is a slightly earthy salty edge to the dry fresh finish.
Name: Setzer 2017 Ausstich Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: An earthy herbal note of moss and fern plays amidst the lemon and pear on nose and palate. The body is light, dry, easy and fresh. But that lovely herbal tang comes back on the refreshing finish.
Name: Soellner 2017 Toni Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Fresh juicy notes of green pear rise immediately. The palate adds a zesty element as well as herbal savor of sage. This is flavorsome, light-bodied, tangy and very refreshing with just a little bit of spritz to make it even more zingy.
Name: Soellner 2017 Wogenrain Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Yeast, citrus pith and green pear all appear on the nose. They appear even more joyfully on the expressive lively palate where a little white pepper joins them. This is slender, dry and very refreshing with its sassy savory finish.
Name: Steininger 2017 Grünschnabel Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Slight hints of moss and green pear on the nose intensify on the light but full-flavored, dry palate. Yeasty, miso-savory hints give a backdrop to lemon freshness and provide lovely texture.
Name: Artner 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Sage, yeast, moss and fern all appear on the savory nose. They re-appear with peppery subtlety on the light dry palate. This is archetypal, refreshing, easy Grüner with lots of flavor.
Name: Der Pollerhof 2017 Frau Meyer Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A salty touch of yeast appears briefly on the nose before green-pear notes take over. That salty pepperiness appears again fleetingly and teasingly on the very light, dry fresh palate, dominated by green-pear notes.
Name: Domäne Gobelsburg 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A touch of yeast colors the sage and moss hints on the nose before lemon and green pear take over. It is lemon and pear that also play on the dry light palate. This is very refreshing, light and animating.
Name: H.& C. Nittnaus 2017 Heideboden Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Both ripe yellow pear and wet earthiness appear on the nose and morph into a very salty soy and miso-like savoriness on the light but fluid, almost soft palate. The dry finish has both pear and a touch of pepper.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2017 Johann Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Green pear and zesty lemon make for a very refreshing nose. This zippy style carries right through on the slender light palate where a little spritz keeps everything lively. A touch of white pepper fizzes on the dry finish.
Name: Ruttenstock 2017 Ried Reipersberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Notions of ripe juicy pear and yellow plum characterize the nose. The palate also displays a certain juicy lightness. This is up front, all about fruit and ease, with just a little pepper on the dry finish.
Name: Winzer Krems 2016 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Crushed fern and sage, lemon and ripe pear make for an intriguing nose. The palate is juicy, guided on the slender light body by bright lemon freshness. The green savory note reappears on the dry finish.
Name: Wieninger 2017 Wiener Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: A creamy, green freshness on the nose is reminiscent of lemon, aloe vera balm and greengage. The palate is light, and has that same gentle but greenish freshness. This is light, smooth, dry and very refreshing.
Name: Markus Huber 2017 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Crushed sage and grass, green pear and lemon entice the nose. They follow though on the juicy but light palate where an earthy element gives a mellow backdrop to the savory flavors. Pear fruit reasserts itself on the dry finish.
Name: Setzer 2017 Vesper Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A floral leafy fragrant freshness hovers above the green-pear notes on the nose. The palate ropes in this aromatic juiciness and adds a peppery verve on its light, easy-drinking but very refreshing body. The finish is dry and moreish.
Name: Dürnberg 2017 Falkenstein Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A touch of fern appears among the pear and lemon notes of the nose. This tangy medley of flavors continues through on the tangy, refreshing and wonderfully light palate. Lots of bang for such a slender dry wine. It is an ideal aperitif or summer party wine.
Name: Familie Zull 2017 Lust & Laune Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Something earthy on the nose grounds the yellow pear notes. On the palate this earthy element has a phenolic pithy touch, adding interest to the very light and dry but fresh body.
Name: Jäger 2017 Vorder Seiber Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Lemon zest and green pear on the nose continue right through onto the light, fresh zippy palate where some pepper gives extra verve to the lemon notes. The finish is dry and refreshing.
Name: Rabl 2017 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe pear notes are met with savory yeasty richness on the nose. The dry zippy palate has that same salty tang and a whiff of pepper. This is juicy refreshing down-to-earth honest Grüner—a joy.
Name: Ruttenstock 2017 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Tender notes of Conference pear on the nose have the slightest touch of lemon zest. On the palate much more fruit becomes apparent. Green and yellow pear, juicy apple and ripe lemon all make an appearance. The result is a soft, fruity, dry and light wine.
Name: Müller-Grossmann 2017 Grosser Satz Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Some reduction plays on the nose. The palate comes in with gentle freshness, ease and absolute lightness. This is dry, fresh and has a lovely citrus tanginess on the finish.
Name: Jäger 2017 Selection Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Both green-pear and white-pepper notes appear on the nose. On the palate, subtle pepperiness wins out. The body is light, dry and refreshing.
Name: Steininger 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A very slight but rather refreshing note of green pear appears on the nose. On the palate this is amplified with more intense notes of Conference pear, guided by lemon freshness to a dry moreish finish.
Name: Der Pollerhof 2017 Galgenberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose only reveals the merest touch of fresh Conference pear peel but the palate fleshes out the green-pear fruit and adds a lovely zesty lemon tang to it. The body is slender and fluid, light and dry.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2017 Terrassen Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The nose gives a mere glimpse of citrus freshness. The palate gives a fuller but still subtle picture with hints of green pear, sage and lemon. This is light, fresh and comes with a dry finish.
Name: Buchegger 2017 Holzgasse Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A creamy touch joins the green-pear notes on the nose. A touch of fern, lemon and yeast come into the equation on the slender but fruitily fresh palate. This makes for a very light, dry but refreshing aperitif.
Name: Markus Huber 2017 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose is shy but allows some glimpses of lemon and pear. The palate is very light, dry and easy, showing hints of salty yeast and bright fresh lemon.
Name: Rabl 2017 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe yellow pear on the nose is also apparent on the very easy light juicy palate. The slightly dilute palate benefits from tangy citrus on the dry finish.
Name: Stadt Krems 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Wet pebble and green moss waft past the nose and continue on the light but very citrus-driven palate. Bright lemon accentuates the lightness even more and makes the dry finish wonderfully fresh.
Name: Zantho 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: The pear and stone fruit on the nose almost have floral hints. The palate also has an unusual tang of passion fruit. The finish is dry, vivid and fresh.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2017 vom Haus Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Lemon, fresh green pear and pear drop on the nose signal freshness and ease. The light dry body comes with a little spritz and zingy savory peppery freshness. This is archetypal easy Grüner for a crowd.
Name: Ruttenstock 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose has both a tangy and a creamy aspect and both are equally enticing. On the light easy palate, gentle pear fruit is supported by bright lemony freshness. The finish is dry and tangy.
Name: Allram 2017 Strass Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Aromatic green and fresh yellow pear combine to very appetizing effect on the nose. The palate is less overt in fruit but brings bright zesty citrus to the fore. This is refreshing, light, slender and dry.
Name: Weixelbaum 2017 Stephanus Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose is rather closed but the palate gives glimpses of a soft lemon freshness on a light fluid body. This is easy and fresh. It is on the finish that more lemon and some salty yeast become apparent.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2017 Messwein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Ripe yellow pear makes for an appetizing nose. The palate has the same friendly fruit, with a little more green-pear freshness. It is light, dry and easy.
Name: Bründlmayer 2017 L&T Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
