Description: Hints of lemon zest and moss on the nose signal appetizing freshness. On the light palate, this freshness is helped along by a bit of spritz and more zestiness and a hint of yeasty pepperiness—very moreish.
Name: Netzl 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Lemon and green pear make a very slight appearance on the almost neutral nose. On the light palate, their image is clearer and refreshing with a hint of Grüner's herbal tang before ending in a zesty finish.
Name: Dürnberg 2017 L&T Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A whiff of passion fruit flickers across the mind before ripe pear takes over. The very light palate is equally fruit driven with a gentle, ripe freshness across the very light dry palate.
Name: Landhaus Mayer 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Notes of juicy green pear characterize the nose. The palate is less defined when it comes to fruit but is easy, fluid, fresh and very light. This is almost translucent in flavor and has a dry finish.
Name: Loimer 2017 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A riper hint, almost a touch of apricot, joins the pear fruit on the nose. The palate is just as fruit-driven, again in that lemony fresh apricot way, with a slight creaminess. The body is light and dry.
Name: Meinklang 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Exuberant pear drop dominates the nose. The palate adds lovely zesty lemon notes on a rather slender, light, dry and easy body. The finish reveals some savory yeastiness.
Name: Nastl 2017 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Ripe yellow pear on the nose is also apparent on the very easy light juicy palate. The slightly dilute palate benefits from tangy citrus on the dry finish.
Name: Schwarzböck 2017 Bisamberg-Kreuzenstein Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Green apple and pear drop on the nose reappear on the juicy easy-drinking palate, which has just a slight edge of sage savoriness. The finish is dry and refreshing.
Name: Winzer Krems 2017 Kellermeister Privat Kremser Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Slightly muddied lemon and pear notes on the nose lead to a fresh easy light palate. They are joined by that characteristic whiff of white pepper and a savory edge of sage. The finish is totally refreshing.
Name: Dürnberg 2017 Getränk Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Description: Juicy yellow-pear notes dominate the nose. The light dry palate has lemon freshness and the merest touch of sage.
Name: Höpler 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Subtle notes of ripe yellow pear on the nose are toned down by lemon freshness on the light easy-drinking dry palate. Lots of verve and juiciness make for an ideal aperitif or party wine.
Name: Hugl-Wimmer 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Slightly muddied notes of pear appear on the nose. On the dry light palate it is lemon that takes over and adds welcome verve and liveliness. Very refreshing and easy with a dry finish.
Name: Hugl-Wimmer 2017 Wimmer Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A mere whiff of tender lemon freshness appears on the nose. The slender easy palate also benefits from that lemon freshness on its dry finish.
Name: Adolf & Heinrich Fuchs 2017 Skeleton Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Notes of yellow pear have a touch of juicy ripeness on the nose. The palate adds an earthy element but also lots of freshness. The finish is clean and dry.
Name: Gruber Röschitz 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Some reduction clouds the pear fruit on the nose. The palate is light and dry but lacks focus and drive. A little lemon freshness colors the finish.
Name: Markowitsch 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Green pear and lemon have something high toned on the nose but soon calm down on the light easy palate. This is dry, easy, warming but fresh.
Name: Weingut Christ 2017 Bruch Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Lemon, pear and pepper are merely hinted at on the almost neutral nose. On the palate, a creamy aspect takes the shine off the freshness and muddies the fruit a little, but the finish is dry and fresh.
Name: Rabl 2016 Käferberg Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: One of the few bottlings of this variety in the state, this brings spicy herb, white peach, citrus rind and white pepper aromas. The flavors are light, sleek and acid-driven, with a drawn-out finish. It provides a lot of appeal and versatility at the table.
Name: W.T. Vintners 2017 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Kramer's Celebrate series features non-traditional sparkling wine grapes that are carbonated in tank rather than re-fermented in the bottle. The Grüner Veltliner is the best of them; it captures the grape's peppery character in a bracing, bone-dry sparkler, with cucumber, lime and melon highlights.
Name: Kramer 2016 Celebrate Grüner Veltliner (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This variety is an extreme rarity in the state, with only a handful of bottlings produced each year. Light aromas of herb and citrus lead to thick feeling apple flavors boosted by lively acidity.
Name: Cerulean 2016 Acadia Vineyards Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of cut green apple, lentil, pear and spice are followed by mild fruit flavors on the palate. Enjoy for its easy appeal.
Name: Snowbirds 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This estate features biodynamically grown fruit and artisanal winemaking practices. This wine is tart and focused in snappy lemon, orange and pineapple flavors.
Name: Johan 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Compared to the 2015 vintage which retained its liveliness, this new vintage seems woody and oxidized. It's a natural wine, and those can sometimes thrill tasters willing to stretch out a bit. Here, it's soft and slightly flat, with flavors of mashed fruits. Drink up.
Name: Minimus 2016 Vitae Springs Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Willamette Valley)

Description: This wine's shy, elusive nose promises hints of ripe citrus and herbal savor. The palate obliges with streamlined, zesty citrus notes and the salty tang of thyme and sage, surrounded by bright lemon freshness. A compact, incisive package of refreshing delight, it dances on tiptoe but knows its every step.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2016 Rotes Tor Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine's pure, ripe Conference pear notes appear on the nose and are given full rein on the palate. They add color and charm to concentrated, savory notions of celery salt and miso. Bright citrus accents make it taut and fresh, depsite that immense concentration. It echoes long on the finish, promising to unfold beautifully with more age. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2016 Honivogl Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Green pear and lemon zest characterize the nose of this concentrated, salty wine. Zesty citrus notes give both texture and direction on the taut palate, which shimmers with savory, yeasty, miso-like saltiness. A very delicious, impactful little package that is sure to unfold beautifully. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2016 Ried Loibenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A tropical touch of passion fruit plays on the pear-inflected nose of this wine. The concentrated palate, however, is all about lemon freshness and yeasty texture. Soy and miso notions add a salty element while lemon zest and pith notes provide a precise texture. That lemon peel quality dominates with its purity on the long finish. Lovely and compact but very concentrated.
Name: Alzinger 2016 Ried Steinertal Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Juicy, ripe pear notions and bright Mandarin accents swirl enticingly on the nose of this wine. They dominate the streamlined, brisk palate for now, but underneath, the savory, herbal and intriguing saltiness of Grüner Veltliner shimmers. Along with sage, thyme and miso flavors, they make their full, satisfying appearance on the dry finish. This has both charm and depth. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: F X Pichler 2016 Ried Steinertal Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Freshly cut green Conference pear notes hover above more elusive crushed wild thyme aromas in this wine. There is a touch of wet pebble, too. The palate is concentrated but streamlined. An earthy hue of textured miso adds a little richness to the otherwise zesty, lemony, fresh and enduring flavors. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2016 Ried Kellerberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This leads with a ripe, tropical whiff of pineapple that's subsumed into a more savory notion of celery-salt and miso. The concentrated palate similarly juxtaposes salty miso with bright lemon notes. In the end, the saltiness triumphs and leaves you wanting more. A compact but very concentrated wine that's full of flavor and has a lip-smacking finish.
Name: F X Pichler 2016 M Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Pristine, aromatic Mandarin notes color the underlying notions of green and yellow pear in this wine. The palate has that same aromatic Mandarin ripeness, along with textured, concentrated yeast flavors that shimmer with soy saltiness on the palate. The body is taut and streamlined; it promises to be very long-lived. Citrus aromas tingle long into the finish.Drink 2019–2030.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2016 Ried Kellerberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A note of flinty reduction still clings to the pear and yeast notes on the nose of this wine. Apart from citrus zest, the palate almost dispenses with fruit, delivering instead a celery-salted, yeasty, tingling texture. It crackles on the tongue with its freshness and savor and leaves an immensely fresh, long aftertaste. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: F X Pichler 2016 Ried Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine's unlikely combination of passion fruit, wild thyme, lemon zest and fennel seed aromas is totally convincing. On the palate, that same richness is even more apparent. Savory herb and salt notes seem counter a richer, oilier citrus aspect, making for high drama and lots of flavor. Sip, sit back and savor the long, citrus-inflected finish.
Name: F X Pichler 2016 Ried Liebenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine's fresh green apple notes vie with green Conference pear scents while a flinty touch of reduction promises longevity. The palate shimmers with miso, sage and bright, pure lemon notes, which emphasize darker tones of savory yeast. The combination is totally moreish and effective.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2016 Ried Schenkenbichl Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's ripe, yellow pear aromas have a savory touch of miso. On the palate, a pleasantly bitter note of citrus pith takes over, adding freshness and texture to complement the savory flavors that give it so much intrigue. It would be simply impossible to not take another sip. The finish is clean, taut and moreish.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2016 Ried Höhereck Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine's pure notes of ripe green pear send enticing signals. The palate adds zesty lemon and floral woodruff touches, creating a green cloud of aroma that fills nose and palate. It's slender and taut in body, its salty midpalate texture beautifully pervaded by citrus brightness. The finish is moreish and totally lip-smacking.
Name: Alzinger 2016 Ried Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The pear fruit on the nose of this wine is so heady and pristine it almost comes across as candied. It continues on the palate, where it's joined by a fluid and creamy texture, with hints of citrus pith and salt. An intriguing, elegant and taut package. The finish is long and recalls pure lemon zest.
Name: Eder 2016 Raubern Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A touch of yeasty savor appears on the subdued nose of this wine. On the palate, everything seems elevated and poised: there is concentration and texture as well as creamy lemon freshness, deeply savory yeast notes and a salty, herbal tang. This is little pleasure bomb waiting to unfold. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Eichinger 2016 Ried Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A ripe, tropical pineapple vibe adds richness to the more customary fruit notes of pear in this wine. The palate broadens into rich, savory miso flavors and leesy texture before being countered by lively, pervading lemon freshness. A big, dramatic wine with incisive brightness. Drink 2029–2030.
Name: Fischer 2016 Privat Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A zesty lemon note pervades this wine's lovely Russet pear peel scents. The palate has an equally lithe and elegant feel. The midpalate texture is like taut and delicate lace. Everything is there, but in filigree. The finish is really lip-smacking and fresh.
Name: Markus Huber 2016 Ried Berg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Sun-warmed hay, gentle pear and ripe lemon notes make for a quietly aromatic nose in this wine. That same harmonised touch is also apparent on the almost-creamy palate. Deep, savory citrus pith and hay tones create an understated backdrop for the lovely, gentle fruit. Very elegant from start to finish.
Name: Proidl 2016 Ried Ehrenfels Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine suggests fresh greenery on the nose: sage and fern are the foremost aromas. The palate brims with an intense savoriness recalling miso, salt and soy. It's intense, concentrated and compact and totally designed for the long run. Drink 2019–2030.
Name: Loimer 2016 Ried Käferberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fragrant ripe apricot notions hover above the pear and herb base notes of the nose of this wine. On the concentrated palate, they add smooth fluidity to the yeasty, salty, herb-tinged texture. Pure lemon freshness adds welcome and beautiful brightness, making it slender, precise and utterly delicious.
Name: Eder 2016 Ried Süssenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The appetizing brightness of freshly cut Conference pear engages upon first sniff. The palate then brings a yeasty riff that goes hand-in-hand with luminous lemon flavors, presenting a harmonious balance of lasting savory, creamy and fruity flavors. This shows immense poise and purity.
Name: Eichinger 2016 Ried Gaisberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Freshly cut green and ripe yellow pear notes appear enticingly on the nose of this wine. The palate takes these along and adds zesty citrus brightness and a spicy herbal tang of sage and celery salt. It's taut, fresh, concentrated and muscular, without any fat.
Name: Jäger 2016 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fragrant green notes inform the nose of this wine: there are moss and sage, citrus foliage and fern scents. That herbal richness also plays on the slender, fresh and streamlined palate. Citrus freshness emanates from the textured flavors, softened slightly by salty yeast notes. An impressive, concentrated wine with lots of potential. Drink 2018–2028.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2016 Ried Käferberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's clean, ripe yellow pear notes stream from the glass, accentuated even more by bright, lemony freshness. This fruity combo continues throughout the slender, lithe palate, which reveals intriguing celery salt and fennel seed notes as you slowly savor. It is made all the more precise by fresh, lemon-like acidity. Gorgeous now but sure to develop. Drink 2018–2028.
Name: Malat 2016 Ried Höhlgraben Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Fresh celery and dried fennel seed notes play against a backdrop of pear-fruited freshness on the nose of this wine. These qualities are repeated on the light, translucent and refreshing palate. There is something quite disarming about so much flavor in such a lithe body. Simply lovely.
Name: Bründlmayer 2016 Langenloiser Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A wonderfully ripe notion of yellow pear plays on the nose of this wine. Its bright, friendly fruitiness is also amply apparent on the creamy palate, where it's joined by a savory element of soy, salt and miso. A little citrus pith adds even more texture to this rich, rounded wine.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2016 Hommage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: This wine's soy-scented miso notes create an immensely savory nose. The palate centers on those yeasty textures and flavors, but a citrusy streak of lemon freshness brightens and highlights them. This is concentrated and intense, with lots of aging potential. Drink 2018–2028.
Name: Steininger 2016 Ried Loisium Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The nose of this wine boasts pear, celery salt and herbal spice notes. The palate delivers a savory tingle of white pepper and salty soy but also adds luminous, fresh, ripe lemon zest for an incisive, savory and dramatic package. The finish is lip-smacking and long. Drink 2018–2028.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2016 Bergdistel Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A whiff of passion fruit adds tropical allure to the ripe pear fruit on the nose of this wine. It's tempered by rich yeastiness, which continues on the palate, softening the texture. A spike of lemon freshness brightens everything in this impressive, full-bodied wine.
Name: Hiedler 2016 Ried Schenkenbichl Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's nose is shy at first but opens to reveal a note of salty yeast. The palate unfolds into a creamy but streamlined expression of salt, chervil, lemon zest and pith. It may need some time to mellow, but its wonderfully fresh streak of zesty citrus promises longevity. Drink 2019–2029.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2016 Ried Sauberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The first whiff of this wine, with its concentrated hit of pear peel and citrus pith, spells pleasure. The palate adds a softening, enriching touch of creamy yeast as a backdrop to the rich, fruit-driven flavors: pear, fern, sage and Meyer lemon. The finish is lasting and moreish.
Name: Hiedler 2016 Ried Kittmannsberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's enticingly flinty notes of reduction promise a long life ahead. The concentrated palate presents a characteristic and impressive Grüner Veltliner: ripe pear fruit with salty, lemon-tinged yeast and celery salt and miso nuances. This has layers of sophistication and fun.
Name: Hirsch 2016 Ried Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's shy nose gives very little away, apart from a promise of citrus. The palate evokes layers of salty and tangy miso, brightened by mouthwateringly fresh lemon notes that accentuate the saltiness all the way through the finish. This needs time to unfold. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2016 Von Stein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A creamy whiff of fresh, juicy yellow pear creates a most appetizing nose in this wine. That pure, friendly fruit dominates the palate, illuminating a background of spice and herb notes that recall dried sage and fennel seed. Lemon freshness frames everything and makes for a lovely, full-flavored mouthful.
Name: Stadt Krems 2016 Ried Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The nose of this wine appears as a creamy cloud of green and yellow pear. The palate continues in a similar vein, its fruity, friendly, appetizing fruit congregated around a central spine of bright lemon freshness. A deeper core of savory yeast notes sleeps just beneath the surface; give it time to wake up. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2016 Ried Gottschelle Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's ripe yellow pear notes are joined by riper notions of yellow plum, with a characteristic salty, herbal tang. The concentrated, fresh palate picks up those notes and puts the yeasty soy-like savor to the fore. Salty, dry freshness rings long into the finish.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2016 Ried Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: The sun-ripened yellow pear notes on the nose of this wine still have the faintest touch of flinty reduction. The concentrated salty, yeasty flavors on the palate bring a pithy, lip-smacking note of miso and soy. This is impressive and lasting. Drink 2018–2026.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2016 Ried Stein Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Both pear and citrus pith inform the shy nose of this wine. The palate expresses more of that pithy citrus, adding streaks of bright lemon and the slightest touch of salty yeast. It's concentrated yet taut and utterly refreshing, with an almost cleansing quality.
Name: Buchegger 2016 Ried Vordernberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Hazelnut-like oak notes still dominate the nose of this wine. The palate counters them with friendly mirabelle plum fruit and ample lemon freshness. This needs time to integrate and unfold but has all the necessary balance and stuffing to do just that. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Bründlmayer 2016 Ried Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine has that lovely mix of citrus zest and pith on both the nose and palate. The two vie for attention, giving both freshness and texture. The flavors are highlighted by lemon but also informed by greener, savory hints of ivy, celery and fennel. White pepper makes an intriguing appearance on the dry finish.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2016 Smaragd Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Russet pear peel and citrus pith notes hovers above the savory, yeasty nose of this wine. The palate then gives full rein to wonderully rounded, salty soy notes, which ring with citrus freshness and ripe pear notes through the midpalate. Beautifully balanced, concentrated and very appetizing.
Name: Geyerhof 2016 Ried Gaisberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A creamy, subdued ripe pear aroma is the first impression this wine gives. The palate counters with ample freshness and a wonderfully textured mouthfeel that combines cream, fruit, celery salt and citrus pith notes. All the concentration is cushioned with generous fruit and invigorating freshness.
Name: Josef Bauer 2016 Ried Spiegel Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: A flinty touch of reduction colors the pear and yeast notes on the nose of this wine. The palate shows all the characteristic savory richness of yeast, but here it seems to sparkle with lightness and brisk, lemony freshness, finishing on savory notes of sage and fennel. Although slender, it's full of flavor.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2016 Ried Loiserberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A touch of ripe melon colors the more usual pear notes on the nose of this wine. Here, they're pure and pristine. That same fruity pear perfume characterizes the creamy palate, along with a yeasty texture and pithy citrus richness. A highly elegant, svelte style, with friendly, delicious fruit.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2016 Ried Lindberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A touch of soy, a spark of lemon and friendly ripe pear notes combine on the nose of this wine. That harmonized interplay continues on the concentrated palate, where lemony brightness and yeasty, soy-like richness play off each other to great effect. The finish is taut and refreshing.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2016 Ried Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's fresh, fruity nose is most inviting, recalling freshly cut Conference pear and the lovely tang of miso and yeast. The palate is evenly balanced between yeasty, salty savoriness and the yellow and green pear notes, creating a lively and full-flavored white with a long, dry finish.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2016 Ried Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: A pure streak of freshly cut green pear on the nose promises a bight, lively wine. The palate is indeed bright and slender, dominated by that pure, lithe, lifted pear note. It's fruit-driven but elegant and understated. The finish is both lemon-fresh and smooth.
Name: Buchegger 2016 Ried Moosburgerin Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A youthful aroma of peardrop is foremost on the nose, but on the palate, a zesty, pithy texture takes over. It's accompanied by vivid, lively lemon freshness that keeps it slender and streamlined, ringing with purity and verve. The finish is moreish and lip-smacking.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2016 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Passion fruit-like tropical notes dominate the nose of this wine, but the palate predominantly expresses lemon, herbs and salt. Its citrusy freshness tingles on the textured midpalate, opening into richer soy, miso and preserved lemon notes. The body is taut and fresh and the finish long.
Name: Fischer 2016 Ried Frauenweingärten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A creamy, earthy note joins pear fruit scents on the nose of this wine. The palate bears out the earthy note completely, adding sonorous, textured, yeasty richness. This is countered by lemony freshness, which carries through a fine, long finish.
Name: Malat 2016 Ried Gottschelle Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A shy touch of pear, green apple and passion fruit hovers above the yeasty nose of this wine. On the palate, lemon zest-like freshness takes over and spotlights the textured, savory and salty yeast that fills it out. That pure lemon tone seemingly lasts forever on the moreish finish.
Name: Weixelbaum 2016 Ried Wechselberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Freshly cut yellow pear peel aromas hover above a rich yeasty note on the nose of this wine. The palate counters this with an almost fizzy note of lemon freshness that accentuates both its core of pear fruit and the celery and sage notes of the salty yeast. Very refreshing and moreish.
Name: Loimer 2016 Ried Loiserberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fragrant, ripe apricot scents hover above pear and herb base notes on the nose of this wine. On the concentrated palate, they add smooth fluidity to the yeasty, salty, herb-tinged texture. Pure lemon freshness adds incisive, welcome and beautiful brightness, making this both slender and utterly delicious.
Name: Eder 2016 Ried Süssenberg Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This leads with an impression of yeasty, funky richness. That lovely funkiness then turns to great concentration on the palate as leesy, salty savory notes combine with celery, sage and fern flavors. A pure lemon note is a lovely and fresh accent on the long, salty finish.
Name: Hirsch 2016 Ried Renner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's fresh, green Conference pear notes immediately hit the nose. The slender, dry, streamlined palate adds a streak of fresh, bright lemon. Spicy yeast, celery salt and miso notes appear on the taut, refreshing finish. Lovely.
Name: Nigl 2016 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Utterly fresh hints of green Conference pear play on the nose of this wine. They also dominate the palate at first, before a salty, moreish touch of yeastiness leaves its textured imprint. All is united by bright, lemony freshness that has a savory tang.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Ried Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The perfume of very ripe, yellow pear and the salty tang of miso are equally strong on the nose of this wine. They continue their contrasting play on the palate, where chervil, pepper and soy savoriness takes over. Pithy citrus and a lots of midpalate texture leave a lasting impression.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2016 Goldjoch Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: This wine's fresh, juicy yellow pear-inflected nose has a touch of ripe cantaloupe and an herbal hint of conifer. The palate continues with intriguing notes of fir honey but gives the starring role to ripe pear and fresh apple notes. It's lithe and fresh, always with that heady hint of honey.
Name: Sepp Moser 2016 Ried Schnabel Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's subdued nose just hints at pear and yeast. The palate combines fresh, pure green pear fruit with a slightly textured, sonorous hint of sage and soy-scented yeast. The overall tone is one of wonderfully rich pear fruit.
Name: Steininger 2016 Grand Grü Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's nose is dominated by the scent of freshly cut russet pear but also has a streak of citrus pith. That pithiness makes itself felt on the palate, where it's joined by bright, inviting lemon notes and rich, textured, yeasty savor. A wonderfully concentrated wine with an earthy edge.
Name: Winzer Krems 2016 Kremser Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's intense, creamy, pear-laden nose leads to a textured palate full of yeast and miso-like savoriness. Citrus pith notes and bright lemon freshness only add to the mouthfeel. The finish is lip-smacking and savory.
Name: Felsner 2016 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's abundant yellow pear notes suggest rounded ripeness on the nose. The palate comes in with a creamy, textured mouthfeel and salty, spicy nuances. It's concentrated, round and rich but remains toned and dry. Lovely.
Name: Josef Bauer 2016 Ried Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Soy-like yeastiness takes turns with ripe, yellow pear scents on the nose of this wine. The palate unites these notions, but the rounded, rich and highly textured mouthfeel wins the day. Some bitter pith appears in the background and makes for a lip-smacking finish.
Name: Loimer 2016 Ried Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A slight funkiness accompanies the salty yeast notes on the nose of this wine. The funk disappears on the lithe and elegant palate as wonderfully pure notes of green pear and a moreish lick of sage, ivy, moss and fern combine. A lovely and irresistible flavor combination.
Name: Weszeli 2015 Purus Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Chervil and miso savoriness combine with fresh pear and lemon notes on the nose of this wine, which tingles with white pepper. The palate is rounded and soft but remains juicily slender. There is earthy power here and a deep well of rich fruit that sings with its distinct and beautiful phenolic structure. Drink 2019–2029.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2016 Ried Bürsting Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Celery salt and lemon pith scents set the tone in this wine. The palate follows suit with generous pear fruit that swirls against a savory backdrop of miso and yeast. Lemon pith frames all of this with freshness. The finish centers on gentle pear fruit.
Name: Hermann Moser 2016 Ried Gebling Reserve Fortissimo Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: An earthy element hugs the ripe yellow pear notes on the nose of this wine. It appears again on the concentrated palate, where it's characterized by pithy citrus and miso-like creaminess. The finish has a spike of bright lemon freshness, which gives direction to the lovely, concentrated palate.
Name: Aigner 2016 Ried Obere Sandgrube Privat Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is restrained, giving away just a bit of lemon zestiness before a more herbal touch of celery salt appears. On the surface, the fluid palate is all about easygoing pear fruit, but there is a deeper layer that has yet to wake up. It promises salt and spice—the edges of tingling white pepper are proof.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2016 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's wonderfully pithy, pear-fruited nose hints at once at freshness and depth. The palate honors this with pristine, ripe pear notes and lovely, fragrant lemony depth. Everthing about this brims with pear and Mandarin fruit, concluding in a refreshing citrusy finish.
Name: Nigl 2016 Ried Pellingen Privat Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's combination of ivy leaf and golden pear scents makes for a highly seductive nose. On the palate, bright, ripe lemon takes center stage. It lends an appetizing accent of freshness that complements the yeasty texture of the concentrated midpalate.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Ried Renner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A fresh, tropical whiff of passion fruit clings to the pear notes on the nose of this wine. The palate, on the other hand, is far more savory, with its textured, yeasty mouthfeel and sage and celery salt fragrance. It's soft but full-flavored.
Name: Leth 2016 Ried Scheiben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: An earthy note tones down the lemon brightness on the nose of this wine. On the palate, the roles reverse: lemon brightness stirs up earthy hints of yeast, miso and soy. That citrusy freshness carries it through to a lively, dry and lip-smacking finish.
Name: Eder 2016 Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Friendly ripe yellow pear notes perfume the nose of this wine. That generous fruitiness continues on the rounded, pear-driven and juicy palate. The body is cushioned with all of this fruit but remains streamlined and bright thanks to vivid lemon notes.
Name: Hermann Moser 2016 Ried Gebling Reserve HannaH Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The scent of freshly cut Conference pear peels combines with crisp, green apple notes in this wine. The palate shows the characteristic, yeastiness that shimmers with saltiness, but juicy pear fruit plays the starring role. The finish is totally moreish.
Name: Steininger 2016 Ried Kittmannsberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The merest hint of passion fruit gives this wine's nose a tropical twist. The palate still has some sprightly fizz, combining earthy, soy-like savory texture with pithy citrus notes. It's slender in body and finishes on a dry, refreshing note.
Name: Forstreiter 2016 Schiefer Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Highly appetizing notes of Mirabelle and fresh green pear dominate the nose of this wine. The palate is lithe and slender, with a citrus focus, a yeasty, savory midpalate texture and a moreish, salty finish.
Name: Weixelbaum 2016 Wahre Werte Gaisberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's wonderfully heady citrus pith and pear notes hit the nose. The palate joins with a rounded mouthfeel and more savory flavors; this is all about textured miso and salty sage. A spike of lemon brightness leads to a clean finish.
Name: Geyerhof 2016 Ried Steinleithn Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The smell of freshly peeled ripe golden pears shimmers on the nose of this wine, alongside yeasty richness. The palate puts more stress on the rich, textured seam of yeast, which has a satisfying, sonorous miso note.
Name: Weszeli 2015 Ried Schenkenbichl Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Zesty freshness and lemon brightness characterize the nose and palate of this slender, sinuous wine. Herbal savor tinges the edges while ripe pear fruit comes to the fore. Lovely, lively and wonderfully taut.
Name: Markus Huber 2016 Ried Alte Setzen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Appetizing notes of green and yellow pear and even a touch of yellow plum play on the nose of this wine. The palate has that varietal, textured backdrop, but pear, plum and fresh, ripe lemon notes take center stage. It's concentrated and fruity, with a citrusy finish.
Name: Laurenz V. 2016 Charming Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Very fresh, primary notes of green pear and apple swirl on the nose of this wine. The palate adds a savory element of chervil, celery salt and yeast to this refreshing, moreish package.
Name: Kohl 2016 Kittl Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's fresh, bright and zesty lime and green pear scents have a lovely touch of nettle. The palate has the sprightly ease of these fresh flavors but also a lovely, grounding element of yeast that adds texture.
Name: Schwarzböck 2016 Ried Sätzen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Beautifully pure and aromatic notes of green pear, lemon peel and green spring herbs like tarragon and chervil play on the nose of this wine. The palate shows similar fruity, fresh and lively charm. Very refreshing.
Name: Ruttenstock 2016 Ried Reipersberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Lovely and appetizing notes of green and yellow pear play on the nose of this wine. The palate adds a bright lemon highlight to these aromas, keeping it sprightly but also juicy and ripe. The finish has a lovely lemony tang.
Name: Schwarzböck 2016 Aichleiten Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The nose of this wine gives an immediate breezy, zesty impression before a faint hazelnut note appears. On the palate, fruit is in the foregound. Green apple plays with ripe yellow pear and leaves a lovely, light-footed yet textured mouthfeel with a refreshing finish.
Name: Höpler 2016 Kirchberg Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Salty yeast and bruised apples notes create immediate impact on the nose of this wine. The palate brings savoriness and yeasty texture to the fore; its celery salt and miso flavors are bound up with fresh green apple and pear. A big, bold Grüner Veltliner with ample fruit.
Name: Kohl 2016 Kohloss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's almost glowingly ripe fruit notes stream from the glass: yellow plum, ripe pear and a touch of melon. That immense juiciness is confirmed on the palate and joined by a yeasty, leesy texture and fresh lemon notes. It persists into a fruit-driven, almost bouncy finish.
Name: Hermann Moser 2016 Ried Gebling Reserve Der Löss Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine's subdued nose hints at lemon, pear and yeast. The palate puts those three elements in an almost fizzing but concentrated package, where lemon and green pear notes enwrap a yeasty core. Citrusy freshness is the lasting impression.
Name: Laurenz V. 2016 Friendly Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A very earthy tone recalling bruised apple and yeast dominates the nose of this wine. The creamy, soft and rounded palate combines these fruity and savory elements. Citrus pithiness lends texture to the warming finish.
Name: Weixelbaum 2015 Anno Dazumal Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Description: This wine's yeasty nose tinged with celery salt and lemon zestiness is very appetizing. The palate continues with this very attractive fruity-savory combination, adding a lovely creaminess against which the tangy herbal and lemon notes shine.
Name: Winzer Krems 2016 Edition Chremisa Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A friendly, ripe and appetizing tone of yellow pear dominates the nose and palate of this wine. It's fluid in its flavors, with a yeasty edge that adds some texture and a touch of saltiness that lasts all the way through the finish.
Name: Weingut Frank 2015 Ried Hoher Weg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Crisp Anjou pear, white flowers, lime zest and chalk show on the nose of this bottling. There's a great interplay between the high acid and tannic grip on the sip, where ripe Asian pear and red-apple flavors slide into a squeaky, taut finish.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2016 Rava Blackjack Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Monterey)

Description: A tropical touch of ripe mango hovers on the nose of this wine. The palate also has abundant fruit: ripe citrus with hints of juicy pear, yellow plum and again a notion of mango. This is light-footed yet full-fruited and made for easy drinking.
Name: Ruttenstock 2016 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The scent of very ripe russet pear shows prominently on the nose and continues its pervading, fruity charm on the palate. There's just a touch of yeasty texture and a pithy edge. A very ripe, fruit-driven Grüner Veltliner.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2016 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine's shy nose gives little away. The palate comes in with zesty lemon freshness and just a hint of peppery watercress. A light-bodied, refreshing and easy-drinking wine.
Name: Dürnberg 2016 Tradition Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of sliced ripe red apple and pear are followed by a quite sleek linear bone-dry palate that shows a pleasing sense of balance. It's an intriguing wine, best suited for the dinner table.
Name: Pacific Rim 2016 Spring Creek Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Yakima Valley)

Description: A touch of citrus and herb on the nose points to the varietal character of Grüner Veltliner. The palate confirms this with a yeasty, savory tinge so typical for this variety. Frothing bubbles heighten these sensations on a light, dry and full-flavored body. This wine belongs on the table with food, thanks to its long aftertaste and strong presence.
Name: Steininger 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose is shy, showing just a few herbal hints reminiscent of yarrow. Frothy bubbles, however, pronounce the varietal character of Grüner Veltliner, revealing an appealing textural element as well as herb-tinged pear fruit. Fresh, dry and light on its feet, this would be a lovely apéritif.
Name: Szigeti NV Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Lemon and lemon-balm notes give a fresh impression on the nose. That same green-tinged freshness continues on the light palate, where peppery accents swish around the fizz. This wine is supremely light and refreshing, full of bright lemon notes before finishing dry. It would make an exuberant apéritif with lots of verve.
Name: Schlumberger Wein- und Sektkellerei 2015 Méthode Traditionelle Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Yeasty funk that has notions of quince, lemon and beer makes for an interesting and fruity nose. The palate brings tart and pure red apple, bright lemon and a touch of aromatic stone fruit. The fizz on this pét nat is very tender and subtle, but the purity of fruit and the wonderful texture of the wine make it rather convincing and moreish.
Name: Hager Matthias 2016 Pétillant Naturel Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Description: There are only a few examples of Grüner Veltliner from the state, and this one—from the Columbia Gorge and Terrace Heights—shows the variety's promise at the right site and in the right hands. Its white pepper, citrus and herb scents are followed by broad, dry fruit flavors stitched together with tart acidity that carries them into the finish.
Name: Syncline 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Washington)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Zesty and fresh, this bristling Grüner Veltliner offers pristine tangerine, lime and melon flavors. While delicate in concentration, vibrant acidity and crisp lime pith notes reverberate on the finish. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh lime and lemongrass juxtapose earthier notes of pollen and bees wax in this zingy, light-footed Grüner Veltliner. It's a straightforward yet revitalizing sip to enjoy now through 2019.
Name: Inspire Moore 2016 Rhythm Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Revitalizing freshness abounds in this dry, spry Grüner Veltliner. Pristine tangerine and lemon flavors are briskly concentrated. The finish is marked by a kick of fresh ginger spice.
Name: Hosmer 2016 Estate Grüner Veltliner (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Heady freesia and tangerine zest perfume this fresh, lemony Grüner Veltliner. The palate highlights bright grapefruit and lemon flavors nuanced with pollen and smoked nuts. A brisk, deftly balanced dry white to enjoy now through 2019.
Name: Fulkerson 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh tangerine, green melon and lime abound in this fruit-forward dry white. This shows light-footed refreshment without a lot of complication. The finish is brisk and pristinely citrusy.
Name: Stony Lonesome 2016 Estate Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Steely mineral and brisk grapefruit notes combine in this spry, cutting Grüner Veltliner. It's dry in style, with delicate concentration but loads of refreshment. The finish is touched with nut and earth tones. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Fulkerson 2016 William Vigne Grüner Veltliner (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Initial hints of dust and dried earth on the nose dissipate with aeration to reveal prettier notes of fresh grapefruit and lemon. The dry, full-bodied palate is brisk with citrus flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Heron Hill 2016 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Description: High-toned acidity is adorned by wet-stone mineral flavors. A pungent bouquet of white flower, grapefruit peel and lime are the key scents in this head-turning wine that's deliciously crafted and light on its feet. Waxy apricot and honeydew add a juicy succulence to the crisp finish.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Steiner Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: Aged 18 months in equal parts neutral oak and stainless steel, this wine is made in a bold deliciously compelling style, offering lush components of waxy lemon, pear and peach. Dry and crisp in acidity, it teases in flavors of wildflower and white pepper.
Name: Belden Barns 2015 Estate Grown Grüner Veltliner (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: Despite coiming in at only 12.5% abv, this is fairly weighty. Restrained aromas of crushed stone set the stage, then bold peach and melon flavors take over, finishing with a bit of celery leaf. Drink now.
Name: Forrest 2015 The Doctors' Grüner Veltliner (Marlborough)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is immensely intriguing and unique, with gooseberry, grapefruit skin, wet river stone and the faintest whiff of serrano chili. It's as racy as it can be on the sip, as the bright, fresh and grippy texture reveals flavors of underripe white peach, lime and tons of wet stone.
Name: Zocker 2015 Paragon Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Edna Valley)

Description: This medium-bodied wine features an intriguing blend of stone-fruit and celery-leaf notes. The finish is long and silky, a fascinating textural aspect of this white wine.
Name: Forrest 2014 The Doctors' Grüner Veltliner (Marlborough)

Description: Nelson is well known for its aromatic whites, so it's no surprise that this Maori-owned brand has bottled an attractive Grüner Veltliner from the region. Delicate leafy aromas accent stone fruit, while the medium-bodied wine is zesty, long and elegant, with no hint of bitterness. Drink now.
Name: Kono 2014 Aronui Grüner Veltliner (Nelson)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bursting with ripe apple scents and flavors, this is dry and ready to enjoy. Fermented in a mix of neutral barrel and stainless steel, it starts off sharp and assertive but mellows into pleasing roundness on the midpalate. Drink now and over the next year or two while it's at its freshest.
Name: Chehalem 2016 Ridgecrest Vineyards Grüner Veltliner (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: This wine is broad on the palate and creamy in texture. Bruised apple aromas mar the otherwise delicate melon and peach notes, while it finishes quickly.
Name: Jules Taylor 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Marlborough)

Description: A cloud of otherworldly flavors enters the brain: candied pineapple, vanilla, candied peach, caramel, Mirabelle and a touch of honey. The palate presents viscous sweetness, pierced by fresh acidity that explodes completely. This is a pure, rich and aromatic Eiswein of Austria's flagship variety. Delicious now, it should cellar well through at least 2040.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2015 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: An immensely savory nose immediately hints at an intense wine, with salty miso and tangy, peppery arugula. The palate turns the flavor volume up, with the spicy intensity brightened by lemon freshness and a textured but toned body. A stony saltiness edged with white pepper makes this moreish and irresistible for a lasting, powerful but very authentic Grüner experience.
Name: Geyerhof 2016 Rosensteig Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Aromatic notions of green and yellow pear play on the nose. These get intense on the palate with herbal savor: think arugula and salt, chervil and miso. Intensely savory, the flavors are full but the palate remains fresh and slender. Hints of ripe stone fruit provide fruity, refreshing interludes alonside bright lemon freshness. It conveys wonderful varietal purity and tang.
Name: Geyerhof 2016 Stockwerk Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A spray of white pepper, lemon and green pear plays on the nose. The spicy palate majors in savory, yeasty notes of white pepper, miso, pea shoot and arugula, all brightened by lemon freshness. The slender and balanced palate is chock-full of flavor and leaves a lasting impression to savor.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2016 Stein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: An aromatic touch of ivy plays alongside green pear on the nose. These aromas continue on the palate where they acquire a zesty, fresh edge reminiscent of grapefruit. A note of pepper joins on the slender, dry body. This is aromatic, light and very refreshing, with an invigorating, lip-smacking finish.
Name: Eichinger 2016 Ried Hasel Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The pure scent of freshly cut, ripe, green pear makes for a very appetizing, fruity nose. The palate adds a subtle white-pepper edge to this intense but juicily refreshing pear fruit. Green apple pops up, as well as bright and lively lemon. All this happens on a smooth and rounded body, full of charm but with a serious, savory core.
Name: Anton Bauer 2016 Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Aromatic hints of russet and yellow pear appear first, followed by lemon freshness. The palate holds all of these, accentuating the freshness with a touch of fine spritz. White pepper shimmers around the edges and the slightest phenoloc grip creates a fresh and slender body. This has a light touch but a lastingly clean finish.
Name: F X Pichler 2016 Ried Klostersatz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Spicy notes of miso and yeast appear first on the nose. The palate, full with vivid spritz, amplifies them even more. Bright lemon notes provide freshness, createing a lively, almost warming but still refreshing Grüner that is all about total savoriness, spice and verve.
Name: Fischer 2016 Ried Zanzl Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The nose is still shy but the palate has an almost-fizzing freshness that speaks of a multitude of aromas: green-apple peel, green-pear flesh, a touch of yeast and a salty, savory, peppery edge of miso. This is compact with a good creamy core in its slender and slinky body, but full of flavor and verve.
Name: Eichinger 2016 Ried Wechselberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Lifted lime and lemon notes appear on the shy nose, edged with soy spice. The palate follows with ripe, beautifully drawn pear fruit and even more yeasty, savory miso. Texturally this has a creamy lick and sleek midpalate concentration. The long, lovely finish brings out earthiness, pear peel and hints of lovage and chervil.
Name: Geyerhof 2016 Hoher Rain Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Pure notes of fresh apple and pear peel are appetizing on the nose, with a touch of spicy tangerine peel. The palate amplifies these expressive fruit notes. Ripeness of fruit and concentration characterize the midpalate that also shimmers with white pepper. The finish is long and intense, again with that lovely tangerine pith.
Name: Sohm & Kracher 2016 Lion Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The freshness of green citrus, pale yellow fruit and dewy summer meadows plays on the nose. The earthier palate focuses on textured savoriness reminiscent of miso and soy, counterpointed by lemon freshness. Savor slowly so you do not miss anything going on in the concentrated, slender body. It finishes on a savory lemon note.
Name: F X Pichler 2016 Loibner Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fresh lime and ivy hits you first, followed by a leesy hint and some pear on the nose. The palate comes in with salty savoriness that suggests yeasty miso, chervil and lovage, with lots of white pepper accented by a little spritz. Brightened by fresh lemon notes, this makes for a spicy, elegant and slender wine with a light touch and real depth.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Ried Steinsetz Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fresh pear peel, ripe pear fruit and a touch of citrus make for an inviting, appetizing nose. The palate takes all this fruit as a backdrop on which to display both herb and spice: white pepper, chervil, miso and salt. This interplay of spice and fruit is savory, slender and vivid, giving a moreish, totally balanced wine.
Name: Gruber Röschitz 2016 Hundspoint Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Pure notes of Conference pear appear with the first whiff on the nose and then stay throughout the palate. They are joined by bright and zesty lemon freshness on a concentrated yet very streamlined body. A touch of spritz accentuates that bright lemon and green-pear delicacy even more. Very fresh, very invigorating, it's totally delicious.
Name: Bründlmayer 2016 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A smoky, flinty touch of reduction joins ripe notes of green and yellow pear on the nose. The palate lets the pear fruit come to the fore but also presents a wonderfully textured body with a creamy, yeasty element and hints of ripe grapefruit. Zesty and fresh, the finish gives equal consideration to earthy and fruity elements.
Name: Aigner 2015 Privat Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A restarined but fresh note of pure lemon rises from the glass. The palate is just as fresh and adds an earthy, stony touch as well as the fruit and texture of russet pear. This is slender and refreshing, yet full of flavor. The finish is lip-smackingly lemony.
Name: Hirsch 2016 Kammern Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Savory notes of chervil combine with fresh citrus and ripe pear on the nose. The plate still has a yeasty, leesy touch and a full texture on the generous but fresh body. Slight spritz adds to the verve. The finish is both warming and refreshing, and chock full of pear fruit.
Name: Markus Huber 2016 Obere Steigen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Ripe notions of yellow Mirabelle plum make for a friendly, inviting opening. Lemony freshness persists on the palate where it is joined by spicy white pepper and a savory, salty undertone of yeast. This is refreshing, light and moreish.
Name: Loimer 2016 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fern, jasmine, green pear and tart mandarin create an aromatic, inviting nose. The palate supports these aromatics with an intense, concentrated freshness of bright, pure lemon on the midpalate. This is streamlined and refreshing, with just the right amount of invigorating spritz.
Name: Türk 2016 Kremser Weinberge Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Green apple appears amidst the more usual yellow and green-pear fruit and sets a fresh accent. The palate carries through on these vivid fruit notes and adds yeasty, savory spice: white pepper and arugula leaf create real interest. it's very refreshing and totally moreish.
Name: Hiedler 2016 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A touch of flinty reduction colors the nose, showing how young this wine still is. The palate, however, is fresh and sprightly in shape, but totally rich and concentrated in flavor. Svelte generosity shows in the very fluid midpalate texture and a lasting lemon finish.
Name: Anton Bauer 2016 Gmörk Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: The shy nose gives away a flinty hint of reduction. The palate has a juicier, easier quality where green pear, slightly earthy yeast and fresh citrus are drawn together. The body is light, fresh and very invigorating. With a little air, more aromas awake and present notions of Conference pear and yeasty saltiness.
Name: Bründlmayer 2016 Berg Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Moss and citrus join the Conference-pear flavors on the nose. The palate tingles with citrus freshness and has edges of white pepper, savory yeast and salty soy. The flavors are mouthfilling but wonderfully light on a zesty, slender and refreshing palate.
Name: Fischer 2016 Rossatz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The nose is very shy, giving little away apart from slight citrus. Everything happens on the palate, with tender but ripe pear fruit gently edged with zesty citrus. A tingle of white pepper along the lemon peel creates a vividly fresh but light wine. It's clean and totally refreshing, with a long finish.
Name: Markus Huber 2016 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Wet moss, green apple and russet-pear peel create a nose that is spicy, fresh and fruity. The palate concentrates these flavors against a backdrop of zesty citrus freshness. Compact and taut, the body is accentuated by slight spritz, and is very appealing in its zesty vigor.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Concentrated notes of pear peel and lemon zest make for an intense nose. The palate is juicy, light and fresh and majors on white-pear flesh with a bright touch of lemon that is dry and invigorating. The finish tingles with white pepper and lemon freshness.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2016 Ried Liebenberg Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The nose gives little away except for a touch of reductive smoke. The palate then presents a streak of zesty freshness, a light ripple of lovely texture and shimmering nuances of white pepper, crushed chervil, salty soy and savory miso. All this comes on a very light body, finishing with a bright, friendly note of lemon.
Name: Malat 2016 Ried Höhlgraben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A touch of miso mingles with green-pear fruit on the palate. There also is a cool touch of cucumber and a suspicion of white pepper. The palate is slender, fresh and clean. This almost has thirst-quenching qualities and is delicious without being simple.
Name: Hirsch 2016 Hirschvergnügen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Green pear and yellow Mirabelle plum are lifted by zesty lemon freshness on the nose, promising both fruit and refreshment. The palate gathers these flavors up in one juicy sweep with its slender body. The mouth tingles with citrus freshness, finishing dry and clean.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The nose gives away very little. The palate has exquisite lightness, with a fine spray of tender spritz that accentuates the slight white-pepper notes. Lemon and green pear shimmer through. This is light but refreshing, with a clean, spicy lemon finish.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2016 Point Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A mix of yeast and citrus zest creates a nose that is fresh and creamy at once. The palate has an earthier touch, emphasizing salty yeast more than juicy fruit, but the citrus freshness stays throughout. This is juicy and refreshing with a savory fillip at the end.
Name: Weszeli 2016 Steingarten Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This wine was 20% barrel fermented with the rest in stainless steel. The aromas bring appealing notes of green apple, white pepper and herb. The palate is dry and sleek but still rounded in feel. This is as impressive an example of the variety that has come out of the state to date. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
Name: W.T. Vintners 2016 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: A soft touch of lemon and green pear creates an appetizing nose. The palate has a salty tang on its smooth, balanced and fruity body. Easy and light, this is perfect as a refreshing, versatile white.
Name: Landhaus Mayer 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: An energizing nose combines ivy, lemon, green apple and lime for utter freshness. The palate adds a savory, yeasty note to counterpoint all the lemony freshness. The mix is moreish and lively in this refreshing if light summer wine.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2016 Kies Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Grapefruit peel, salty miso and white pepper create a savory and appetizing nose. The palate is slender and zippy, full of these spicy notes and enlivened by fresh lemon and green pear. It's a wonderfully easy but exciting Grüner: light but authentic, with lasting pepperiness.
Name: Felsner 2016 Moosburgerin Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A subdued nose gives mere hints of ripe, yellow Mirabelle plums. The palate conveys a little more of this lovely fruit on the slender, easy and almost juicy palate. A zesty core and some spritz add to the freshness and verve of this zippy, dry and sprightly wine.
Name: Gruber Röschitz 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Grüner Veltliner is an extreme rarity in the state. Sparkling offerings? Unheard of. This one brings appealing aromas of lime pith, white pepper, autolytic notes and citrus. The palate brings a big blast of acid, drinking quite dry. The acid is intense on its own but it will fit in nicely at the dinner table.
Designation: Scintillation Brut Sparkling Wine Underwood Mountain Vineyard
Name: Syncline 2015 Scintillation Brut Sparkling Wine Underwood Mountain Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: This still has a touch of flinty reduction. Clean and fresh, the palate does not yet show much fruit. This seems stony and tight, with occasional glimpses of spice. The wine needs some air to open up but presents taut, clean refreshment.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2016 T 26 Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The nose is shy but a deeper sniff reveals ripe notes of green pear. These also appear on the compact and slender palate, accented by a bright lemon freshness. It's refreshing, clean and bright, and the finish leaves you wanting more.
Name: Aigner 2016 Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A salty hint of yeast and fresh, green apple and pear appear on the nose. The slender palate is enlivened by lemon brightness and slight spritz. Cheeky green fruit and white pepper tingle everywhere, making for an easy but refreshing drink.
Name: The Dot 2016 Austrian Pepper Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Fresh lemon flesh and an edge of white pepper play on the nose. The palate has the same spicy freshness; the body is slender, fresh, dry and light. Glimpses of spicy white pepper appear time and again amid ripe notions of yellow Mirabelle plum.
Name: Winzer Krems 2016 Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Ripe Mirabelle plum and summer blossom create an inviting nose. These friendly, easy flavors persist on the slender palate that is enlivened by some spritz. Ample lemon freshness lasts through the dry, easy palate until the lively finish.
Name: Felsner 2016 Lössterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Notes of peardrop and lemon are immediately apparent on the nose. The palate is fresh and light, while the body shows spritz and fruity joy. This has ease and freshness, finishing on an appetizing hint of lemon.
Name: Winzer Krems 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A subdued nose carries just a hint of pear fruit. The slender, dry palate gives a little more green pear and fresh zestiness alongside peppery edges of herbs. This is light and easy but has lasting freshness.
Name: Malat 2016 Crazy Creatures Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A flinty touch of reduction appears first on the nose. On the palate, there is a little lack of definition but lemony freshness takes over on the slender and light body. The wine is refreshing and wonderfully light.
Name: Malat 2016 Furth-Palt Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Green-pear peel and a slight touch of bright lemon make for an understated, slender Grüner. The inherent, herbal freshness appears on the palate, with a hint of white pepper amid clean lemon notes.
Name: Weszeli 2016 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: That herbal, yeasty tang of Grüner is on display on the nose. The dry palate further brings out the earthy aspect with miso, stone, yeast and lemon. The body is light and balanced with a savory but diffuse finish.
Name: Steininger 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A yeasty, fresh and vivid nose has hints of lemon and ivy. The palate offers the same refreshing and lively lemon note, brightening the slender body alongside slight spritz. The lemon lasts on the fresh, dry finish.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2016 Von Den Rieden Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Almost luscious pear aromas and notes of peardrop make for a very fruity nose. The palate has a fruity, lemony ease, while the body is slender, dry and has some spritz. The lemon freshness is vivid, brightening everything on this easy, fruity summer wine.
Name: Winzer Krems 2016 GV Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose is rather shy, while the palate brings freshly cut green apple and Conference pear. This is precisely but finely drawn with ample lemon freshness and bright verve. The body is light and dry. Bright, lively lemon on the finish sets the tone.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Fresh and clean notes of pear and lemon rise immediately. They also play on the featherlight, easy and juicy palate, enlivened by some lively spritz. Dry and refreshing, this is made for a summer party or picnic.
Name: Pratsch 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Both green pear and peardrop make for an inviting, fruity nose. The palate portrays the same easy juicy fruit on a light, sprightly body that is lifted by bright lemon freshness and lively, fine spritz.
Name: Pratsch 2016 Steinberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A touch of spritz enlivens the nose of green pear. The palate shows riper flavors of yellow apple and is light and fresh. A juiciness and ease suggests this should be drunk soon to relish the dry, easy fun.
Name: Hiedler 2016 Löss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose is subdued but fresh. The slender palate seems a little unfocused and dilute, but slight notes of lemon and green apple are fresh and clean. Enjoy this easy-drinking, light-bodied wine with a fresh finish soon.
Name: Martinshof 2016 Zum Martin Sepp Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Description: A creamy, rounded note hits the nose first, followed by aromas of green apple and pear. The palate presents lemony freshness that makes this an easy, dry and refreshing white with a lovely green-apple finish.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Description: An appetizing aroma of ripe, yellow pear dances on the nose. The palate tones this down and brings slight lemon flavors into play, with a touch of spritz and a slender, fresh, clean body.
Name: Markowitsch 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Coconut oil, lime blossoms, fermenting citrus, kaffir lime and cold steel aromas show on the nose of this bottling of a grape rarely planted on the Central Coast. That coconut richness shows briefly on the sip, but it tightens up quickly to reveal restrained touches of lime skin and tangerine mousse.
Name: Solminer 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: The nose gives little away apart from a hint of green-pear peel. The palate is equally subdued, giving clean but almost neutral and slightly dilute notes of green pear. This is very fresh but provides little apart from some lemon and gentle pear fruit. Drink soon.
Name: Martinshof 2016 Lobster Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The highest priced among the four different Grüners produced at the winery, this elegant wine has the depth of the Reserve, the minerality of the Dolium, and riper flavors than either, with peach and melon dominating. Drink this slightly chilled and it will pair beautifully with just about all poultry and seafood.
Name: Reustle 2015 Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This reserve bottling, done entirely in stainless, brings extra weight and depth, with an enticing floral top note. Oranges and citrus-peel aromas carry into the palate, and a sense of powdered sugar suggests that perhaps it wasn't fermented completely dry. In any event, it's complex, compact and commanding.
Name: Reustle 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented in a concrete egg, this is a texture-based style with subtle penetrating minerality. The fruit flavors suggest peach, pear and Meyer lemon—not big and rich, but elegant and satisfying.
Name: Reustle 2015 Dolium Grüner Veltliner (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Reustle makes four different versions of this wine, each distinctive and worthy of attention. This is vinified in all stainless, and pushes sappy tart flavors of Meyer lemon and grapefruit front and center. The fruit is ripe enough that it leaves an impression of sweetness—a perfect counterbalance to the wine's natural acidity.
Name: Reustle 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This variety is extremely rare in Washington, especially in single-vineyard wines that are dry farmed. Light aromas of white pepper, lime and herb are followed by a dry palate marked by a strong sense of acidity. It needs food to shine.
Name: Savage Grace 2016 Underwood Mountain Vineyards Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: This wine's dried pear, hay and hayflower scents create an immediate impression of richness. The palate underlines all of these generous flavors with a unique, streamlined freshness that illuminates. This is what happens when good Grüner Veltliner benefits from a little bottle age: Its herbal, lifted allure comes to the fore. Savor this.
Name: Sohm & Kracher 2012 Single Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: There's an exotic edge to the nose of this wine, suggesting juicy, ripe mango and passion fruit. The palate is zesty and fresh and still rings with yeasty savor. It's slender yet concentrated and has a lasting flavor that encompasses yeasty richness and citrus tones. Lip-smackingly refreshing.
Name: Wieninger 2016 Vienna Hills Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Ripe stone fruit notes, especially aromatic Mirabelle plum, rise from the glass, alongside more evolved chamomile tisane scents. With its slight bottle age, this shows where evolution can lead Grüner Veltliner. The palate retains its zesty, salty savoriness yet is wonderfully concentrated. Juicy Mirabelle reappears on the long, savory finish.
Name: Leindl 2013 Seeberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Rich and developed dried pear and apricot notes stream from the nose of this wine, signifying its evolution. The palate is dry but rich with fruit and an emollient sense of vanilla spice. This is structured and bold, holding ample power within its broad shoulders and plenty of length on the finish. Pair with an equally potent dish or cellar and drink through 2020.
Name: Sohm & Kracher 2013 St. Georg Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Crisp green apple and Conference pear scents vie for attention in this wine. The slender palate adds a backdrop of yeasty savoriness yet remains sprightly and zippy. Riper fruit adds a more sonorous tone as it finishes, feeling full of citric verve and totally appetizing.
Name: Stadt Krems 2016 Ried Weinzierlberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A warm but fresh green and yellow pear peel scent on the nose gains even more currency on the palate of this wine. The midpalate exudes a savory, yeasty, textural element that provides structure and interest, yet the finish is very fresh.
Name: Ecker 2016 Von Stokstal Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: A ripe, earthy russet pear and hay element plays on the nose of this wine. The palate has that same rich but fresh character and comes with such concentrated flavor for its fresh and slender body. It has serious backbone and finishes with clean, zesty length.
Name: Sohm & Kracher 2013 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Friendly, lemony freshness plays on the nose and palate, where it's joined by spicy grapefruit peel notes. That zestiness pervades the taut, straight-lined and utterly refreshing palate. This is concentrated, clean and full of citrusy verve.
Name: Josef Bauer 2016 Katharina Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Ivy leaf and ripe, green pear notes make up this wine's enticing nose. The palate brims with juicy pear and citrus, feeling concentrated, lively and moreish. Dry and streamlined with citrus, it also layers pear and peach fruit before finishing with lip-smacking citrus zest.
Name: Josef Bauer 2016 Ried Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: A hearty swirl in the glass wakes up this wine's aroma, showing lemon balm, cress and green pear. Those fresh flavors also play on the lithe palate, where yeasty savoriness is enhanced by lemony spritz. It's totally zippy and refreshing, with far more concentration than is at first apparent, proving it needs time to breathe.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2016 Stein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Lovely, herb-tinged fragrance—as fresh as aloe vera and as aromatic as fig leaf—jumps out of the glass in this wine. The palate contributes yeasty earthiness and concentration, all highlighted by freshness and verve. The finish is clean and zesty.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2016 Am Berg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A restrained hint of peach plays on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with a little spritz and lots of savory, yeasty spice. White pepper accents lemon and pear peel flavors on the streamlined palate. The finish is lemony and fresh.
Name: Familie Zull 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The understated but alluring perfume of ripe pear peel leads the nose of this wine. Its concentrated body has the lovely, peppery, yeasty midpalate feel that we always hope for in Grüner. Subtle, light, savory and fresh, it finishes dry and zesty.
Name: Nigl 2016 Freiheit Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Green apple, peardrop and Conference pear shine on the nose of this wine. The streamlined palate clebrates those fresh flavors, highlighting them with extra lemon spritz, a salty, yeasty fringe adding complexity. The finish is lip-smacking, moreish and dry.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2016 Furth Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The savoriness of yeast still lingers on the nose of this wine. The palate brings herbal and sage-like notes to the fore, highlighting its concentrated, rich flavor. Citrus overtones herald the finish, while the saltiness demands you take another sip.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2016 Franciscus Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Creamy, herbal freshness reminiscent of fern and fig leaf rises from the glass in this wine. That same combination of creaminess and verve pervades the concentrated palate. It's dry, sophisticated and wonderfully compact.
Name: Laurenz V. 2015 Friendly Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine leads with lovely touch of flint, accentuating its green pear and lemon zest aromas. On the palate, it's light and dry, with a phenolic character that lends both texture and structure, adding complexity to all the freshness.
Name: Von Donabaum 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Yeasty savor and saltiness mingle with yellow pear scents on the nose of this wine. The palate adds juicy, ripe yellow plum to the mix, expanding its flavor to full-on fruitiness, with a baseline of zest and saltiness. It's generously packed, with a clean, dry and lasting finish.
Name: Laurenz V. 2015 Charming Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A hint of passion fruit mingles with yeasty tones in this wine's aroma. The palate doles out savory, sage-like notes in a concentrated, textural frame. It finishes with a lemony, lip-smacking and refreshing fillip.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2016 Haidviertel Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A hint of lemon and yeast leads the nose of this wine. Its light-footed palate brings in more yeasty savoriness and texture before ample lemon zest flavors kick in with appetizing freshness. This has concentration and light-heartedness in equal and abundant measure.
Name: Esterházy 2016 Estoras Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Ripe yellow plum pervades the nose of this wine. The palate brings more Grüner Veltliner savoriness, with hints of yeast and herb. Light in body and dry in mouthfeel, it refreshes with a lovely herbal citrus tang on the finish.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2016 Wieden Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This Grüner Veltliner's salty, yeasty savoriness comes with a tinge of sage and soy. Its slender palate, on the other hand, recalls zesty lime and lemon. Light and sprightly with spritz and verve, there is something weightless and animated here, with a lovely, savory, herbal finish.
Name: Jäger 2016 Klaus Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A touch of yeast and sage emerges amidst lime peel scents on the nose of this wine. The palate reinforces those flavors, while white pepper and lime notes tingle around the edges. It's lean but concnetrated and finishes with such a clean and refreshing zip that you just want to sip more.
Name: Stadt Krems 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Ripe, juicy pear scents make for an inviting nose. The wine's concentrated palate presents ample citrus with those pear notes, as well as spicy grapefruit zestiness. This is lovely, dry, refreshing and focused.
Name: Dürnberg 2016 L&T Cool Climate Falkenstein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: With an aroma reminiscent of peardrop and a zesty, easy and fresh palate, this wine is light on its feet and almost weightless. A whisper of zesty vigor on the finish makes it clean and refreshing.
Name: Jäger 2016 Selection Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
