Description: Savory notes of yeast trump fruit on the nose while the palate counters the spiciness with lots of zesty citrus. A very refreshing, lip-smacking Grüner, ideal for hot summer days.
Name: Hillinger 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Lovely, fresh and enticing green Conference pear flavors abound on nose and palate where they are met with a tangy grapefruit zestiness. This is ultralight and very refreshing. Drink soon.
Name: Nastl 2014 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Intriguing hints of passion fruit and tomato leaf play about the nose and lead to a very slender, slight body with ample freshness. There is more zest than fruit on the succinct palate.
Name: Zantho 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Slightly fragrant, superfresh and pear-scented, this is a very simple but fun Grüner made for sunny afternoons. Very easy, refreshing and fruity.
Name: Forstreiter 2014 Grooner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Telltale hints of pear and white pepper are just subtly hinted at, the palate is fresh, slender and simple. Provides perfect but simple refreshment.
Name: Felsner 2014 Moosburgerin Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Up-front fruitiness of green and yellow pear lead to a simple, citrus-fresh palate with lots of zing. A simple, savory pleasure with lingering pepperiness.
Name: Sommer 2014 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Fresh green pear and hints of ivy on nose and palate create a light-bodied, friendly, easy-drinking summer white. Zippiness and fruitiness are the hallmarks. Drink as soon as possible while fruit flavors are at their peak.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2014 Von den Rieden Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A lovely, lemon-scented freshness, almost of lemon balm, leads on the nose. The palate is similarly citrus-focused but also holds notes of savory yeast. A simple, superrefreshing wine.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2014 Von den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: The nose presents a mélange of pear, yeast and peppery herbs. On the palate, the fruit is almost completely subdued and dominated by strident yeastiness. This unusual wine would work well with soft, washed-rind cheeses or miso-flavored dishes.
Name: Sommer 2014 Bergweingarten Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Lots and lots of pear upfront on this simple, refreshing, easy-drinking summer wine. The light body and uncomplicated style make this a good party quaffer.
Name: Biokult 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Simple citrus freshness brightens nose and palate, the refreshment factor enhanced by ample spritz. This will make an ideal light-bodied and fun apéritif on a hot day. Drink soon.
Name: Felsner 2014 Lössterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Slightly lactic notes on the nose detract from the citrusy freshness of the simply refreshing, easy-drinking palate.
Name: Martinshof 2014 Lobster Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Savory herbs and yeast dominate the green pear flavors on nose and palate. The palate offers citrus freshness, a toned body and a clean-cut finish.
Name: Direder 2014 Schlossberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: The nose here is not quite as clean-cut as it could be, while the palate shows a little more focus. Crisp and zesty, if a little short.
Name: Nadler 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: A rather flat nose with just a hint of pear leads to a rather dilute, incongruous palate where the chief marker is unbalanced acidity.
Name: Fritsch 2014 Windspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Round and fruity, this is big, forward and loaded with ripe stone fruit, melon and a finishing lick of citrus. Fresh and lively, it's ready for immediate enjoyment.
Name: Raptor Ridge 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: A delightful citrus scent intrigues, suggesting yuzu or mandarin. The palate is richer and introduces notions of earth and that pithy, phenolic edge of serious Grüner Veltliner. The initial citrus on the nose returns with redoubled force on the streamlined, fresh and still tightly closed palate. Give this time to unwind, so that the fruit can fully express itself. The deliciously green- and orange-tinged finish promises everything. Drink from 2017.
Name: F X Pichler 2013 Dürnsteiner Liebenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Lusciously ripe, almost honeyed, pear fruit emanates from the glass. Underneath that is grapefruit zest and pith and a herbal, stony, earthy edge. The palate is rich and curvaceous but completely toned by a pervasive, lemony acidity that lends drive and linearity. This is already approachable, which is not to say that it doesn't promise a lot of mileage: this will go on and unfold its facets of fruit. Immense charm almost plays over the fact that this is a very age-worthy wine, with a finish that's almost endless. Drink from 2017.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2012 Ried Loibenberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Ripe pear shot through with savory notes of lovage and yeast create an appetizing nose. The palate holds the same savory dimension but is streamlined by welcome, citric freshness reminiscent of grapefruit peel. A phenolic component makes for real mouthfeel and texture—one of the characteristic joys of Grüner. This is a tight little bomb waiting to go off. It will do so in great fashion from about 2018.
Name: Eder 2013 Süssenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Wet earth, rain-wet stones, damp moss, wild sage and very ripe pear make for a complex opening. Further sniffs reveal more citrus: both juice and zest of lemon. The palate still holds a lot of leesy yeast flavors but its phenolic richness is tempered by total citrus freshness. This is still tightly wound; leave it so it can come into its own. The warming resonance on the palate suggests it has a long future. Drink from 2019.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2013 Ried Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: While this takes a while to open up, what follows is worth waiting for. It discloses a rounded richness composed of yeasty layers interspersed with ripe pear, stone fruit and ivy leaves. It also offers shimmers of apricot and juicy, yellow pear, with a more salty verve of grapefruit zest around the edges. Texture and acidity are the twin pillars of structure on this ripe and rounded wine that should be cellared to give its best. Drink from 2018.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2013 Ried Schütt Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Distinct botrytis notes of dried apricot and musk for now dominate the nose while the primary fruit still sleeps in this dry, still-closed wine. The palate is sleek and flowing, while the backbone of acidity sits upright and straight. This uncompromisingly dry wine will not reveal its true colors until at least 2017. Hold onto it until it can shine with subtly spiced, delicate dishes. The length it already possesses promises a great future.
Name: F X Pichler 2013 Loibner Steinertal Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Very ripe notions of pineapple and soft banana are coupled with a fresh, clean earthiness. A phenolic edge lends mouthfeel and structure while citrus zest pervades the palate with freshness and linearity. With more time in glass, a very charming, tender note of ripe conference pear appears. Give this time to unfold. Drink from 2018.
Name: Jäger 2013 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Ripe, juicy notes of yellow pear on the nose are shot through with lively, zesty lemon freshness. Smatterings of white pepper play around the sleek edges of this slender but super-juicy wine. This is totally enlivening and sings with fruit and freshness—with all the verve of its vintage.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe yellow pear and red-cheeked apples combine into a fresh and lively fruitiness. The edges are just seamed by a little peppery herbal spice while fresh citrus delivers refreshment. This delivers squeaky-clean lightness, fruit with a little peppery twist.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2014 Göttweiger Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Yeasty, savory hints pervade nose and palate in an intriguing fashion, along with white pepper. The fruit is still subdued and lemony freshness is prevalent on the superlight body that nonetheless shows plenty of Grüner character. If you like zippy wines, you will fall in love with this.
Name: Josef Jamek 2014 Ried Achleiten Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: While still closed on the nose, this has hints of green and yellow pear that shine through. A slender but very appetizing juiciness on the palate is light but full of freshness and flavor. Yeast, aloe vera and herbal spice add even more pleasure. It's a gorgeous, refreshing wine from a challenging vintage.
Name: Eichinger 2014 Hasel Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Yeast, lovage and yellow pear unite in an ultrasavory Grüner that honors the variety's nickname of pfefferl—the peppery one. The flavor base rests on green pear and fresh lemon, but the spice ratchets everything up a notch, and the lovely pepper lingers. Incredibly appetizing, this wine calls for light, savory dishes.
Name: Loimer 2014 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Lovage and peppery watercress join pear and lemony citrus to deliver a charming and super-clean textbook Grüner. Verve and freshness play on the palate and linger pleasantly.
Name: Unger 2014 Zieselrain Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: With just a little air, the wonderful peppery nature of Grüner becomes apparent. A quintessential Grüner from a cool but refreshing vintage, this offers white pepper and crushed lovage leaves amidst pear and citrus zest.
Name: Malat 2014 Am Hohlgraben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Notes of nettle tea and crushed nettle partner with tart conference pear on an ultralight but beautifully textured body. A super-clean finish offers lemon tartness that lingers refreshingly. This is made for light fish cuisine, such as steamed white fish with fresh lemon and parsley.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2014 Stein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe, rounded green pear flavors gain edge from peppery, herbal notes and the verve of zesty lemon acidity. The conference pear flavors shine through to the very end to provide zesty, savory pleasure.
Name: Stadt Krems 2014 Weinzierlberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Lime zest and green pear peel on the nose turn into fuller, zestier flavor on the palate. Leafy pepperiness joins the fresh conference pear fruit and makes for a lovely, if very light, texture. The wine is an accomplishment for such a difficult vintage.
Name: Stadt Krems 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Savory yeastiness joins lemon zestiness and draws a peppery line from start to finish on this refreshing but lightweight wine. Flavors make you want to keep sipping to get to the bottom of these spicy nuances.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2014 Löss Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Sleek green pear-scented ripeness is married to tender creaminess. Underneath the fruit, subtle yeast notes appear. Slender but flavorsome and easy, the wine offers lovely Grüner typicity and perfect balance.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2014 Zeiseneck Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Moist, mossy freshness frames the green pear fruit on this slender, zesty and very juicy wine. The light body makes for ultimate refreshment.
Name: Müller-Grossmann 2014 Großer Satz Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Zippy, fresh conference pear fruit with just a little edge of white pepper and zingy lemon zest plays on this linear, light-bodied but ultrafresh wine. An almost-weightless lightness means that the wine will do well as an enlivening apéritif.
Name: Steininger 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Despite the lightness of body, this lemon- and pear-scented wine offers both texture and zest. Sleek, slender refreshment, it delivers a lot of citrus zip and cleansing length.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2014 Messwein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Fern fronds mingle with green pear on the nose. The palate adds zingy but ripe lemon acidity and an impression of ripe and juicy pear despite the slender palate. The wine offers supreme refreshment at a moderate weight.
Name: Buchegger 2014 Gelbling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: While this Grüner does not give away too much on its rather closed nose, the savory hints of pepper, arugula, pear and thyme unite beautifully and insistingly on the midpalate. The wine gets full marks for refreshing, authentic typicity.
Name: Wieninger 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Spritzy, citrus-focused refreshment sets the tone on nose and palate. This is slender and light-bodied, but totally fresh-flavored with a lemony zing on the finish.
Name: Artner 2014 Steinäcker Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Streamlined lemon, lime and conference pear flavors pervade nose and palate. Some spritz lifts things even further to an almost weightless level of easy refreshment.
Name: Winzer Krems 2014 Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Yeasty notes of fermentation still swing on the nose. The palate is more evolved and shows the characteristic slenderness and freshness of the 2014 vintage. Green apples join a lemony zestiness while the palate adds peppery Grüner spice. The finish is ultraclean.
Name: Markus Huber 2014 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: This offers a winning combination of yeasty roundness and green pear with added lemon zing. Simple but beautifully balanced, it is refreshing, versatile and spicy without ever weighing heavily on mind or palate. It's a rounded, yet refreshing wine.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2014 Hochterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Just a hint of pear drop plays over fresh, tart conference pear fruit. The palate is sleek, linear and super-clean; while this is driven by freshness some luscious fruit awaits underneath.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2014 Terrassen Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Pear drop and fresh, green conference pear join lemony freshness on nose and palate. Light bodied and easy-drinking, it refreshes but does not weigh down.
Name: Schwarzböck 2014 Vier Gärten Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This refreshing and light-bodied Grüner also has a rounder, riper aspect, referencing flavors of red apple and green pear. While the nose does not give away that much, concentration characterizes the midpalate before an easy, super-clean finish.
Name: Markus Huber 2014 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This slender, barely-there wine offers almost weightless lightness, fresh citrus notes and a soft finish of lime zest. It delivers simple, clean refreshment.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2014 Franciscus Messwein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The 2014 vintage was cool and difficult in Austria but conscientious winemakers delivered wines of incredible refreshment and verve. This bottling offers citrus, white pepper, lemon zest and a touch of green pear. If you like it slender, sleek and refreshing, grab this now.
Name: Malat 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Spicy yeast notes rather than fruit or citrus take over and make for a light-bodied, fresh but rounded white that will be best with food, presenting savory notes that will echo any spiciness. It's a versatile, peppery white with lots of Grüner spice.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2014 Kies Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This shows the greenish scent of conference pear peel and its juicy, tart but ripe flesh. After up-front fruit, it refreshes with a superlight, lemony-fresh body. If you are looking for featherlight refreshment, the Grüners from the 2014 vintage will deliver zippy fruit.
Name: Allram 2014 Strassertaler Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Subtle pear drop flavors hover over riper notes of yellow pear on nose and palate, joined by a fresh, friendly lemon zest acidity. A very typical example of the fresh, light-bodied 2014 vintage, it features a welcome edge of Grüner's pepperiness.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Very slight peppery accents peek though the citrus and yeast notes of this light-bodied, very slender wine. The streak of zesty acidity has a peppery edge. Light but refreshing, it's perfect for an enlivening apéritif.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2014 Wieden & Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Echoes of that typical Grüner pepperiness can be divined on nose and palate. Even if this is very light, it offers clean fruit, citrus verve and refreshing zip.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2014 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Rounded flavors of ripe, red apple play about the palate and make for very appetizing if light-bodied drinking. Refreshment is the key factor, as is fruity exuberance. Drink soon.
Name: Münzenrieder 2014 Classic Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Citrus and green pear combine with yeasty notes to give an impression of subdued but creamy fruitiness. It's an easy-drinking, savory and versatile white, with some peppery spice.
Name: Soellner 2014 Fumberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Very ripe, almost pineapple-like notes emanate from the glass. The palate is light and also has ripe tropical notes, shot through with refreshing lemon acidity. The light body turns this into an easy sip, but drink soon while the fruit still lasts.
Name: Malat 2013 Crazy Creatures Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A very attractive peppery and herbal note informs the citrus nose of this refreshing white, along with a floral hint. This offers a lot of charm for a very easy, enjoyable wine.
Name: Unger 2014 Q Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Savory yeast notes take center stage, with touches of citrus and pear firmly in the background. This light-bodied, fresh white will pair well with equally light fare like fresh salads. The spice lingers beautifully.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2014 Austrian Pepper Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: L&T stands for “leicht & trocken”—light and dry. This wine is true to its name. Yeast notes mingle with grapefruit zest on the still-closed nose. The palate refreshes with crisp green apple and freshly sqeezed lemon. An almost austere wine, it has backbone, verve and lasting freshness.
Name: Bründlmayer 2014 L&T Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Fresh, fruity, zingy and clean with yellow and green pear and refreshing citrus, this is a simple and easy-drinking crowd-pleaser.
Name: Markus Huber 2014 Broadbent Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This presents a feather-weight but super-clean rendition of the 2014 vintage in a slender and balanced package. With airing, the characteristic pepperiness of Grüner shines through.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2014 T26 Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A subdued nose of citrus leads to a pleasantly round, fresh palate that is enlivened by a little spritz. Subtle citrus notes linger. Well-chilled, this will make for easy, light-bodied refreshment.
Name: Netzl 2014 Classic Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Yeasty notes speak louder than citrus or pear and make for a thoroughly savory, rounded wine that has a light body. There's a lot of Grüner spice here, despite the easy-drinking nature of the wine.
Name: Loimer 2014 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Yeasty overtones dominate the nose, while the palate reveals creamy pear fruit and a rounded palate with savory Grüner spice. This will work very well with mixed cheeses.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2014 Haidviertel Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Blossom and peach notes are layered amidst dust and bramble on the nose of this robust, full-bodied Grüner Veltliner. Lushly textured, the palate showcases white grapefruit flavor tinged with characteristic notes of pepper and spice.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The nose is pungent, juxtaposing pretty white floral, grapefruit and pineapple tones against musky, slightly sweaty notes. Dry and bristling on the palate, it's marked by lemon-lime acidity framing crisp honeydew and green plum flavors.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Description: This easy-drinking white marries citrus and green pear with just a hint of herbal spice. Simple and straightforward, it would make a refreshing, light-bodied party-pleaser.
Name: Soellner 2014 Wogenrain Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Pear drop, leafy arugula and faint lemon form the aromatic trio that governs nose and palate of this light, refreshing white. Drink soon.
Name: Höpler 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Pear drop and some citrus are the aromatic markers of this soft, light and very easy-drinking wine. The finish refreshes with green pear flavors.
Name: Müller-Grossmann 2014 HM9 Helma und Marlies Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Faint notes of citrus lend an edge of freshness to this easy-drinking wine. Slightly dilute notes make for even more lightness but the finish is clean and fresh.
Name: Lenz Moser 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While exuberantly floral, this wine feels weightless and breezy on the palate. It's a bit lacking in concentration, but tart grapefruit and pineapple flavors make it refreshing and quaffable.
Name: Stony Lonesome 2013 Estate Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Description: Ripe notes of yellow pear pop up on nose and palate. The body is light and easy.
Name: Landhaus Mayer 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Deep, golden yellow, this elegant but structured white offers aromas of fragrant white flower, alpine herb, mature pear and exotic fruit. The vibrant, spicy palate doles out crisp green apple, white peach, nectarine, lemon zest, white pepper and a ginger note. It's balanced and fresh, with bright acidity and a long, mineral finish.
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2012 Praepositus Veltliner (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This grape, seldom planted on the Central Coast, produces a wine that boasts intense aromas of passion fruit juice and candied grapefruit. It's lively and ripe on the palate, with white rose and apple blossom flavors, yet balanced, with lime peel, cut grass and steel accents.
Name: Zocker 2013 Paragon Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas of beeswax, white spring flower and a whiff of pear mingle in the glass. The linear palate offers crunchy green apple, nectarine zest and ground white pepper alongside brisk acidity. It's very pretty and extremely refreshing.
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2013 Veltliner (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The scents and flavors suggest pink grapefruit, apple and pear, dusted with cinnamon. It's round and spicy, with moderate acidity and a touch of residual sugar.
Name: Reustle 2013 Revelation & Sorek Bloc Grüner Veltliner (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: What differentiates this from the winery's other Grüner is hard to say. Both are round and spicy, with moderate acidity and a suggestion of residual sugar. This has a touch more alcohol, and a bit of heat in the finish.
Name: Reustle 2013 Winemaker's Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This super cool-climate exploration of the Austrian grape is high-toned on the nose with lots of grassy elements, yet a bit of rounded ripe pear too. The palate is powered by bitterness and tension, with pear skins and tangy lemon skin making for a sour, mouth-rinsing sipper.
Name: Tatomer 2013 Paragon Grüner Veltliner (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Graham Tatomer is bringing Austria to California with his exciting wines, in this case delivering aromas of tight banana, poached apple and guava along with steely gunmetal. There is great zing on the tip of the palate, with apple and pear as well as a lime zest backbone.
Name: Tatomer 2013 Meeresboden Grüner Veltliner (Santa Barbara County)

Description: The remarkably powerful nose takes time to open up, hinting at yellow flowers, fern fronds, beeswax and citrus. The palate is immensely concentrated but not heavy, with a sleek density and a feeling that this has barely begun to breathe. Hang on to this; soft sprays of pepper hint at the pleasure to come. Drink as of 2017.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2013 Axpoint Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Floral notes play above the aromatic woodruff and fig-leaf aromas which make this incredibly enticing. The palate is slender, tight and totally concentrated. This is nervy, high-octane stuff, for now boasting lemon and pink grapefruit, without a single ounce of fat—and yet this is not ungenerous.
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2013 Supperin Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fresh, bright pear on the nose gives way to far more focused, even linear lemon on an extremely streamlined palate. This is racy, ripe but laser-sharp. A wine of great precision and purity with immense impact and mileage.
Name: Proidl 2013 Ehrenfels Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Strikingly golden in color this tightly holds very ripe yellow pear fruit and dark honey. With time in glass, fresh and ripe pineapple tantalizes. The palate is concentrated and has a pleasantly bitter phenolic edge, stony definition and a core of freshness. The undeniably ripe fruit is still tightly corseted and will need cellaring to express itself. Drinks as of 2018.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2013 Honivogl Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Subdued hints of citrus point to a subtle, understated but no less delicious white. Soft notions of juicy yellow pear, very ripe pink grapefruit flesh and grated yellow grapefruit zest harmonize beautifully. A gentle but shapely and poised Grüner of immense elegance and a wonderfully cushioned midpalate.
Name: Hiedler 2013 Kittmannsberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Dried sage, fresh yeast and salty miso, shot through with lemon acidity, meet to make an incredibly savory, spicy but concentrated and streamlined palate with a lot of power. There is weight here, but nothing is bulky, it's pure, toned muscle. This still needs time. Drink as of 2017
Name: Loimer 2013 Spiegel Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The enticing scent of green mango chopped with mandarin leaves sets the exotic tone. On the palate the aromatic leafiness becomes even more delicious and pronounced. White pepper, citrus leaves, and rich, ripe tropical fruit sear on the palate. This is dramatic stuff and oh so moreish. Hints of candied lime zest roar in the background. The spicy finish is very long and leaves you wanting more.
Name: Malat 2013 Gottschelle Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Smoky, waxy overtones play with citrus zestiness on a very focused, concentrated palate that tingles with citrus and pepper. The immense power and concentration will take cellaring to come to full fruition. Drink 2016-2022.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2013 Von Stein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Yeasty freshness swings along with the citrus, watercress, green pear and miso flavors, showing that this is made to last. Grüner's elementary savoriness is exemplified here with verve, weight and conviction. The length is stunning. the moreish flavors never seem to end. Drink as of 2017.
Name: Loimer 2013 Käferberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine pulls off a daring feat: despite palate weight and concentration it has a light, almost delicate, feathery citrus touch and a streamlined, fresh palate. The aromatic expression is just beginning to unfold, promising freshly cut apples and oceans of green and dried spice. This should carry a danger-warning: seriously, deliciously addictive! Beautiful now but it deserves maturing. Drink as of 2016–2017.
Name: Eichinger 2013 Gaisberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Slight spritz accentuates both the fresh peppery notes and the riper glints of peach and plum. Citric acidity pulls everything into sharp focus and makes for a concentrated, impactful midpalate. This will continue for a long, long time. Drink 2015-2020.
Name: Winzer Krems 2013 Kremser Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A creamy nose shows spikes of green freshness, reminiscent of fern or ivy. The palate holds peppery, citrusy spray with creamy generosity while white pepper and ripe pear appear at the seams. The long finish is whistle-clean. This will blossom into further aromatic intensity with a little age. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Bründlmayer 2013 Vincents Spiegel Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Creamy, rounded freshness with an immensely savory core of sage, arugula and white pepper make for an understated but seriously delicious white. There is weight and importance here, but it is lightly worn. The spicy, almost salty flavors keep you wanting more.
Name: Bründlmayer 2013 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Still a little closed, this does not yet want to give too much away of its ripe, almost sumptuous flavors. The palate however, signals that all is there: concentration, balance and rich fruit cut through with ample freshness. Yeasty savoriness and white pepper play on the midpalate. This will open up. Drink as of 2017.
Name: Eichinger 2013 Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Beautifully nuanced notes of white flowers, fern fronds, white peach and tart passion fruit seeds make for an intriguing play on nose and palate. These take turns in highlighting the shimmering acidity of this sleek, beautiful wine with satisfying length. This is both lively and enlivening and so very long.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2013 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The scent of freshly cut, warm hay pervades the yeasty notes of this concentrated, ripe yet fresh and zingy Grüner. On closer acquaintance, riper notes of yellow pear appear, spiced with white pepper and grapefruit zest. The linear, sleek drive and vivacious energy are very satisfying indeed.
Name: Loimer 2012 Käferberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Beeswax, yellow pear peel and yeasty notes for now dominate nose and palate while pepper and fruit still slumber. The wonderfully sleek mouthfeel with real phenolic grip and zesty finish also hints at tropical largesse of pineapple and mango. Do not touch before 2017.
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2013 Kellerberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Subdued, ripe, yellow pear meets yeasty, almost soy-like savoriness head-on to create a palate full of interest. The wine conveys weight, concentration and a bit of alcoholic heat, but it's all carried of with peppery panache. Lovely now but will only get better.
Name: Bründlmayer 2013 Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Very ripe yellow plum, immediately tempered by zesty grapefruit, is the chief notion on the nose. The palate seems softer and even has a smoky note. Slender and mineral, this is toned and light-footed. The layered palate pulls to mind very stony soils. Beautiful now but will get even better—if you can wait at all. Drink as of 2017.
Name: Lagler 2013 Steinborz Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A gently floral nose that also acknowledges hints of fern and fig leaf provides a fitting entry to this elegantly nuanced Grüner, which subtly plays between those aromas and more citrus. Gentle but focused and concentrated, it accentuates depth rather than power.
Name: Nigl 2013 Senftenberger Pellingen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Smoky citrus aromas build a structure for a lighter, delicate yet very ripe wine. The acidity is like a fault line and accentuates different fresh fruits like peach, mango and tart passion fruit. Aromatically, this is a total winner with its sleek and slender palate.
Name: Malat 2013 Das Beste vom Veltliner Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Sprightly grapefruit zest notions play with peppery arugula to make a spicy streamline along the palate. White pepper is vibrant along the edges and delivers lots of excitement on the tight, concentrated and slender palate. Beautiful now but with the stuffing to age.
Name: Schmelz 2013 Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Lusciously ripe notes of apricot and honeydew melon demand attention. The palate is more toned down but has dimensions of peppery arugula and lovage leaves. The finish is long and savory with a citrus kick.
Name: Gruber Röschitz 2013 Mühlberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Lifted notes of Conference pear blended with creamy, balmy aloe vera create an intriguing, friendly and inviting nose, while a pleasantly bitter edge suggests some grapefruit zest. The palate is zingy, sprightly and fresh, almost belying the concentrated power at its base. Texturally this is a pleasure too, with a wonderfully ripe phenolic edge.
Name: Allram 2013 Hasel Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Hints of woodruff, green pear and grapefruit zest frame the ripe yet firm palate. A pleasant phenolic edge adds even more structure, while the finish is bracingly clean. A tight and concentrated wine which will last and develop.
Name: Schmelz 2013 Pich Point Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The nose recalls a host of very fresh things: green ferns, wet pebbles and zesty lime peel. The palate adds generous yellow plum fruit and convinces with a spicy, fruity core and quite a bit of alcoholic warmth. Extended, savory length.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2013 Hommage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: On the nose this is muted, but the palate is full of easy charm. Floral hints meet with ripe pear and that wonderfully leafy, ripe pungent pepperiness. Sleekness, shapely freshness and a bit of playful verve underlines the fact that this is immensely concentrated despite not coming across as heavy.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2013 Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe yellow pear is held in check by citrus zestiness, but rich fruit notions keep breaking though the bracing freshness of this wine. A slender body and fine-tuned phenolics add to the appeal of this balanced white.
Name: Alzinger 2013 Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Freshly sliced yellow plum, ripe yellow pear and creamy hints of aloe vera make for an inviting nose and a very mellow, soft palate with that delicious edge of finely ground white pepper. Quintessential Grüner with verve and concentration.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2013 Stein Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Flavorful and appetizing, this focuses on zesty citrus fruit with pink grapefruit juiciness highlights. Notions of white pepper shine through, but the chief attraction is this wine's juicy, refreshing and almost thirst-quenching nature. A lingering zestiness persists long after the last sip.
Name: Hiedler 2013 Thal Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: With a very slight spritz, this offers lots of zesty flavors that create a savory midpalate amid white pepper and yeast. Riper hints of green and yellow pear await in the background. There is immense concentration on the palate, which finishes almost with a kind of saltiness.
Name: Geyerhof 2013 Gaisberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Inviting citrus and herbal notes lead to yeasty freshness, bright lemon acidity and the peppery savoriness of watercress and arugula. It's wonderfully concentrated, long and streamlined with a full and lasting flavor. Good now but will open up nicely.
Name: Fischer 2013 Ried Steiger Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Ripe pear and yellow plum vie for prominence on the nose, while the palate is full of savory, peppery kitchen herbs like chervil, lovage and dried sage. The midpalate phenolic texture destines this for the table where it will shine with subtly spiced dishes. Wonderfully complex and long.
Name: Wieninger 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Soft, juicy notes of pear and yellow melon play softly on the palate before an edge of pleasantly pungent watercress adds a whole new kick of interest. All is supported by firm citrus freshness to the concentrated, long palate.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2013 Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Green pear is the only notion emanating aromatically, but so much more lurks within this tightly coiled wine. White pepper, watercress punchiness and straight-laced lemony acidity decree that this will be at its best 2017–2018 when more fruit will come to the fore.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2013 Kellerberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The peel of green Conference pears, some wet earth and the merest hint of smoke provide an interesting nose that refines itself into lemon with savory herbal notes on the long and streamlined palate. There is something pleasantly racy about this. Very moreish.
Name: Fritsch 2013 Mordthal Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Green, exquisitely ripe Conference pear with softer, leesy notes create a ripe yet fresh creaminess. There are fringes of spice but fresh fruit and lemony brightness are in the foreground here. Very refreshing and invigorating.
Name: Allram 2013 Gaisberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A softly fruited, pear-scented Grüner full of super-clean, green Conference pear aromas. Grapefruit and lemon highlights brighten the creamy yet slender midpalate. A gentle wine but with focus and huge charm.
Name: Müller-Grossmann 2013 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Hints of green Conference pear with even gentler notes of aloe vera make for an inviting nose. The palate is tight, concentrated and linear, but still full of charm. At the core a very refreshing citrus zestiness radiates. A very elegant wine.
Name: Stadt Krems 2013 Kremser Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Very concentrated notes of zesty grapefruit peel mingle with punchy, peppery watercress on a rather concentrated palate. Freshly ground pepper intriguingly pops up here and there. This is a weighty wine that definitely belongs on the table.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2013 Renner Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Subtle lemon hints and zesty freshness mellow a little on the creamy but nonetheless very slender, graceful palate. Elegance and purity are hallmarks here and it is depth rather than power that convinces. Very clean finish.
Name: Hiedler 2013 Löss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Yellow plum and mineral hints of wet pebble with an almost salty draw demand attention. The palate is fresh and full of appetizing, lemony zing and concentration. This is fun and satisfying, not to say completely delicious.
Name: Hirsch 2013 Renner Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Flavors of yeast, dark miso and lovage combine in a very spicy, resonant palate. Zesty citrus freshness keeps it all in check. This will shine with subtle but intricate dishes and will be a total winner with stinky cheeses.
Name: Hager Matthias 2013 Urgestein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Very soft notions of ripe, yellow pear with floral overtones create a softer, luscious but completely dry palate. An ideal wine for those who like structure but mellow flavors. The savory edge of Grüner makes itself felt around the edges but never dominates and provides spicy length.
Name: Markus Huber 2013 Berg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Inviting notes of ripe yellow plum and a mossy creaminess on nose and palate combine to great effect. Peppery watercress notes provide extra interest. The spiciness persists for a long time in this beautifully balanced wine.
Name: Dürnberg 2013 Endlos Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Soft, delicate pear and gentle citrus coalesce into a more citrus-focused, super-fresh palate with verve and elegance. Light-footed but concentrated, this is graceful, with wonderful minerality.
Name: Unger 2013 Gottschelle Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Glowingly ripe pear and juicy yellow plum make a great aromatic opening that continues onto the flavorful palate where it is tempered pleasantly by white pepper and lemon zest. Freshness, verve and drive characterize the concentrated palate. The finish is long and clean.
Name: Steininger 2013 Kittmannsberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is still closed tightly and barely wants to give away more than punchy grapefruit zest, but the balanced palate that cushions the fresh but ripe acidity suggests that this will open up gradually. Drink as of 2017.
Name: Alzinger 2013 Steinertal Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Subtle but unmistakable white pepper flashes through this slender, lemony but oh-so-savory wine. Notions of ripe pear enter on the midpalate which comes across as complete, harmonious and long.
Name: Anton Bauer 2013 Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: Smoke and flintstones play among green pear and savory yeast notes. The palate reveals a yeasty, cushioned texture, framed by grapefruit zestiness. The finish is clean-cut but persistent and is set to evolve over the years.
Name: Bründlmayer 2013 Käferberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Very ripe yellow pear mixed with punchy arugula create a contrast that makes this wine hard to put down. Partly aged in large, used acacia barrels, partly in stainless steel, the slender but ripe body is accentuated by the peppery edge. Very moreish with a lovely and long finish.
Name: Markus Huber 2013 Alte Setzen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Savory herbs and peppery watercress dominate the crunchy green pear fruit on nose and palate. Citrus edges lend liveliness to the concentrated, spicy palate. Lots going on here, from the first whiff to the last, lingering echo.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2013 Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Friendly and animating notes of ripe Amalfi lemon, ripe pear and fresh greenery come together in this immensely appetizing white. Focused citric softness makes this a serious pleasure to drink. The peppery aftertaste lingers dangerously long.
Name: Steininger 2013 Loisiumweingarten Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Green pear, miso and soy sauce mingle spicily on the nose. The palate is a combination of rich, rounded yeastiness and fresh, zesty lemon. Sage and white pepper provide further layers. This is full of interest and freshness.
Name: Arndorfer 2013 Strasser Weinberge Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Smoky hints play about the nose but the palate comes through with green pears, pear peel, grapefruit zest and yeasty, peppery savoriness. Layers of flavor emerge, and savory spice wins the day. This will be compelling with soft cheeses.
Name: Dürnberg 2013 Rabenstein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Miso paste cuts through with yeasty, salty richness set against wonderfully sharp citric freshness lends serious thrill to this textured, layered Grüner. There is more to come on the aromatic front in future years, even though it will take a lot of resistance not to drink it right now.
Name: Hirsch 2013 Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Freshly peeled green pear with top notes of fig leaf and aloe vera dominate nose and palate. This is slender but buffered, creamy but not fat. A balanced wine with friendly glints of fruit and freshness.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2013 Gottschelle Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The combination of superripe juicy pear with crunchily fresh green glints suggesting citrus foliage or aloe vera makes for an irresistibly refreshing drink. Lemony, zesty midpalate concentration creates extra liveliness.
Name: Laurenz V. 2013 Charming Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Beckoningly ripe, yellow pear with overtones of yellow plum unite in a very juicy, refreshing and lively white which slowly reveals layers of savory, peppery spice. The streamlined body remains toned despite its undoubted concentration. Ready now but will definitely keep.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2013 Loiserberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Yeasty and juicy, this is a very savory Grüner where peppery, herbal spice stands in the foreground with lots of citrus freshness. This is lip-smackingly fresh, lively and intense.
Name: Geyerhof 2013 Steinleithn Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Ripe pear fruit comes with a spicy, peppery edge that blends creamy aloe vera with zesty grapefruit peel freshness. So easy and pleasant to drink and yet not without sophistication.
Name: Markowitsch 2013 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: This offers ripe yellow and green pear shot through with grapefruit zest, with a yeasty, savory streak on the midpalate and a touch of pineapple. Certainly ripe and rounded—but beautifully tempered by lively white pepper.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2013 Spies Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Lemon balm, peppery arugula and yeasty savoriness combine into a sleek, streamlined wine that goes down all too easily—notwithstanding its wonderful layers and length. The lemony finish lasts and refreshes.
Name: Dürnberg 2013 Tradition Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose does not want to give too much away, apart from delicacy and ripe yellow pear. The palate is ripe and rounded and has a distinct yeasty, almost nutty savoriness. Pepper then makes an entrance and stays right there to linger beautifully.
Name: Sepp Moser 2013 Schnabel Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Yeasty notes of pear with floral hints provide a nose that is both earthy and ethereal. The savory yeastiness is stronger on the rounded, structured palate framed by a phenolic edge.
Name: Mantlerhof 2013 Spiegel Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Seriously savory watercress and yeast notes take the aromatic lead. The palate follows suit with pepperiness and lemony, citric verve. Zippy, lively and fresh, but with weight and resonance.
Name: Steininger 2013 Grand Grü Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Yeasty citrus notes dominate the nose while the palate is savory with chervil, sage and more yeast. A vein of crisp citrus acidity pulls it all together. The aftertaste lingers long with lemon zest.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2013 Höhereck Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Tender, teasing perfumes of ivy leaves and citrus with riper notions of pear, yeast and grapefruit peel make for a complete, spicy palate. The phenolic midpalate has a counterpoint in the zesty acidity. Good now, but will develop.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2013 Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Aromatic green pear with hints of peardrop dominates the nose and the palate is cushioned, despite the lively acidity. Plenty of verve and fruit in one compact package.
Name: Forstreiter 2013 Schiefer Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Grapefruit peel, ripe apricot and zingy lemon spell freshness, while the palate is focused and precise, exhibiting some of the expected peppery notes. Very tangy with a clean, almost lip-smacking finish.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2013 Kies Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Focused and sprightly flavors of savory leaves are shot through with lemony freshness and zing, but the freshness is beautifully cushioned by a yeasty midpalate spice. Concentrated yet light.
Name: Leth 2013 Scheiben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Ultrafresh Conference pear just sliced and dripping with juice—that is the pure expression of this sleek, slender and very refreshing, clean white. This is neither heavy nor very concentrated, but nonetheless compelling for its pure fruit.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2013 Messwein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Yeasty pepperiness and savory spice pervade the lemony core of this zippy Grüner. The body is light but offers interest and refreshment. A very moreish, spicy little number.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2013 Kirchlissen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Peardrops on the nose currently hide the more peppery, savory side of this slender Grüner, which nonetheless convinces with its light but spicy and fresh body.
Name: Anton Bauer 2013 Grande Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

Description: A subtle nose of citrus suggests a restrained wine. Indeed, the palate is slender, citrus-fresh and light, but enlivened by the peppery varietal edge that invariably adds interest. Clean, crunchy finish.
Name: Fritsch 2013 Schlossberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Peppery, spicy red apple notes mingle with yeasty overtones in this rounded yet streamlined Grüner. Spice and minerality hold the foreground. There is citrus verve at the core and one can almost taste wet stones. Lovely now but this will age gracefully.
Name: Preisinger 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Lemon, green pear and aloe vera meld into a balanced, streamlined white with focus, elegance and depth. Citrus flavors play with peppery spice and combine for a lasting finish.
Name: Dürnberg 2013 L&T Cool Climate Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Abundant pear fruit, both green and yellow, with yellow plum thrown in, provides an immensely fruity core that is tightly corseted by zesty citrus for a wonderful and lasting contrast.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Ripe green pear and a leafy, savory edge of watercress with a phenolic dimension on the mouthfeel create a rich and concentrated wine. The rounded palate demands food.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2013 Kremser Tor Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Soft, light, fresh and zippy. This quintessential and very refreshing light white wine hints at citrus, arugula and pepper notes and presents a light-footed, invigorating mouthful.
Name: Broadbent 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Yeasty, rounded and almost earthy notes are conjured up on the nose. That almost soy-like yeastiness remains on the palate, where citrus zest cuts through the richness. Texturally this is creamy and buffered, but not without tone.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2013 Loam Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Subtle pepper, pear and lemon hints segue from nose to palate, where spicy savoriness begins to dominate. Tight, refreshing and light-bodied with pleasing focus.
Name: Dürnberg 2013 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The merest hint of fresh lemon zest with fresh notes of green Conference pear combine to make a light-bodied and ultimately very refreshing wine with just a touch of spice on the finish.
Name: Dürnberg 2013 Falkenstein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Tight, streamlined and slender, this lemony, fresh Grüner has a cheeky hint of pepperiness on the refreshing finish.
Name: Dürnberg 2013 Erdenlied Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Enticing flavors of juicy ripe pear with creamy, yeasty elements play about nose and palate. A yeasty mouthfeel also characterizes the rounded midpalate.
Name: Schwarzböck 2013 Ried Sätzen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lighter and lower in alcohol than the previous vintage, this takes the flavors up a notch, with a leesy, textural, refreshing mouthfeel. Grapefruit and lime rind are among the highlights, setting up a tart, dry, mineral-soaked finish.
Name: Chehalem 2013 Ridgecrest Vineyards Grüner Veltliner (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: Aromas of lemon curd and lemon pith are bright on the nose. The wine has a nice level of minerality on the palate, with flavors of green apple and fresh picked apricot that lead into a dry, zesty finish.
Name: Count Károlyi 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Pannon)

Description: Faint vanilla and lovely creaminess play around the richly contrasting flavors of sumptuous, bright blossom honey cut by zesty, tart lemon-peel notes. Here and there a notion of passion fruit appears, highlighting the linear, zesty and yet totally rich nature of this seductive wine. An intriguing play between two extremes.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2011 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Sultry notions of honeycomb, pine sap and something more tropical—perhaps pineapple, perhaps passion fruit—converge in an incredibly concentrated and at the same time tight and light-footed palate. Passion fruit notes intensify on the palate and while this is very sweet, racy, zesty acidity holds wonderful sway. This expresses the much-lauded purity of Eiswein perfectly.
Name: Nigl 2012 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The light amber color already promises concentration. What follows is the complex and almost mystical sweetness of candied citrus—sweet orange and tart grapefruit are recognizable, as is candied whole mandarine, all in a linear, tight but lucsious package, cut by a streak of racy, wonderfully piercing acidity.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2012 Eiswein Exquisit Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: A wonderfully pure red-apple note is the first hallmark of this dry and harmonious sparkling wine, made from 100% Grüner Veltliner. The mousse is soft and fine, and lets the fruit speak a little louder than the autolysis, giving this a refreshing and very charming edge. The apple notes take on a delicious baked character on the finish. This is the sort of sparkling apéritif that will please both novices and connoisseurs with both depth and length.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2008 Méthode Jurtschitsch Brut Nature Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Notes of lemon peel, grass and Red Delicious apples mingle to create a wonderfully harmonious but light-footed sparkling wine with wonderfully soft bubbles. There is a yeasty backbone that lends both structure and length, while the bright acidity balances and sparkles. This is an incredibly versatile apéritif with length that will easily tackle canapés.
Name: Szigeti NV Brut Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Savory varietal notes creep in and give a food-friendly edge of spice to this light-bodied sparkling wine. The fizz is frothy and refreshing, and there is a pleasant focus of acidity that keeps this very lively. If you are looking for a wine that will go with food and nibbles, here is your dry-finishing apéritif.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2008 Méthode Jurtschitsch Brut Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Zesty, superfresh citrus and apple notes set the tone of this light-footed, slender fizz that is dry, vivacious and refreshing, with just a little yeastiness. Its a classy little apéritif whose lightness of touch will make every conversation sparkling.
Name: Steininger 2012 Flaschengärung Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: A directly appealing wine with notes of peppery spice, stone fruit and citrus zest. It drinks just about dry, with fleshy stone fruit flavors and a good framework of acidity.
Name: Sineann 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe white grapefruit and lychee notes perfume this refreshing, easy-drinking Grüner Veltliner. On the palate, gooseberry and lime flavors are delicate in concentration but it finishes with an invigorating brace of crushed minerals.
Name: Fulkerson 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While the nose is demure with delicate notes of apple and lemon, the palate on this Grüner Veltliner is ripe with fleshy gooseberry flavor. It's delicate in flavor concentration, but overall, refreshing and brisk.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lavishly floral with notes of orange blossom and lemon candy, Konstantin Frank's Grüner Veltliner is another standout for the region. Dry and medium-bodied in style, the palate bursts with crisp white peach and nectarine against a backdrop of lime zest and mineral tones.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Grüner Veltliner is fairly new to the Finger Lakes, but Hazlitt's exemplifies the grape variety's promise in the region. Touched with honeycomb and lemon on the nose, it's ripe and rich on the palate with concentrated flavors of white peach, melon and apricot. Bright with acidity, it finishes long with hints of green herb and lime.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A perfect dry white wine for warm weather sipping, when a cold salad or assortment of salty cheeses and snacks are on the menu. Gooseberry, grapefruit and a touch of white peach fruit flavors anchor this racy, ripe and refreshing wine.
Name: Pacific Rim 2013 Spring Creek Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of pressed apple and pear are savory and earthy on this brisk, medium-bodied Grüner Veltliner. There's a dusty minerality that lingers through the midpalate, but the finish is bright and lemony.
Name: Fulkerson 2012 William Vigne Grüner Veltliner (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Dusty mineral tones and pressed apple aromas lend a savoriness to this dry, full-bodied Grüner Veltliner. The palate boasts a fresher fruit profile, with bright apple and lemon flavors that wrap up briskly on the finish.
Name: Stony Lonesome 2012 Estate Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Description: This wine is so savory, it is hard to decide what notions appear uppermost. There definitely is white pepper, also some soy-sauce depth, dried hayflowers and arugula pungency, all framed by ripe pear flavors and displayed on a textured, refreshing canvas.
Name: Eichinger 2013 Wechselberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Spritzy lemon, peppery arugula and an almost salty edge provide lots of interest in this super-refreshing and really lip-smacking light white.
Name: Nigl 2013 Senftenberger Piri Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Less aromatically forward than its peers, this suggests slightly riper fruit. A welcome mineral focus comes on the concentrated, textured palate that boasts zesty citrus peel and a wonderfully straight, upright backbone. This will come into its own by 2015–2016.
Name: Hirsch 2013 Kammerer Heiligenstein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Pure lemon zest mingles with peppery pungency and makes for pepper-speckled refreshment. Linearity and focus abound and this wine is so lively, it seems to fast-forwarded into the future.
Name: Bründlmayer 2013 Berg Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Soft and inviting ripeness of yellow plums leads to a spicy, peppery and wonderfully focused citrus center. This is a wine you want to savor, easing out every last notion of the layered spice. While it is fresh now, it can certainly keep and will shine especially when paired with hearty, Austrian-style food—Wiener Schnitzel, anyone?
Name: Eichinger 2013 Hasel Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Lifted, pear-scented freshness dominates the nose while the palate is soft but has a pleasing and linear citrus focus. This is poised and offers sophisticated refreshment.
Name: Steininger 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The combination of ripe, almost tropical fruit notes, bright, lifting acidity and a meltingly rounded mouthfeel makes for ultimate refreshment. Depth of flavor keeps you going back for more of that zesty length.
Name: Schwarzböck 2013 Vier Gärten Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Aromatically, this wine does not want to give too much away yet. However, the citrus focus of its linear palate and the refreshment that it holds are already evident. This is Grüner for grown-ups with a neat dose of peppery pungency and great concentration.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2013 Löss Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Hints of passion fruit play appetizingly about the more usual pear aromas, and the palate displays a winning combination of fresh, zesty lemon and white pepper. It finishes with pleasant length.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2013 Fass 4 Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: White currant, green pear and peppery arugula rule this crisp white. It bursts with very ripe sweet, juicy pears on the palate, making for  savory sipping with lots of resonance, with or without food. Drink now.
Name: Buchegger 2013 Gelbling Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The intriguing spice of grapefruit foliage and freshly cut grapefruit peel haunts the aromatic edges of this subtle and rounded but still focused wine. Peppery watercress flares up, too. This delightful wine will perform miracles with food but keep your interest  on its own, too.
Name: Lenikus 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: It shows total citrus focus, linearity and precision, fringed by green pear peel and peppery leaves. Superior freshness and definite ageing potential show in the tingling, invigorating acidity.
Name: Hermann Moser 2013 Karmeliterberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The fragrant freshness of cut Conference pears with grassy undertones promises immediate invigoration. A background of peppery savoriness, spicy length and mouthfeel destine this for food.
Name: Glatzer 2013 Dornenvogel Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Subtle peach notes lead on to an elegant but almost meltingly rich palate that is nonetheless structured by fresh, lemony acidity. Rich but streamlined, it confounds with its complexity. Great peppery finish.
Name: Josef Jamek 2013 Stein am Rain Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The archetypal pear flavors of Grüner Veltliner come to the fore: fresh, flavorsome and crunchy green Conference pear in this case, with zesty acidity in a linear, refreshing and zesty frame. This is concentrated and totally refreshing.
Name: Jäger 2013 Selection Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Full-bodied and elegant, it discloses aromas of white spring flowers, aromatic herbs and stone fruit. The juicy palate offers tart green apple, yellow peach, ripe cantaloupe, white pepper and mint alongside crisp acidity. The lingering finish closes on an energizing mineral note.
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2011 Praepositus Veltliner (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: Freshly milled white pepper and lemon zest are inviting on the nose. Spice and lemony freshness continue on the palate where they are joined by riper fruit notes of yellow and red apples, always keeping that refreshing and lively zing.
Name: Wieninger 2013 Herrenholz Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Green pear peel, fresh cucumber and ripe, golden pears all unite to make a rounded, toothsome food wine that's also crisp and savory.
Name: Glatzer 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Ripe Concord pear and an intriguing, phenolic mouthfeel combine in this highly drinkable light white. There is enough weight to support food and a pleasing hint of savoriness as well as depth.
Name: Hugl-Wimmer 2013 Wimmer Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Still closed, this will take a little time to come out of its shell. But it's worth the wait: there's pepper, zestiness and a streamlined, structured body. One word comes to mind: sleekness.
Name: Jäger 2013 Klaus Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fresh lemon juice on cut Conference pear constitutes the main flavor on this tight, light and slender white. It displays focus, a precise edge of minerality and lovely phenolic texture.
Name: Markus Huber 2013 Obere Steigen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Freshly cut pear peel and savory, almost nutty herbs announce a richer style with plump notions of yellow pear and plum. Savory nuttiness is foremost, playing on the rounded and beautifully textured palate. A lasting notion of white pepper makes for an intriguing finish. This has “food wine” written all over it, and will shine on the table.
Name: Loimer 2013 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: It offers exuberant green pears in a linear body, shaped slenderly by citrus zest. It resonates with ripeness, savory spice and mineral focus.
Name: Stadt Krems 2013 Weinzierlberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Fragrant, refreshing, spritzy, citrusy—this wine is like a dictionary of descriptive Grüner terms. It even provides an edge of that much-loved pepperiness.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Very ripe, juicy yellow pears are the central feature on nose and palate of this well-balanced, concentrated and refreshing wine. Zesty lemon acidity lends poise and length.
Name: Machherndl 2013 Bachsatz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Lifted lemony freshness greets the nose, while savoriness dominates the palate. It offers pear and citrus, as well as riper stone-fruit, earthy hints and pungent watercress and white pepper—all packaged in a ripe but streamlined body.
Name: Türk 2013 Kremser Weinberge Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Still closed, this only begins to show its fresh, rounded passion fruit and mango-cocktail flavors after it has had some air. The palate is concentrated and precise. This will come into its own by 2015.
Name: Türk 2013 Vom Urgestein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Hints of ripe apricot and ethereal notes of crushed boxwood add interest to the more usual aromatic spectrum of green pear and white pepper. A lovely phenolic grip provides extra dimension and calls for food. Rounded, intriguing but still very refreshing.
Name: Felsner 2013 Moosburgerin Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Floral hints of acacia blossom play with ripe pear notes on the nose. The palate offers pleasant spritz and a real twist of that white pepper desired in Grüner Veltliner—ideal for summer days and immediate drinking.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2013 Freiberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This still needs a little time to come into its own but all the principal features are present. A concentrated palate provides texture framed by fresh acidity, linear length and fleshy fruit, hinting at ripe pears and yellow plums.
Name: Weszeli 2013 Steinhaus Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: It conveys the purest scent of cut green pears, a crisp but cushioned body, and zesty, citrusy freshness. It's very complete and for immediate consumption.
Name: Buchegger 2013 Holzgasse Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Freshly cut green pear aromatically leads on to that white pepper spice so often looked for in Grüner. Here it shows in abundance, in duet with ripe but refreshing lemon acidity.
Name: Anton Bauer 2013 Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Enticing notions of passion fruit and peach grab the attention first, but there is almost more interest in the peppery, zesty mouth-feel. Fresh but rounded.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2013 Birthal Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Restrained notes of ripe pear gain savory interest from herbal notes reminiscent of curry leaf and lovage. There's also ample spice in this eminently gastronomic wine with a refreshing, super-clean finish.
Name: Hillinger 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Just a touch of fresh citrus plays on the nose, but the palate delivers textured mouthfeel and peppery, leafy freshness. Although the acidity is cushioned, the wine is refreshing and leaves a super-clean finish.
Name: Wieninger 2013 Vienna Hills Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: A hint of passion fruit plays on the nose of this subtle wine. The real strength lies in its textured midpalate that reveals soft pepper notes and a backbone that will make it a winner on the table. Enjoy the savory aftertaste.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2013 Haidviertel Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Texture and spice are the main features of this concentrated white with citrus zest on the palate. The aromatics still need to wake up; with time, they will shine. For now, grapefruit zest will suffice.
Name: Sepp Moser 2013 Von den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This subtle but refreshing wine strikes a wonderful balance between fresh pear notes and citrus zestiness and texture. It's spicy and versatile.
Name: Setzer 2013 Ausstich Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Expressive notes of white pepper, watercress and citrus make this a quintessential and zippy Weinviertel Grüner, where the variety is known in the local dialect as “Pfefferl”, i.e. little pepper.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2013 Hermanschachern Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: While the citrus aromas are subtle, the linear palate discloses lemony concentration and green pear, lending precision and structure rather than aromatics. The wine calls for sturdy food.
Name: Unger 2013 Zieselrain Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A wonderful mix of white pepper, fresh lemon zest, herbal pungency and green pear flavors makes Grüner Veltliner such a success. Here it all comes in one focused, friendly and easy package, with peppery length.
Name: Loimer 2013 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Savory herbs like lovage and arugula play the starring role; underneath lies fresh citrus and some wonderful spritz. This longs for food and will be heaven with cheese.
Name: Nigl 2013 Freiheit Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: It has fragrant, lifted freshness and a seam of lemony acidity that focuses the textured palate. Slender and refreshing, with long, lemony finish.
Name: Müller-Grossmann 2013 Grosser Satz Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Riper notions of juicy yellow pear play here, fringed by peppery leaves of arugula and zesty lemon freshness. It's focused, precise and concentrated.
Name: Bründlmayer 2013 Kamptaler Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Very fresh green pear notes are joined by riper notions of passion fruit. These linger on the palate where peppery phenolics add structure and depth.
Name: Hermann Moser 2013 Per Due Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Slender zippiness supports fresh lemon and white pepper notes on this tight, light-footed and linear white.
Name: Josef Schmid 2013 Satzen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A subtle mix of pear and pepper plays on the nose. A seam of clean, fresh acidity leads to a concentrated, peppery palate where zestiness reigns, made more interesting by the aromatic pungence of lovage and arugula.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2013 Stein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fragrant Conference pears, lemon zest and an edge of white pepper deliver on nose and palate. Light, crisp and totally invigorating.
Name: Brandl 2013 Weinberge Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Rich stone fruit adds to the pleasure of this lemon and arugula-scented white that manages to remain crisp despite its inviting and luscious ripeness.
Name: Fritsch 2013 Vom Donaulöss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Green pear peel and citrus zest promise refreshment, framed on a linear, focused palate with lots of citrus precision. Invigorating and clean-cut, this will shine on a hot day.
Name: Weszeli 2013 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Green pears and ivy leaves, together with zesty lemon, bring a very slender and precise focus to this wine that promises refreshment and ageing mileage. Drink now or keep until 2015–2016.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2013 Franziskus Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Ripe peach mingles with a mix of phenolics and zestiness on the concentrated midpalate. Structured and spicy, it delivers peppery impact and a prolonged finish.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2013 T 26 Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fresh pear peel and citrus shimmer on the nose. The palate delivers zesty freshness, gentle texture with a little spritz and enticing arugula and white pepper spice in a rounded body.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2013 Von Den Rieden Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Expect zesty, rounded and spritzy freshness from this fruit-driven little tonic; it's a pear and citrus party in the glass.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Lemon, lime and lightness with edges of white pepper and arugula make for a super-refreshing, light crisp wine. Drink now.
Name: Setzer 2013 Easy To Drink Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Green pear peel and flesh dominate nose and palate and make for a fruit-driven, slender but concentrated white. The melting texture is an added bonus.
Name: Stadt Krems 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Lychee and peach notes recall ripe fruit, tempered by lemony freshness on the focused palate. Nonetheless, this wine is rounder, suggesting soft, runny cheeses as an ideal match. Overtones of pepper are a bonus.
Name: Weixelbaum 2013 Ried Wechselberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A ripe, rounded notion comes to play on this crisp white, imbuing it with additional body and rich lychee flavors. A fruity little wonder for immediate drinking pleasure.
Name: Winzer Krems 2013 Sandgrube 13 Edition Chremisa Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Freshness, spritz and a lemony citrus focus are the attractive main features here, making for poised refreshment.
Name: Brandl 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe Concord pear and lemon zest beckon on the nose, and a lively lemon vein goes right through this refreshing little number. Drink now, preferably with lots of sunshine.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2013 Am Berg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Tinged with green pear, the gentle palate has a core of buffered acidity, fine texture and a focus of lemony intensity.
Name: Nastl 2013 Kittmannsberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Zippy green pear and a spritz of lemon make this an inviting and almost thirst-quenching choice. Poised acidity pulls through to the zesty finish.
Name: Machherndl 2013 Kollmütz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aged partly in casks made from acacia wood, this structured wine opens with aromas of Alpine wild flowers, herbs, green apple and spice. The juicy palate offers apple, pear and intense white pepper alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Cantina Valle Isarco 2012 Aristos Grüner Veltliner (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: Lifted green pear and passion fruit come in a clean but slender package that offers easy, zingy refreshment.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2013 Goettweiger Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Restrained and soft on the nose, this light-bodied white offers subtle lemon zestiness and a phenolic seam that provide structure and food-friendliness with a savory, almost herbal edge.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2013 Terrassen Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Texture rather than aroma is the main appeal of this slender white. The nose is restrained but the palate has spicy hints of pepper. While citrus dominates, it also shows a riper notion of tangy passion fruit.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2013 Wieden & Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Peppery arugula leaves and ripe passion fruit are a winning combination on this textured, spritzy white. In particular the passion fruit lingers attractively on the palate. Drink as fresh as possible.
Name: Hermann Moser 2013 Gelbling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A fresh scent of green pears greets the nose. What follows comes in a light, crisp citrus vein, supported by a rounded mouthfeel. A refreshing wine for immediate drinking.
Name: Hugl-Wimmer 2013 Hugl Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A scented mix of ivy leaves, green pears and citrus segues into a spicy, peppery but crisp palate. A light and refreshing quaff, this is easily enjoyed with or without food. Drink now.
Name: Markus Huber 2013 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Ripe yellow pears and an earthy edge knit together this refreshing yet concentrated white that finishes with the clean tang of lemon zest.
Name: Winzer Krems 2013 Kremser Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This polished, spicy wine is loaded with crisp green apple, white pepper and steely mineral sensations. The juicy fruit is balanced by lively acidity that gives a linear character and leaves the mouth feeling fresh and clean.
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: A hint of lime and green pear peel, a touch of pepper and passion fruit: this subtle and light white does not give too much away. However its acidity and texture make it a versatile and satisfying food partner.
Name: Höpler 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Rather quiet at first, this wine unfurls into a soft but textured palate. This balanced white lives more off structure than aroma; the herbal white pepperiness is to be savored.
Name: Josef Jamek 2013 Ried Achleiten Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Opening with a clean-cut scent of ripe green pears this has refreshing, lemony zip in a rounded, soft body.
Name: Laurenz V. 2013 Laurenz V and Sophie Singing Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A profusion of green Conference pears and refreshing spritz make this crisp and pale white ideal for a summer party.
Name: Nastl 2013 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Grassy overtones and freshly clipped boxwood turn this into an aromatic, fragrant wine with a lithe body but lots of aromatic depth, with hints of tropical passion fruit underneath. Drink now.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2013 Heideboden Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Green pear aromas are joined by a playful, floral note and lifted lightness; on the slender palate there is peppery arugula, too. A super-refreshing summer white.
Name: Markus Huber 2013 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)
