Description: There's lots of zesty lemon on nose and palate; all that freshness is buffered by a textural and super-savory element on the midpalate. This balanced wine delivers quietly but convincingly.
Name: Weingut Christ 2013 Bruch Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Almost billowy like a cloud on a summer sky, it combines the virtues of easy but rounded refreshment, subtle citrus and pear aromas with perfect lightness.
Name: Anton Bauer 2013 Gmörk Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Very ripe flavors of yellow pear gain focus on the palate where they are framed by grapefruit zest. There's an earthy pull, too, and lots and lots of texture.
Name: Mantlerhof 2013 Lössterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Clean, tight and crisp, this treads a straight, citrusy path seamed by a phenolic touch and the aroma of crisp, green pears.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2013 Austrian Pepper Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Creamy pear with overtones of mint presents an inviting nose for this soft but streamlined wine. Ever-so-slight fizz lends additional freshness.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2013 Von Den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: The nose is subdued and rounded, while some green pear aromatics play on the palate of this mild wine. It still takes time to come out of its shell, but will become full-fruited and open up by 2015.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2013 Hundsleiten Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Tropical hints of passion fruit join freshly cut pear in the aroma stakes. The palate is zesty, fresh and ever so slightly spritzy, making for easy, very enjoyable drinking.
Name: Gruber Röschitz 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Citrus scents mingle with green pear peel. A textural vestige of phenolics suggests that this wine belongs on the table.
Name: Netzl 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: A little lemon, a little pear and a little spritz on the palate are backed by wonderful texture. This will be even better when served with food, even though the lemony acidity on the round body makes for easy drinking.
Name: Soellner 2013 Hengstberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Ripe and aromatic yellow pears on the nose combine with bright lemon freshness on the palate to result in a zingy summer wine. Drink now.
Name: Zantho 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Ripeness and a rich, phenolic edge dominate. Savory notes of lovage and an earthy undertone would make this a great companion for ripe, soft cheeses.
Name: Stadlmann 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: An almost tropical hint of passion fruit and mango enters the lemony pepper realms of Grüner: an intriguing variation on this soft, pleasing white.
Name: Lenz Moser 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Floral notes enhance the pear flavors and lend playfulness to the rounded but light body that also offers edges of spicy white pepper.
Name: Pleil 2013 Pfaffenhölzl Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A fresh and zesty nose leds to a concentrated and refreshing body with echoes of that wonderful pepperiness. Light but very enjoyable.
Name: Gruber Röschitz 2013 Hundspoint Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: It shows an altogether riper aspect of Grüner. Yellow pear, yellow plum and notions of peach appear and give way to a rounded, generous palate with lots of phenolic backbone and structure. It can definitely shine with substantial food.
Name: Fritsch 2013 Steinberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Crisp green pear, a touch of lemon and even some of that much-vaunted pepperiness find their way into this unobtrusive but refreshing white, which also boasts some welcome spritz.
Name: Pratsch 2013 Made With Organic Grapes Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Soft and ripe green pears play on nose and palate where that textural, phenolic mouthfeel is the main feature, suggesting that this belongs firmly on the table.
Name: Winzer Krems 2013 Kellermeister Privat Kremser Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The nose is subdued but savory. There is also slight spritz and a pliable, rounded freshness in this uncomplicated but friendly white.
Name: Martinshof 2013 Hausberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Peppery notes of arugula and fresh lemon acidity add interest to this easy-drinking white.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2013 Hochterassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Roundness and spice feature strongly here. A phenolic midpalate gives backbone and suggests that this is best had with food where its structure will come into play.
Name: Soellner 2013 Wogenrain Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Ripe and juicy green and yellow pears abound on the nose, while the palate is soft, fresh and makes for easy summer drinking.
Name: Schwarzböck 2013 Vom Bisamberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Subtle notes of green and yellow pears play on the nose and the almost gentle palate. Refreshing but easygoing for uncomplicated summer drinking.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2013 Zeiseneck Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Fresh green pear in a light, crisp and uncomplicated body spell refreshment. Drink now.
Name: Unger 2013 Q Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Spritzy freshness, lemony hints and a slender body combine to make an uncomplicated but rewarding summer wine.
Name: Pleil 2013 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Ripe yellow pears are barely tempered by citrus freshness. The palate has a slight bitter note but lovely ripeness nonetheless.
Name: Fritsch 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Savory, citrusy and pear-scented, this is fresh, crisp and light, making it ideal for a party.
Name: Winzer Krems 2013 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Soft and pliable in body, it has gentle citrus hints and crisp acidity.
Name: Landhaus Mayer 2013 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fresh apple and pear aromas are marked by touches of blossom and smoke in this unusual, yet thoroughly enjoyable Gruner Veltliner from Long Island. Round and rich, the palate is concentrated, with honeyed peach and apricot flavors, but balanced by soft acidity and a delicate mineral tone.
Name: One Woman 2012 Grüner Veltliner (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This fresh and fruity wine opens with aromas of lychee, white fragrant flowers, exotic fruit and beeswax. The fresh palate offers pineapple, white peach, melon, lemon peel and Alpine herbs.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Klaus Lentsch 2012 Eichberg Veltliner (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: Rich aromas of late summer are here: the ripe peel of yellow pears, luscious peach and yellow Mirabelle plum plus some dried hayflower notes. There is power and depth, along with some alcoholic heat and balancing acidity—beautiful now but it will get even better. Drink until 2020.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2012 Alte Reben Berglagen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Plump, ripe apricots play above a peppery, lemony core that bursts with juiciness and teases with salty minerality that keeps you wanting more. Delicious now, it promises lots of mileage. Drink until 2020.
Name: Eichinger 2012 Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Red-cheeked apples, juicy pear and Mirabelle plums comes out to play here, tightly held by brilliant acidity. The undertone of herbal savoriness is glimpsed and will come to the fore as this ages. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Josef Jamek 2012 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A spark of flint leaps out of the glass, followed by green plums and Conference pear. That stony touch also tempers the concentrated body and runs from start to pleasantly long finish, ending in a pleasantly bitter sting. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2012 Von Stein Berglagen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Herbal touches of chervil and dill combine with grapefruit zest and a slender but muscular body. Shades of pepper spice are revealed on the tight palate that culminates in a long, delicious and savory finish. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2012 Loiserberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Lifted, lemony freshness mixes with lime zest on the nose. Underneath some pungent arugula also dances on the palate, where pepperiness and fresh acidity guarantee pleasure with this concentrated but toned white.
Name: Eichinger 2012 Gaisberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Perfumed green pears, overlaid with the floral charm of summer blossom, characterize this concentrated yet lithe wine. Nonetheless, it is based on a firm core that suggests the ancient rocks where the vines grew. Little by little, a miso-like saltiness also reveals itself.
Name: Lagler 2012 Steinborz Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Pear, arugula, white pepper and apricots take turns in dazzling nose and palate. A serious, concentrated and mineral vein of power also courses through this sleek wine, which holds even more future promise.
Name: Allram 2012 Gaisberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Aromas of flint and meadow flowers mingle in this mineral but juicy and joyous wine. Grapefruit zest underlines the lively acidity. If you are after concentrated, zippy linearity, this is it.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2012 Käferberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A touch of flintstone, a hint of soy-sauce savoriness and the ripe but fresh scent of green pears all bode well for a grippy, concentrated wine. It features a zesty, refreshing core and a lovely notion of wet pebbles. The body is slender and tight.
Name: Unger 2012 Oberfeld Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: In this restrained wine, red apple and green pear flavors framed by a mineral backdrop suggest both austerity and longevity. There is well-controlled power here and surprising depth with just a twist of white pepper and a pure finish.
Name: Unger 2012 Gotschelle Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Ripe, round and savory notes emerge, almost with a touch of miso. The palate is a repository for zesty green citrus flavors and more of that enticing spice.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2012 Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: While the nose discloses little, the palate displays an array of apricot, sharp arugula and white pepper with some grapefruit zest. Focused and streamlined, this wine delivers lip-smacking freshness, great concentration and a super-clean finish. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2012 Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The wine reveals savory depth that is almost soy-sauce-like, along with hints of nutmeg, white pepper and some arugula. They harmonize with ripe green pear fruit in this typically spicy white that finishes with lip-smacking and clean zest.
Name: Eder 2012 Süssenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The clean-cut lift of fresh green pear and grapefruit peel reveals fruity and juicy concentration on the midpalate, underlined by rocky minerality.
Name: Högl 2012 Schöne Alte Parzellen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The delicate smoke and hazelnut scent of oak shines through and makes a frame for ripe apricot and Mirabelle plums. The palate is soft and rounded, set off by pizzazz from the lively acidity that underlines the juicy core.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2012 Sauberg Tradition Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Grapefruit zest dominates this wine right now, but ripe honeydew melon also is shining though. As the wine opens up, it also reveals peppery, tangy spice and a refreshingly clean finish.
Name: Gruber Röschitz 2012 Hundspoint Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Dried fruit flavors and the bitter tang of dark fir honey are spiked by concentrated lemony acidity. The nose and palate are round and rich, but tamed by acidity that runs through like an electric current. This rich, dry but distinctly late-harvest style wine, with just a touch of residual sugar, finishes with triumphant apple fruit and lemon zest.
Name: Hager Matthias 2012 Seeberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Really ripe red and baked apples pervade nose and palate with their deep and juicy fruitiness. A lively acidic tang and midpalate concentration lead to a deeply satisfying, apple-charged finish.
Name: Arndorfer 2012 Strasser Winberge Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Green pears announce themselves immediately, followed by riper pear flavors. This makes for a rich but still toned palate, where white pepper and leafy spice also come into play. Muscular but trim, this wine has the concentration to last. Drink until 2020.
Name: Josef Schmid 2012 Kremser Gelbling Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A hint of smoke plays about the nose; likewise, the palate is restrained. This tight, closed wine requires time to let ripe and concentrated pear fruit and lime appear. This long zesty grapefruit finish promises future pleasure. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Allram 2012 Hasel Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: With the appetizing scent of lemon-spiked pear sorbet, it delivers breezy refreshment. A tight, linear body is displayed against a mineral backdrop. The finish is softer than expected, like a caress.
Name: Weixelbaum 2012 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Subdued pear fruit is tightly coiled inside this rich and promising white. For now it has phenolic richness and wonderfully tangy acidity. In time the wine will show the luscious ripeness of this harvest. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2012 Wösendorfer Kollmütz Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Hayflowers, summer meadows and ripe pears are conjured up by this wine. The palate is toned with a harmonious interplay of textural power and streamlined freshness. Grapefruit zestiness and herbal savoriness complete the tableau.
Name: Felsner 2012 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Just faint touches of ripe, yellow pear appear on the nose, suggesting how tightly closed this wine still is. However, the generous palate is full of both green and yellow pears and injections of grapefruit acidity. Tight and long, it's best kept for a while. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Hiedler 2012 Thal Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Just-ripe green pears and scented spring flowers make this a charming proposition. Underneath, a firm and concentrated body unfolds into a refreshing and long finish.
Name: Weixelbaum 2012 Wahre Werte Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Lifted and ultra-clean Conference pear signals a disciplined wine. The linear palate is equally pure, with zesty and fresh acidity against a background of these green pears and a mossy savoriness.
Name: Josef Schmid 2012 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The quiet but full-fruited concentration of ripe yellow pears seems to be distilled here. While the aromatic expression is restrained, the palate shows concentration, warmth and phenolic grip—but an equally concentrated acidity provides backbone and lift.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2012 Gottschelle Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A little smoke, a little pear peel, some aloe vera... Nothing is overdone and all falls into place. On the palate a hint of rich, yeasty nuttiness jostles with ripe fruit, but all is under tight restraint. This wine will take time to show its glorious colors. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Türk 2012 Frechau Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Lemon peel and yeast are in the starring roles for now, showing miso-like savor with smoky edges and glimpses of white pepper. The fruit will come later. For now, this is pure, textural pleasure, with a very clean-cut finish.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2012 Höhereck Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Flint, ripe peaches and golden apricots with the merest hint of vanilla suggest the finest Viennese pastries. This well-judged and super-mellow wine is just rich enough, also giving hints of almond paste and lime peel. There is no heaviness, just velvety mouthfeel and sumptuous length.
Name: Anton Bauer 2012 Grande Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Bruised apple peel, ripe Golden Delicious apples and overtones of aromatic, dark fir honey are an unusual proposition, but a successful and intriguing one here. The palate is full and supple and highlighted by fresh apple acidity while the edges are framed by pleasant phenolic grip. This is a wine for grown-ups.
Name: Arndorfer 2011 Die Leidenschaft Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Very ripe yellow pears set the scene. Richness continues on the palate, with the wine preserving a light touch without sacrificing concentration. Full marks for balance, charm and savory length.
Name: Aigner 2012 Privat Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Tightly closed as a flower bud, this needs time to disclose its secrets. Gentle notes of ripe pear appear on the soft and supple palate. A core of lively acidity will keep the wine alive as it opens up.
Name: Türk 2012 Kremser Sandgrube Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Dried hayflowers, juicy yellow pear and notes of dried coriander leaves are paired with a yeasty dollop of richness. Fruit recedes into the background while leaving layered aromatic play. Clean acidity underlies all, enhancing pairings with meals.
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2012 Wunderburg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: First a faint touch of flint and smoke appears, followed by subtle notes of green pear. Still fairly closed, the wine shows a tight body that will loosen into plumper ripeness. Intimations of orange peel and golden pear promise a great wine with a rich mouthfeel and cleansing acidity.
Name: Hirsch 2012 Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Intensely aromatic Williams Christ pear and minerality combine to make a sleek wine that leaves real impact. The palate is concentrated but toned. Fresh grapefruit zest amid ripe apricots makes this wine vivid and refreshing.
Name: Zull 2012 Äußere Bergen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A little aeration and tropical notes of passion fruit add charm. This wine is restrained at first and stays streamlined along the way. Peppery spice enhances the wonderful refreshment edged with minerality.
Name: Hermann Moser 2012 Hannah Reserve Gelbling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Just a hint of ripe apricot is ready to appear. The rest of the fruit remains locked in a rich but concentrated midpalate where a pleasantly bitter phenolic grip gives extra character. Ripe but spiky acid forms a straight backbone and makes this a wine worth waiting for. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Jäger 2012 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Luscious Mirabelle plums and honey melons are tempered by hints of smoke. The slender palate leaves an impression. Assertive but light, it finishes with a long, clean cut.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2012 In der Schablau Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A touch of flint and hints of gunmetal show amidst yellow grapefruit and lime peel. The body is fresh and zesty but has a fullish core. Within a year or two the aromatics will fully open. Drink as of 2016.
Name: Loimer 2012 Langenlois Spiegel Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Grapefruit peel and ripe Mirabelle plums are just hinted at on this sleek white. Thrilling acidity counters alcoholic warmth and give poise to the concentrated body. It still needs to open up more but promises pleasure.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2012 Wösendorfer Hochrain Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: With a little air this wine will start flirting. Ripe white currant and sweet Golden Delicious apples appear on the palate. A lissom but fruity wine, it carries weight in all the right places.
Name: Stadt Krems 2012 Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Grapefruit zest for now plays the starring role, but time will release riper stone fruit. Peppery edges already promise a great future, along with a long citrus finish.
Name: Hermann Moser 2012 Fortissimo Reserve Gelbling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Ripe Russet apples and a touch of the earthy, calming smell of wet hay introduce this rich, soft and supple white. Acidity tempers the roundness and channels the luscious apple fruit that has a pleasingly long but clean finish.
Name: Martinshof 2012 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Ripe yellow pear, hazelnut and yeast form an alliance on nose and palate. They take turns and swirl in this slender yet concentrated and textured wine. A long finish brings breezy refreshment. T. Edward, The Age of Riesling.
Name: Mantlerhof 2012 Mosburgerin Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Touches of both flint and flowers come to the surface, later joined by gentle woodsmoke. All are held together with tight acidity on a linear but broad body. This achieves wonderful balance and length.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2012 Georgenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Aloe vera, green pear peel and ripe Mirabelle plums charm nose and palate on the soft and ripe palate. Despite the ripeness nothing is overdone and reaches a center of gravity.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2012 Bergdistel Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Conference pear and lemony acidity produce a clean-cut mouthfeel and real refreshment factor. The wine is concentrated but also is lean and soaring, supported by stony minerality.
Name: Jäger 2012 Federspiel Selection Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Ripe yellow plums and juicy yellow pears signal richness that is confirmed on the wonderfully textured, almost grippy palate. Fresh and zesty acidity saves this fullness and gives a lipsmacking finish.
Name: Forstreiter 2012 Tabor Die Rarität Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Barely there but intriguing notes of pears draw you in first. The soft body promises refreshment and rounded pleasure, with just enough phenolic texture and a hint of salty minerality.
Name: Hermann Moser 2012 Der Löss Reserve Gelbling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Restrained notes of woodsmoke play around hints of ripe yellow pear. The palate boasts a backbone of acidity plus that famous varietal phenolic grip. Made for the long run, the wine will turn out rich and layered. Drink from 2016.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2012 Hommage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Although the wine is tightly wound, it's ready to spring into full-fruited apricot action. Mineral tautness runs through this rich, concentrated and seriously-minded white. Drink from 2016.
Name: Weixelbaum 2012 Ried Wechselberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: While this opens slowly, it conveys notions of yellow pear and aloe vera. These turn into full-blown fruit on the textured palate that also shows off a limey tang and enticing green pepper.
Name: Hiedler 2012 Kittmannsberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Juicy yellow pear and a touch of flint play on the mellow, textured body. Ripe apricot and pastry also show through, bringing a balance between zestiness and round flavors.
Name: Anton Bauer 2012 Rosenberg Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Lifted green Conference pears show restraint. The wine also delivers linear freshness and a lime-zesty purity.
Name: Zull 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Ripe Williams Christ pears immediately make their appearance and fill the luscious palate with flavor. A refreshing seam of citrus flavors is guided by taut acidity that keeps you coming back for more.
Name: Lenikus 2012 Der Nussberg Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Flint, smoke and dried hayflowers lead off the aromas. The phenolic midpalate provides focus and a little heft, striking a natural, clean balance.
Name: Setzer 2012 8000 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Honey and dried sultana beckon beyond the evident juicy pear flavors. On the palate texture takes over, with that varietally typical phenolic grip gathering up the fruit. Together with fresh acidity, it creates a harmonious whole.
Name: Wieninger 2012 Nussberg Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Freshly cut pear is exuberant on nose. Rich but toned, the soft palate has a cheeky seam of acidity that delivers both mellow pleasure and refreshment.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2012 Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Nutty richness and yellow plums make for an interesting flavor contrast. This interplay continues on the almost grippy but concentrated palate where nuttiness resonates with pepper spice and herbal savoriness.
Name: Nigl 2012 Privat Senftenberger Pellingen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A yeasty, nutty aroma reaches out of the glass, underlain by ripe Mirabelle plum. The concentrated palate also boasts earthy spice and a plump body toned by acidity. A savory subtext to this wine makes it ideal for subtle, layered dishes. T. Edward, The Age of Riesling.
Name: Mantlerhof 2012 Spiegel Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Notes of juicy, yellow pear and gentle grapefruit zest make for a well-honed wine, with undertones of aloe vera and pepper. The balanced body will impress but still needs time. Drink from 2016.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2012 Black Edition Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Honeyed ripeness and plump yellow plum fruit make this a rounded and fruit-driven joy to drink. This exuberance is tempered by the necessary acid and just an edge of phenolic texture.
Name: Sommer 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Leithaberg)

Description: Sweet pear fruit is highlighted by glints of crisp apple. Together they focus onto a concentrated midpalate where acidity lends a clean-cut finish.
Name: Proidl 2012 Ehrenfels Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Subdued aromas of pear peel give way to fleshy pear fruit framed with grapefruit acidity. Harmonious and reined-in, the wine combines elegance with fruity concentration.
Name: Fritsch 2012 Mordthal Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Yeasty aromas give way to a ripe, plump palate. Varietally typical phenolic richness is kept in check by acidity.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2012 Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Juicy pear mingles into a savory, almost soy-spiced midpalate. Round and rich, it leads to a pleasantly bitter and ultra-clean finish.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2012 Renner Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The rich and concentrated fruit of pear compote fills nose and palate, where it is joined by fresh acidity and a supple, rich mouthfeel. Intriguingly soft at first, the wine reveals a wonderfully steely core.
Name: Weingut Christ 2012 X Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: A restrained and powdery nose of yellow plum and ripe red apple hints at the ripeness, which is fully expressed on the broad palate. The mineral length is promising. Still tight, the wine needs time to come into its full, aromatic own. Drink from 2016.
Name: Forstreiter 2011 Das weiße Mammut Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Restrained but flinty, this is a fresh and mellow wine with enough texture to be serious. Zesty acidity gives a lovely lift.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2012 Hohenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Lifted green pears, ripe lemon rind and yellow plums make for a fruity trio. The supple palate radiates substance and style.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2012 Spies Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Suspicions of pineapple send teasing signals. The ripe yellow plum fruit of the midpalate is streamlined by zesty freshness.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2012 Hengstberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Lemony freshness coupled with notes of gunsmoke and yellow plums play on a plump and rounded palate held in check by fresh acidity.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2012 Loam Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Hayflowers and yeast make for more subdued aromatics. Meanwhile, the palate bursts with baked apples, a fresh roundness and textured layers.
Name: Schwarzböck 2012 Kirchberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Perfumed notions of green pear lie within a supple, rounded body. The zesty acidity is welcome but not dominating and the core of fruit is firm and inviting.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2012 Stein Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Rounded and mellow, with a backbone of lemony acid, this wine convinces on the palate rather than the nose: there's texture, fresh acidity and mouthfilling length.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2012 Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Aromatically subtle but ripe notes of yellow pear match the creamy mouthfeel, which has a pleasantly pebbly undertone and soft, almost cushioned acidity.
Name: Leth 2012 Scheiben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Texture rather than fruit is in the foreground. A peppery core is buffered by ripe phenolics and some creamy lees that make for a round and versatile white.
Name: Fritsch 2012 Schlossberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Hints of pear and grapefruit—still with a little residual fizz—make for fresh and easy drinking. They combine with midpalate texture and a touch of herby, white pepper.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2012 Hundsleiten Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Hints of lovage tantalize on the nose. The palate is soft and generous. Juicy pear and a pervading spiciness of white pepper create savory layers.
Name: Martinshof 2012 Hausberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Pear-scented, this supple white delivers straight down the line without any annoying frills. The wine is balanced, clean and comes with poised acidity.
Name: Leth 2012 Steinagrund Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: One of the few varietal bottlings produced in the state, this concrete-fermented wine brings notes of straw, wet stone, herbs and citrus zest. It's tart and mouthwatering with lemony acidity and a textured feel, screaming out for shellfish to be served alongside it.
Name: Syncline 2012 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Compote of yellow plums interacts with earthy, wet hay flavors in this richly textured white. Pleasant hints of herbal savoriness and some lemony highlights also make themselves known.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2012 Eichenstaude Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Plump and fruity roundness without much aromatic fanfare make this a balanced and honest wine with a lovely seam of acidity.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2012 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While youthful on the nose with scents of fresh apple, citrus and blossom, it feels fleshy on the palate with flavors of ripe pineapple and citrus. Dry in style, it has a plump, full-bodied mouthfeel.
Name: One Woman 2011 Grüner Veltliner (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This wine boasts a creamy palate, with aromas of fresh and baked apples that transition to flavors of apple crumble laced with citrus zest. Concentration, precision and lively acidity mean that this will pair well with many fatty foods. It's glorious now, but its acidity means that you can expect pleasant development over the next five years.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2012 Kellerberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A hint of mossy undergrowth leads on the nose, while lovely notes of white-pepper dusted green and yellow pear unfold on the soft, rounded palate. Those looking for texture as well as flavor will not be disappointed. Those who have the patience to cellar this will be rewarded with complex, mature flavors and great concentration. Drink 2016–2020.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2012 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: An aroma of fresh, green Bartlett-pear peel comes first, then the riper notion of pear compote, with a grippy, lime-zest accent and a dash of pepper. Waves of flavor unfold on the tongue and give exquisite length. It has ample mileage to develop; enjoy it now while primary and zippy or wait for mellowed richness later. Either way, it belongs on the table. Drink 2014–2020.
Name: Pratsch 2012 Steinberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Enticing and smoky hints of lime zest mixed with green pear hit the nose immediately. On the palate, even more fruit follows: A mix of green and yellow pear, with some apricot coming through as well. The rounded, rich mouthfeel is prevented from any undue plumpness by vivid acidity and a tingling, peppery finish. Drink 2014–2020.
Name: Pratsch 2012 Steinberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Zesty, grippy, dry and flinty are words that spring to mind for this straight-laced, very zingy white. It shows little more fruit than lime and Meyer lemon right now, but that makes it refreshing and a winner with seafood.
Name: Pratsch 2012 Rotenpüllen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Lightly fined and unfiltered, it's slightly cloudy in appearance with notes of mineral, citrus, herbs and spice. Aged partly in neutral oak, with the rest in stainless steel, the flavors are light, with a creamy midpalate and tart, electric acids, that verge on sour. Pair this with shellfish to see it at its best.
Name: W.T. Vintners 2012 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: This is a beautifully structured wine that has ripe apple flavor, as well as delicate acidity and minerality. There is a sprinkle of pepper, crisp citrus and a spicy aftertaste. This is a fine wine with taut texture that promises a good future. Drink from 2015. Screwcap.
Name: F X Pichler 2012 Loibner Steinertal Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The Singerriedel, one of Wachau's most famous vineyards, is a steep terraced hill above Spitz. With its great exposure, it is able to produce ripe, very rich wines like this. To contrast, there is a tight, steely texture with intense acidity that promises aging. Drink from 2016.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2012 Singerriedel Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This is a powerful wine that's very richly textured and with a structure that promises aging. It has weight and superripe peach and apricot flavors. There is a fine cut of acidity to give both freshness and aging potential. Drink from 2016.
Name: Bründlmayer 2012 Lamm Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: From one of the oldest vineyards in Austria, this is a hugely ripe and intense wine. It has obvious power and concentration balanced with flavorful acidity and creamy pear. Rich, full bodied and dense, it is still young and should not be drunk before 2015.
Name: Forstreiter 2011 Tabor Reserve Die Räritat Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine has a full-bodied character that is very ripe. Pepper dominates the flavors, showing off the quince and pear fruits. There is perhaps too much sulfur at this touch, so let it blow off when opening and before drinking. This wine has huge potential to age, so don't drink before 2015.
Name: F X Pichler 2012 Dürnsteiner Liebenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: There is a peppery character to this fabulous wine, both from its aroma and its flavor. That gives both richness and adds to the dense, complex texture. The wine, with its finely textured acidity ,needs age over several years. Drink from 2016.
Name: Bründlmayer 2012 Käferberg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is a super-ripe, rich wine that's very full in the mouth. It has an opulent feel to it, while also retaining acidity and crisp lemon and apple flavors. The aftertaste brings out pepper as well as a more mineral character. Drink from 2014.
Name: F X Pichler 2012 Loibner Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This is as serious as Grüner gets. It's a very rich wine, fully structured, packed with ripe apricot flavors with a touch of lime. The texture is dense, mineral still very young. With concentration and young acidity, it needs to age. Drink from 2017.
Name: Bründlmayer 2012 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is a big, spicy wine that has exotic flavors of mangoes and kumquats, as well as a firm texture. It's a serious, concentrated wine with its natural exuberance tamed by a tight texture and the promise of acidity. Don't drink yet, wait until 2015. Screwcap. Artisanal Cellars, Select Wines.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2011 Höhereck Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Very mineral in character, this wine is named after a former priest of Dürnstein who renovated the village church. It is certainly ripe, while very textured and chalky in character, with its acidity whirling around the glass. There's great concentration as well, beautifully smoothed out by the spice and crisp apple balance. Screwcap. Artisanal Cellars, Select Wines.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2011 Bergdistel Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This is a fruity wine that attractively layers apples, pears and quince. There is just a touch of pepper to give interest to this full-bodied and ripe wine. Acidity shows at the end to bring a crisp, tight aftertaste. Drink from 2015.
Name: F X Pichler 2012 Dürnsteiner Kellerberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Wood aging brings out a totally different side of Grüner. It adds tropical fruit flavors, a richer texture and a fuller, more Burgundian character. This is an exceptional wine that could well age. Drink now and until 2019.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2010 Black Edition Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a full, aromatic and rich wine that is packed with ripe tropical and white fruits. It has crispness as well, giving a more mineral and zesty texture. There's a characteristic touch of pepper along with a dry aftertaste that offers a strong contrast. This is a fine wine, full of character and ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2011 Grande Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The wine has a warm, rich feel to it while remaining fresh. It has a sense of gravitas with concentrated pear and peach fruit flavors over a mineral texture. The wine is still young, showing too much exuberant acidity. Drink from 2015. Screwcap.
Name: Bründlmayer 2012 Loiser Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is a full, opulent wine that is delicious with acidity and spice. Fragrant grapefruit and citrus notes complement rich apple flavors on the palate. The wine has many years to age and achieve balance between its structure and fruitiness. Drink from 2015.
Name: Loimer 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A strongly spicy, rich wine, this has great concentration and an intense, dense texture.There is weight with plenty of ripe tropical fruits to contrast pronounced black pepper and bitter almond character. It's still young, so don't drink before 2015. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2012 Schiefer Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a really rich wine that has great concentration and richness. It reflects the natural pepper and spice character of Grüner along with tight minerality, a firm texture and considerable aging potential. Drink from 2016.
Name: Weszeli 2011 Purus Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: There is such pure fruit in this crisp, clean wine. Apples and green plums lend a sharp line of freshness and acidity. At the finish, the wine is richer with hints of peppery spice. Screwcap.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2011 Weissenkirchner Steinriegel Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: While it feels rich and round, this is also a wine with a crisp side to it. Acidity cuts through ripe pear, apricot and lychee flavors, giving a decidedly crisp balance. It's a wine that is already ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Josef Schmid 2011 Kremser Gebling Erste Lage Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is an intensely mineral wine that's wonderfully crisp as well as rich. It is strongly textured and tight with acidity, structure, along with powerful pepper and ripe pear flavors. This is a wine for aging, don't drink before 2016. Screwcap.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2012 Steinportz Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A single-vineyard wine from Spitz in the Wachau, this is both crisp and roundly rich. Its weight comes from the superripe fruits that are underpinned by strong pepper and peach flavors. There is a mineral edge to keep everything in order. Drink from 2015.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2012 Obere Steilterrassen Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This big, powerful wine is full of rich white and citrus fruits that are laced with spice and pepper. The wine is full bodied and intensely ripe, with the roundness contrasting with a tangy, mineral edge. Drink from 2015. Screwcap.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2011 Lindberg Erste Lage Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Mineral in character, this is a ripe wine with tight texture as well as a touch of oak aging. It's dense, spicy and full bodied but with bright acidity behind the rich fruit and toast, keeping the wine in balance. Keep this ageworthy wine and drink from 2016.
Name: Dürnberg 2012 Rabenstein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine is still young with a sharp edge that needs to soften out. An apple- and quince-flavored wine, it has fine potential for aging, to round out the corners and intensify in fruitiness. Drink from 2015. Screwcap.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2012 Bürsting Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a ripe, smooth wine that has fine acidity and some intense peppery flavors. From the Wachtberg vineyard, it shows great mineral character as well as a dense texture that brings out rich fruits. Age this for another year.
Name: Winzer Krems 2012 Kremser Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a rich, smoothly textured wine that has great fruitiness, as well as a fine amount of spice and acidity. The combination makes for a well-balanced wine that's fresh while ripe and concentrated. Drink from 2014. Screwcap.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2011 Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A juicy, fruity wine, this also has a rich, textured structure that promises aging. Peach and pear flavors are nicely combined with chalky notes, integrated acidity and a zesty, crisp aftertaste. Drink now, but better to wait until 2015. Glass stopper.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2012 Wachtberg Erste Lage Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Fragrant and delicately fruity, this is a lively, bright wine. It shows elegance, apple acidity and a stylish structure of zesty lemon and orange. It's delicious to drink now, but also keep a few bottles until 2019. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2012 Kremser Kogl Bergwein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A ripe and richly fruity wine that has a soft heart, this has generous pear flavor along with a good dollop of spice. The balance comes from the appley acidity and tight texture. It is ready to drink now and until 2020. Screwcap.
Name: Josef Schmid 2011 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Deliciously fresh and fruity, this is a wine full of ripe apples and crisp pears. It's full bodied, but bright with intense acidity. The characteristic pepper touch of Grüner shows at the end of this full and concentrated wine. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2012 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a serious, pepper, spice and apple-flavored wine. It has a strong sense of minerality that gives bold structure. By contrast, there is a freshness to the wine that will make it very drinkable in a few months. Glass stopper.
Name: Weszeli 2012 Steinhaus Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: From 50-year old vines, this wine shows good concentration and a pepper character that shoots through the acidity and apple fruitiness. It's a complex wine with a dry edge, that should be served with food rather than as an apéritif. Screwcap.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2012 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Rounded and rich, with a pepper and spiced apple character, this is a warm, full-bodied wine. It has a fine texture, but dense structure. From vines just above the castle in Stein, it is still a young wine, so don't drink before 2015. Screwcap.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2011 Berglagen Vom Stein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Fragrant and perfumed, this wine has both nutmeg and ginger flavors, as well as tight citrus acidity. It's a wine that is so refreshing, drinkable and bright with acidity, but remarkably fruity in aftertaste.
Name: Bründlmayer 2012 Vincents Spiegel Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This astonishingly fruity wine is ripe with tropical flavors and a rich, juicy character. The wine is full bodied showing apricot fruits along with a textured character. The wine could age, so drink from 2015.
Name: Fritsch 2010 Schlossberg Erste Lage Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: From the Vogelsang, or “bird song” vineyard, this wine sings melodiously. It has bright green and citrus fruits, lively acidity and a crisp, dancing feel. There is a youthful feel to the acidity that demands a year in bottle. Screwcap.
Name: Bründlmayer 2012 Berg Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Rich and rounded, this is a full, generous wine. It has ripe pear, orange zest and baked apple flavors with a fine, tangy texture that brings out the fruit and concentration. While ready to drink now, it will be better in a year. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2012 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: This mineral textured wine has tight acidity as well as crisp fruit. It's taut, but with a rich background of quince and grapefruit. This fine wine needs to age at least a year to fully shine.
Name: Laurenz V. 2012 Silver Bullet Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Smooth and creamy, this is a rounded wine that's soft in texture. A good bite of lemon juice acidity adds balance and attractive fruitiness. Finishes very clean and fragrant. Screwcap.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2012 Hermanschachern Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Full in the mouth, this is a ripe, rich wine. It has both delicious acidity and a smooth, creamy texture that suggests generosity. The acidity at the end gives great crispness, citrus flavors and a fine bite. Screwcap.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2012 Birthal Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Full bodied with a creamy texture, this is a ripe, pear-flavored wine. It has weight, richness and warmth that contrasts a crisp edge of citrus acidity. With just a touch of spice, it's made to be enjoyed with Asian food. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2012 Tradition Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Laurenz Moser V makes deliciously fruity Grüner, allowing the ripe character of the grape to dominate. This wine, bright with apple and citrus flavors, is light, breezy and ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2012 Friendly Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Smooth and ripe, this is a warm Grüner. It has white fruits, a delicious creamy texture, and a citrus finish. The wine is ready to drink, but could improve after a year. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2012 Charming Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This fresh and fruity wine from Esterházy estates in northern Austria gives a strongly zesty, textured character. It is crisp, green and packed with lemon-citrus flavors. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Esterházy 2011 Estoras Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: There is really nothing forbidden about this wine. It's just off-dry and particularly gentle on the palate. The wine is light and fresh with pepper and tropical fruit fragrance. It's very ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2012 Forbidden Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Terrassen means a blend of wine from different vineyards. This crisp example is lively with acidity and green fruit flavors. It is very pure, bright and ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Bründlmayer 2012 Kamptaler Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Deliciously fruity, with its apple and fresh grapefruit, this is a forward, ripe wine. It has a crisp layer of tight acidity that highlights the immediate attractiveness of the wine. Glass stopper.
Name: Weszeli 2012 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: While fresh and fruity, this wine also has some good concentration and richness. It shows crisp acidity as well as a mineral edge, tangy zest notes and an apple-skin texture. The mouthfeel is bright and edgy still, so it will need a year to fully settle in. Screwcap.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2012 Wieden & Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: L & T, meaning “light and dry” in German, is pure, peppery, fruity Grüner. It has some creamy richness along with apple and grapefruit flavors, all bundled into a fresh, crisp package that is very ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2012 L & T Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This creamed-apple flavored wine is soft, smooth and ripe. It has a dense texture, concentrated structure and rounded corners attractively touched by acidity. The aftertaste is crisp with a fresh, clean finish. Screwcap. Artisanal Cellars, Select Wines.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2012 T26 Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine is very fruity, fresh and crisp while also showing texture and tight apple-skin flavors. Refreshing acidity brings out the fragrant, fresh aftertaste.
Name: Loimer 2012 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Yes, the wine does sing. It has a delicious, direct and fruity character that is ripe while remaining fresh with crisp apples and lime juice flavors. The wine is refreshing and ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2012 Laurenz und Sophie Singing Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: From the far western vineyards of the Wachau, this crisp, light and fruity wine is a delicious expression of Grüner's pepper and apple notes. With great freshness under the spice, it has refreshing crispness. Drink from 2014. Screwcap.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2012 Kalmuck Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This is a tight, mineral wine that is very crisp in character. It has green apple, lime and grapefruit flavors that are pure and brightened with acidity. Drink this delicious wine now.
Name: Fritsch 2012 Steinberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Fresh and crisp, this is a blend of perfumed Musaketeller, herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc and spicy Welschriesling. It is light, very fruity and has an attractive lemon-zest character. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2012 Falko Cool Climate Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: As bright as a button, this is a crisp, apple-fresh wine with a light texture. A touch of pepper is easily dominated by the fresh fruitiness of this wine and its soft, creamy aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Josef Schmid 2012 Satzen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a fresh and fruity wine, flavored with creamed apple and pears. There is the merest hint of pepper here to give spice and to bring out the bright acidity at the end. The wine could hold a year, but is ready to drink now.
Name: Winzer Krems 2012 Chremisa Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Bright, crisply fruity and with delicious acidity, this is a wine to drink now. It has a lively apple and grapefruit flavor that's all freshness and fruitiness. This is a wine to drink now.
Name: Fritsch 2012 Fritsch & Friends Windspiel Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Young and fruity and with a light prickle on the tongue, this is an immediately drinkable wine. Freshly sliced apple and lemon aromas open to a crisp texture and a dry, bright aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2012 Grooner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: In the modern tradition of fruity, accessible Grüners, this is light and crisp, and packed with apple and citrus flavors. It has lively acidity, is fresh in character, and totally ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2012 Hochterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a deliciously fruity, fragrant wine. It has a fine balance between its fresh acidity and ripe apple and pear fruitiness. It's a wine to be drunk young to enjoy its forward, bright character. Screwcap.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2012 Sauberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a wine that feels heavy, with rich apricot flavors that lack freshness and balance. It's not a wine for aging, but will go well with cakes or pastries.
Name: Rosenhof 2010 Orion Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Full in the mouth, the wine has ripe pear and lime flavors. It has a funky edge to it as well, with more rustic flavors. Give the wine six months to come together. Screwcap.
Name: Pleil 2012 Classic Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a soft, fruity wine that has quince and pear flavors along with an earthy, barnyard character. Screwcap.
Name: Pleil 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a wood-aged wine that suggests the argument that Grüner and wood do not always go together. The wine tastes oxidized, lacks fruit, and is weirdly off key.
Name: Kracher 2011 Sohm & Kracher Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: While ebulliently floral and fruity with notes of orange blossom and white peach, a bracing hit of lemon balm and lime zest make this bright, brisk Grüner Veltliner especially refreshing. It lingers long on the palate with a bristling minerality.
Name: Count Károlyi 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Hungary)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Oregon Grüner is still a rarity, but deserves a place of honor in the pantheon of emerging white wine grapes grown in the Willamette Valley. Grapefruit and citrus—both flesh and rind—form the core of this tart, mineral-driven wine. Even better on the second day, it remained fresh and focused.
Name: Chehalem 2012 Ridgecrest Vineyards Grüner Veltliner (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: So light and delicate, this is a wine beautifully poised and balanced. It has liveliness, pepper apricot and a hint of honey. Still very young. Drink from 2017.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2012 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: This wine is rather hard around the edge with bitter almond and apple flavors. The acidity cuts through the sweetness, reining it in.
Name: Manfred Weiss 2010 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee)

Description: Crisp, slightly underripe melon and quince tones lend freshness to white blossoms on this pretty, easy-drinking Grüner. The acidity is striking, a zippy streak of lemon and lime, bristling on the palate, along with a flurry of green, leafy notes that mark the finish.
Name: Vino z Czech 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Moravia)

Description: So ripe and full in the mouth, this is a beautiful wine. It has great layers of spice, yellow fruits, and refreshing acidity and concentration. Dense and multidimensional, it's both a mineral and fruit driven wine. This needs good aging over 4–6 years.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2011 Renner Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A high altitude vineyard yields a cool feeling wine that's very crisp and fragrant. Concentrated and full, it has great acidity, fruitiness and spice all blending together. This is a dense wine with singular intensity that needs time, so give it 3–5 years. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2011 Berg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Intense acidity marks the opening character of this wine. This is followed by equally intensely ripe pears and apples over pepperiness. Full bodied in style, this wine is still finding its feet and integrating. With its richness and great flavors it should be aged for 2–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: F X Pichler 2012 Urgestein Terrassen Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Pepper, spice and a rich texture are all elements of this concentrated wine. It has considerable depth to it, with hints of mineral and yeast, and peach and lemon flavors cutting through a dense palate. Give this impressive wine at least two years to develop. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2011 Alte Setzen Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: This wine is powerful and rich with dried fruit and intense spiciness. The palate has immense weight, concentration, and complexity, and shows superbly ripe lychee flavor. The youthful structure that needs aging, so give this wine 4–5 years. Screwcap.
Name: Hermann Moser 2011 Hannah Gebling Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a great wine, with spicy notes accenting the rich pear and lime flavors. It is rounded and full in the mouth, with a degree of concentration that never threatens to edge out the fresh acidity and the touch of pepper at the end. For aging over 2–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: Hirsch 2011 Kammerner Lamm Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Rich and full, this is a powerful wine with concentrated apples, pears and spice in a harmonious whole. The texture is dense, with beautiful layers of fruit and acidity, and a pure final tension. Age for at least four years. Glass stopper.
Name: Stadt Krems 2011 Wachtberg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine is one of a series of single vineyard wines from this Cistercian estate. The wine exhibits the pepper side of Grüner, full and flavorsome, along with spiced pear laced with citrus acidity. The wine is rich aging potential over the next 3–5 years.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2012 Steinsetz Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is a serious, organically grown wine, that's big, ripe and spicy with a great creamy texture. Very full in the mouth, it boasts rich yellow fruits laced with a chalky, mineral character. Acidity plays a pivotal role in keeping all this freshness in balance. Drink after 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Hager Matthias 2011 Urgestein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a finely balanced, ripe and fruity wine. The texture is smooth, with ripe green and white fruits that are laced with intense acidity. The wine is bone dry but peppery spice gives it a richer feel. It's worth aging this wine at least 1–2 years. Screwcap.
Name: Eichinger 2012 Wechselberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This may be a straightforward Grüner, but there's surprising complexity as well. There's a steely, mineral texture that's almost chewy, as well as a fruitier element. It's a dry, densely structured wine that could age for another year or two. Screwcap.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A clever play on words, this powerful wine is rich, complex, and a shade off dry from its ripe fruit profile. It has intense juiciness with loads of apple and pear flavor and just a touch of pepper. Full-bodied and worth aging for 2–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: Steininger 2012 Grand Grü Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A rich wine that shows ripe intensity as well as forward fruitiness. It has a ripe, creamy texture, and hints of spice and vanilla along with a steely acidity. Full in the mouth, it's packed with pepper as well as fruit. This is a dense wine that could age another year. Screwcap.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2012 Terrassen Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This is a smooth, intense wine that's very complex in its balance between acidity, green fruits and minerality. It's full of delicious fruit flavors, but shows a fine tension as well. Pepper just hints at the end. Screwcap.
Name: Josef Jamek 2012 Ried Achleiten Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This is a rich and full-bodied wine, that's spiced with yellow fruits, a touch of vanilla and a rounded texture. Its ripe, dense and full of concentrated fruits. Needs at least a year to age. Screwcap.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2012 Kies Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is a typically fragrant and fresh Grüner but with great class. It's very ripe and fruity, with acidity that offers a refreshing line of citrus. The Hundsleiten Vineyard's minerality comes through strongly here with a steely texture that finishes the wine with dryness. It's an impressive wine for aging over the next 2–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2011 Hundsleiten Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Spicy, exotic and dry, this wine is full of ripe lychee and mango fruits. Rounded, full and deliciously rich, it's perfect for sipping or for accompanying rich fish sauces. A wine for aging over 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Hermann Moser 2012 Gebling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: With its refreshing green and white fruits at the start and crisp acidity at the end, this wine seems deceptively simpe. In between, however, the wine has complex layers of spice, lime juice and minerality that promise some good aging over three years. Screwcap.
Name: Hirsch 2012 Kammerner Heiligenstein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Highlighted with peppery spice, this is a dense and rich wine, but smoothly textured with a layer of tangy acidity. It is concentrated on the palate, but marked by a light prickle on the tongue, and citrus flavors shooting through at the end.
Name: Anton Bauer 2011 Grande Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Markus Huber manages to get great ripe, full flavors from his Grüners. That's the main character of this wine, from a single vineyard, that offers rich creamed pear and nutmeg flavors along with a shot of acidity to contrast. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2012 Obere Steigen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Ripe and fruity, this is a fine expression of the easy, open style demanded by the Federspiel designation in the Wachau. Green fruit dominates along with a lively acidity that keeps the palate crisp. The wine is totally drinkable now, although it should age well over the next few years. Screwcap.
Name: F X Pichler 2012 Loibner Frauenweingarten Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: From a vineyard owned by Carmelite nuns, this is a delicious, refreshing wine. It wears its fruitiness right up front, supported with a little twist of pepper and a pure line of acidity. It's ready to drink, although it will age for 2–3 years and more. Screwcap.
Name: Hermann Moser 2012 Karmeliterberg Erste Lage Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a crisp, but also rich style of Federspiel. It is full of ripe pear and apple flavor as well as a fine pinch of pepper. Acidity creeps in the background to balance this ready-to-drink wine. Screwcap.
Name: F X Pichler 2012 Loibner Klostersatz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This is a serious wine, despite the ripe fruitiness on its surface. It is full of peach and mango flavors, but structured by a cool, mineral feel. Tangy acidity and tight texture adds tension. It still needs to age 2–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2010 Steinbügel Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a generous wine with richness. It has a smooth texture, and a palate full of ripe green fruit and pear flavors. There is also a tang of lemon as well as a more steely edge at the end. Screwcap.
Name: Schwarzböck 2012 Sätzen-Fürstenberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine is dense and fruity, yet still a fresh and lively wine. The contrast between rich yellow fruits and crisp acidity gives the wine a good tension, offering a fine texture and nervous edge. Great to drink now, but worth aging a year. Screwcap.
Name: Eichinger 2012 Hasel Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is a tight, mineral driven wine that's very textured and almost stark in its character. It offers steeliness, brisk acidity, and a palate packed with citrus fruits. Give this ageworthy wine at least five years. Screwcap.
Name: Steininger 2012 Kittmansberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Per Due, as in a wine for sharing between two people, is a fruity, fragrant, refreshing wine. It has great acidity, lively green apple flavors and just a touch of spice. Very refreshing. Screwcap.
Name: Hermann Moser 2012 Per Due Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Mango and apricot flavors come through strongly with this wine. It is rich, full and already maturing. Black currant flavors give the acidity the wine needs, shooting through the more exotic fruits. At the end, it is open, generous and ripe.
Name: Hager Matthias 2011 Seeberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Named after Rudolf and Anita Schwarzböck's son, this is a big—almost too big—wine. It is full of Grüner's pepper character but less of the fruit. So rich, ripe and dense, it offers a full mouth style that is likely to age quickly now. Screwcap.
Name: Schwarzböck 2009 Philipps Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The Sandgrube vineyard is one of the most familiar names in Krems and produces warm, fruity wines like this. The wine has weight, a dense texture and green-fruit acidity, laced with pepper. It's very young and should be kept for 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Thierry-Weber 2012 Kremser Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a rounded, rich and soft wine with a creamy texture and ripe pear and lime flavors contrasting with lively acidity. It has a smooth character, but with a bite of spice, lemon zest and minerality. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2012 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: This is a ripe, open and fruity wine, that's still very fresh and crisp. It has fragrant apple flavor, soft texture and a bright and juicy core that radiates a rounded character with finishing acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Stadt Krems 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: On the rich side, this is a full-bodied wine with pure green and white fruits. Acidity cuts through this richer texture, a lively fruity wine that is also full of ripe fruits. At the end, a more steely, mineral character emerges. Screwcap.
Name: Steininger 2011 Kittmansberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The Loisium is the wine museum in Langenlois in which the Steininger family is partner. This wines comes from the vineyard next to the museum. It's brightly fruity, a delicately layered wine, full of citrus and apricot fruit flavors, lively and ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Steininger 2012 Loisiumweingarten Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A creamy-textured wine with pear as well as apple flavors. The texture is soft, rounded, warm. At the same time, acidity cuts right through to give a crisp element as well as bringing out a touch of pepper. Screwcap.
Name: Thierry-Weber 2012 Animo Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Grüner, with its natural acidity, makes a fine base for a fresh, fruity sparkling wine. It's delicious and crisp, with lots of apples and grapefruit flavors, finishing with bright acidity.
Name: Szigeti NV Brut Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Intensely peppery, this wine is aromatic with notes of black currants. Fruit flavors are marked with lemongrass spiciness and tense acidity. The wine is light in body, with a refreshing character that's going to be just right as an aperitif. Screwcap.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a stony, mineral-led wine with white fruit flavors overlain by tactile texture. There is concentration from spice, rich fruits and final refreshing acidity. A lively wine that is developing fast and will be ready to drink this year. Screwcap.
Name: Stadt Krems 2012 Weinzierlberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a ripe wine that's full and creamy in texture. It shows quite a different aspect of Grüner compared to the crisper, more mineral wines further north in Austria. This is rich and smooth with pear flavors and clean lines to shape the aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Glatzer 2012 Dornenvogel Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This first Grüner Veltliner from Sineann is lightly aromatic with notes of citrus, apple, and spice. It drinks off dry with sharped edged, green apple-like acids.
Name: Sineann 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Very crisp apples and lime juice fit well together in this fruity sparkling wine. It has plenty of acidity, of course, balanced with a mineral texture and a light hint of spice.
Name: Steininger 2011 Sekt Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Very crisp, collected wine, packed with citrus flavors and lightly lined with a more mineral character. The wine is bright, really fruity, refreshing and delicious now. Screwcap.
Name: Glatzer 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: A light, refreshingly textured wine, very fruity and bright. Citrus and green plums cut through the tangy texture giving a clean, crisp character. The wine is immediately drinkable. Screwcap.
Name: Anton Bauer 2012 Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: This is an attractive and fragrant wine, bursting with fresh pear and apple flavors. It's laced with the hallmark Grüner touch of pepper and finished with refreshing acidity. For drinking this year. Screwcap.
Name: Hermann Moser 2012 Green Eyes Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Light and fruity, a bright and breezy wine, very fresh and refreshing. Shafts of green fruit shine through along with crisp acidity. The wine has spice and just a hint of a prickle on the tongue. Screwcap.
Name: Hager Matthias 2012 Mollandser Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fruity wine, light, elegant with a touch of minerality, it shows a fine balance of green fruits and its spice. The wine is all about freshness, crispness, a touch of minerality to give texture. At the end, the fragrant acidity shines. Screwcap.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2012 Terrassen Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Earthy aromas lead to a crisp while full-bodied wine. There's a whiff of sulphur floating around that takes a while to blow off. Beyond that, the fruit is spicy, crisp and green. Screwcap.
Name: Wieninger 2012 Vienna Hills Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: This is a refreshing Grüner, its apple acidity and spice combining to give a wine that is both refreshing and also tight in texture, with something to bite on. Drink soon. Screwcap.
Name: Michlits 2012 Biokult Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: One of the classic, simple, attractive Grüners to come out of Austria, this brings forward lively green fruits, a touch of spice and crisp acidity. It's totally ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2012 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: One of the popular liter bottles of Grüner Veltliner, this is bright, fruity and laced with red apples. It has lively acidity and a light texture, making it very drinkable and bright.
Name: Thierry-Weber 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Austria)

Description: Veltlinsky is among the very first of the fruity Grüners that swept through our wine shops. It is as crisp and green as the grape should be, with apples and pepper laced together in a bright, light harmony. Screwcap.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2012 Veltlinsky Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Pepper's the name, and pepper's a character of this wine. There is such a light touch with the pepper pot though, allowing for apple flavors and a light, dancing texture. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2011 Austrian Pepper Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A simple, fruity wine, this offers lime and green-apple flavors giving complete freshness. It's a light, aromatic wine with a touch of pepper. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Steininger 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A very crisp wine, with a fine mineral texture, this pulls in the direction of green fruits, citrus and a tangy, zesty character. Brisk and fragrant, it needs another few months to be at its best. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Spicy and fruity, this is a refreshing, open, green and white fruited wine. Lively and crisp, it has good acidity and just a touch of pepper to add another dimension. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Grüner Veltliner, though still rare, shows good promise in Oregon. This is a big, sappy, ripe version that's borderline syrupy, with big flavors of peaches and apricots. But the supporting acids, and a lick of mineral, keep it from crashing.
Name: Raptor Ridge 2012 Estate Grüner Veltliner (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: There is deliciously pure fruit here, rich certainly but with a straight line to pear, sweet orange and peach flavors. Behind the fruity exterior is a more structured core, showing spice as well as density and final acidity. Age for three years and more.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2011 Ried Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Give Grüner the chance to become really ripe and you end up with luscious, rich wines like this. It may be dry, but its texture is so unctuous and soft. Its peach, lychee and kiwi fruit acidity offer the chance for drinking soon, but also promise good aging over the next 2–3 years.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2011 Ried Schütt Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Big, rich wine, packed with spice, ripe peach and mango flavors. Designated a Library Wine by Knoll, it is complex, ageworthy, with a weight of both fruit and pepper to it. Keep this powerful wine for at least another 2–3 years.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2011 Loibner Smaragd Vinothekfüllung Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The wine served at Vienna's famed Opera Ball, this is crisp, herbaceous with apple and citrus fruits already showing a totally refreshing character. It would benefit from a few months in bottle. Screwcap.
Name: Winzer Krems 2012 Kellermeister Privat Kremser Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The Sandgrube vineyard is one of the larger vineyards in the Krems area, well exposed to the Danube river. This Grüner is soft, finely formed, with a youthful texture that gives a mineral tang. Keep this wine for a year. Screwcap.
Name: Winzer Krems 2012 Kremser Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A ripe and full-bodied wine. It offers rich creamed apple and peach flavors as well as a contrasting citrus element. Minerality adds texture to this still young wine that needs some bottle aging. Screwcap.
Name: Winzer Krems 2012 Wein Manufaktur Krems Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Deliciously refreshing, peach and apricot flavored wine. It is soft while also crisp, bright and fruity. There's a refreshing lemon zest tang to finish. Screwcap.
Name: Hirsch 2010 Veltliner No 1 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Tangy orange zest and lime are the dominant flavors of this bright, refreshing wine. There's almost a spritz here, very fruity, crisp, finishing with spice and pepper. Screwcap.
Name: Höpler 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Creamy textured wine, soft and ripe. It has attractive pure acidity that lies lightly on the palate, blended well with riper red apple, pear and just crisp acidity. Ready to drink in six months. Screwcap.
Name: Winzer Krems 2012 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A fresh, fruity wine, full of crisp apples with a touch of pear. It's in the bright, light style of the one liter bottles from Austria, a great party wine.
Name: Lustig 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Description: A rich style of Grüner, showing pear and peach fruits and a warm texture. There is citrus acidity present, supporting the richness. It's a ready-to-drink simple wine, finishing full and fruity. Screwcap.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2011 Mo-Velt Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: A wine that is soft, fragrant and very fruity. There's a touch of spice, pepper as well as tangy lemon zest. Sandgrube 13 is the address of the Krems cooperative. Screwcap.
Name: Winzer Krems 2012 Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Pure and fruity, this has a fine line of steely acidity that cuts through the crisp apple fruit. The Loiser Berg is a south-facing, sheltered site that helps to create a taut wine with considerable aging potential. Keep for 4–5 years.
Name: Bründlmayer 2011 Loiser Berg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine is full and opulent, and its yellow fruit is at the fore. The ripeness is tempered by the complex notes of spice and almond as well as the taut, steely acidity. Age for at least four years.
Name: Bründlmayer 2011 Kammerner Lamm Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Full and rich, this is a beautifully concentrated wine. It's packed with apricot and citrus, but it also has a serious, mineral -driven side that gives it a taut texture. The acidity is intense, and it needs several months to soften and integrate. Keep this for 2–3 years or more.
Name: Bründlmayer 2011 Loiser Berg Erste Lage Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Rich and concentrated, this is dominated by superripe fruit. The wine derives its weight and full body from the clay soil of the Käferberg. The tight texture and acidity shows some restraint, but this selection is about power.
Name: Bründlmayer 2011 Käferberg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Rich and fruity, this has a yellow fruit flavor that's touched by a hint of pepper. A tasty edge of acidity balances this full-bodied, concentrated wine.
Name: Bründlmayer 2011 Vincents Spiegel Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine has concentration, but it also demonstrates great elegance in its crisp acidity, lemon-zest-like texture and bright fruitiness. It's a wine to age for several years, but it can also be consumed soon.
Name: Bründlmayer 2011 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This concentrated effort boasts rich, ripe yellow-fruit and citrus flavors as well as fine acidity. It is packed with fruit, but it also has a firm, steely, nervy texture. It should be aged for 2–3 years, maybe more, for maximum effect.
Name: Pratsch 2011 Steinberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Ripe and full, this has layers of refreshing green-fruit, apple and cream flavors, enlivened by fresh acidity. It has a light touch of orange zest that gives extra vitality to this ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Bründlmayer 2011 Berg Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
