Description: A pepper- and spice-dominated wine, this has a background of citrus and green plum flavors. The palate is textured and full. The Rotenpüllen is made up of glacial deposits.
Name: Pratsch 2011 Rotenpüllen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: One of the entry-level wines from Bründlmayer, this is all about the fruit. It is fresh and perfumed, with just a touch of pepper that adds zestiness. It's a pleasure to drink now, and the creamed pear and citrus flavors are already in harmony.
Name: Bründlmayer 2011 Kamptaler Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A spot-on Oregon Grüner, this is dry and spicy. It's clean as a whistle, with flavors of celery, lemon and sour peach.
Name: Chehalem 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: The lightest of Wachau wine styles, this has a lilting, waltz-like feel. This is ready to drink, with a crisp apple flavor and a pepper touch.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2011 Terrassen Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: There is an attractive lemon tang to this wine, as well as bright acidity and a creamy texture. It has plenty of fruit, and a sense of lightness that would make it a great apéritif.
Name: Michlits 2011 Biokult Grüner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Classic Grüner Veltliner, this combines a creamy texture with crisp green fruit. Bright, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Pratsch 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The chalk soil of the Rabenstein Vineyard has 50-year-old vines, which produce a dense, concentrated wine. Spice and mineral characters combine with creamed apple in a rich display. The wine could certainly age over the next 3–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2011 Rabenstein Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Made from fruit that's sourced from over 50-year-old vines, this is a rich, concentrated single-vineyard wine. It shows notes of tropical fruit and pear, with just the right amount of crisp acidity. A dash of pepper gives spice to the wine. Showing its origins in the cool region of Weinviertel, the wine ends with a crisp bite of lemon.
Name: Dürnberg 2011 Rabenstein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Opulent and rich, this is a fine expression of the dense mineral side of the Achleiten Vineyard. It has weight, and is packed with ripe peach and peppered pineapple flavors. It is obviously capable of aging for at least three years. Screwcap.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2011 Achleiten  Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Smooth and rich, this shows notes of apricot, intense pepper and spice, with a dry, firm structure. There is a tangy orange zest character that gives some tightness, suggesting it can age.
Name: Winzer Krems 2011 Kremser Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a ripe, spicy and pepper-flavored wine. It has pear and green plum notes that give a crisp edge to the rich texture. There is a mineral touch that brings out the acidity to balance the opulence. Age for 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2011 Terrassen  Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Ripe and creamy, this is an apple- and pear-flavored wine that's rounded and rich. It's fresh and full bodied, while preserving attractive acidity. The finish has a touch of spice. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2011 Charming Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Despite its maturity, this still has fresh pear and grapefruit flavors, which combine with almond, cream and currant notes, producing a round, smooth wine.
Name: Bründlmayer 2006 Kamptaler Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Warm and creamy, this fills the palate with apple and pink grapefruit flavors. A touch of spice adds interest to this ripe, fruity effort that is ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2011 Falkensteiner Tradition Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a spicy, peppery wine initially, opening with a fragrant, fresh and citrus character. It's bright and crisp, showing some intensity from low-yield vines. Full, ripe and fresh on the finish. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2011 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: This fresh, crisp bottling features a green apple note with a touch of citrus. Made by Laurenz Moser V and his daughter Sophie, this is the epitome of light, fruity Grüner, a wine that dances easily across the palate. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2011 Laurenz and Sophie Singing Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Lively, vital and fresh, this is typical of the new generation of Grüners that are made for early drinking. It's light and tangy, bursting with apple and lemon flavors. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2011 Falko Cool Climate Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: "Chremisa," the ancient name of Krems, is commemorated in this wine that comes from Krems vineyards. It has tight, tangy apple-driven acidity, with a bright, light, citrusy character. Not for aging.
Name: Winzer Krems 2011 Edition Chremisa Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A note of white, waxy flower and a wisp of smoke on the nose introduce intense flavors of tangerine, lime and peppery leaf on the palate. Bright acidity and a glimmer of wet stone linger on the finish.
Name: Szoke Matyás 2011 Zöld Veltelini Grüner Veltliner (Mátra)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The attack on this light-bodied sipper is unabashedly fruity, with loads of ripe peach and nectarine flavors. It balances out quite nicely with zippy acidity and a dry, steely finish. This is a noteworthy addition to the growing line up of Finger Lakes Grüner Veltliner.
Name: Stony Lonesome 2011 Estate Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sunny and ripe on the nose, this has loads of yellow peach and apricot aromas, tinged with hints of dried, savory herbs. This dry, medium-bodied Grüner is subdued on the palate, but thirst quenching with its vivid acidity and clean, minerally finish. Drink now.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of sweet white peach and apple blossoms are lovely on this lean, light-footed Grüner Veltiner. The palate could use a hint more concentration, but it's lemony and brisk, with pleasant crushed chalk and grass notes. Drink now.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2011 Estate Bottled Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tart, racy, steely and bracing, this is a fine Grüner for Oregon. Grapefruit and Meyer lemon flavors are highlighted with a note of orange candy. It's persistent and crisply defined.
Name: Raptor Ridge 2011 Estate Grüner Veltliner (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: This is concentrated and ripe, with its fruit sublimated into a tense, mineral texture, layered with equally intense acidity. It has power, with the fruit lending a rich, full-bodied finish.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2010 Lamm Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Steely and mineral in character, this is a taut, nervy wine. It has great acidity and balance, with green fruit and sliced apple flavors. Keep for 3–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: Geyerhof 2010 Steinleithn Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a ripe, creamy wine made with grapes from a single vineyard. It's smooth yet laced with minerality and a tang of lemon zest, green apple and kiwi. This should age nicely for 3–4 years.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2011 Wachtberg Erste Lage Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This concentrated wine hits the palate like the shock of a cold shower. As the fruit settles, it shows depth of flavor, with notes of green apples and honey. Young and crisp, this is worth aging for another year at least.
Name: Eichinger 2010 Gaisberg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe and perfumed, this has almond, apple and baked-pear flavors that are layered with notes of nutmeg and pepper. It's a concentrated wine, with acidity that has become rounded. Made from a top Kamptal vineyard, this has the potential for aging further. Screwcap.
Name: Hirsch 2010 Kammerner Lamm Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Almost sweet in its richness, this succeeds despite being the antithesis of Grüner. It's so ripe, so full, yet wonderfully balanced.This is worth aging over 3–4 years.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2010 Eichenstaude Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is intensely rich, with very concentrated ripe fruit. Apple and peach flavors are cut by acidity. A note of pepper details the finish. Age for 3–4 years.
Name: Forstreiter 2010 Tabor Reserve Die Räritat Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: While the wine is technically dry, its richness gives it a sweeter sensation. The ripe apricot and pineapple fruit is cut with knife-like acidity, allowing this concentrated wine to remain poised, with a crisp finish.
Name: Geyerhof 2010 Gaisberg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is finely proportioned, with intense fruit flavors laced with spice, acidity and a mineral texture. Made using grapes from a single vineyard, it is concentrated, with a depth of intense flavor. For aging over 3–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2011 Obere Steigen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: A rich and creamy wine, this is full of the ripest fruit. It has flavors of yellow fruit and pineapple, with intense acidity. The wine is powerful yet balanced, with a delicious acidity on the finish.
Name: Kurt Angerer 2010 Loam Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Rich and almost liquorous in its texture, this is powerful stuff. It has weight, with intense, concentrated flavors of tropical fruit, spice and a smooth character. The acidity lends lift on the finish. Screwcap.
Designation: Oberfeld Erste Lage Alte Reben Reserve
Name: Unger 2010 Oberfeld Erste Lage Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is rich and concentrated. It has weight, with the ripe white-peach fruit giving a smooth edge to the otherwise taut, mineral acidity. Age over 3–4 years. Glass stopper.
Name: Stadt Krems 2010 Wachtberg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Beautifully smooth, this ripe wine contrasts its rich peach and pineapple flavors with a squeezed lime note and taut acidity. With its intensely-fruity finish, this is a wine for aging.
Name: Summerer 2010 Schenkenbichl Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Textured and concentrated, this offers layers of green fruit and tightly controlled acidity. Packed with fruit, this complex wine should age for several more years. Screwcap.
Name: Unger 2010 Gottschelle Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Ripe and creamy, this is full of rich pear and green plum fruit. It has weight and is layered with acidity, with a spice note and a taut, mineral texture. This is complex and age worthy.
Name: Eichinger 2011 Wechselberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is a big, fruity wine that has a dense texture and intense white fruit and peach fruit flavors. It's an impressive, rich wine, worth aging for 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Weixelbaum 2010 Wahre Welte Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A beautifully concentrated wine that balances flavors of baked apple and spicy pepper. It feels full in the mouth, with a tense texture and intense acidity. Drink now, but better to hold for two years. Screwcap.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2011 Wiedenberg Tradition Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a powerful and intense wine, with its rich fruit encased by a tight line of acidity. It has great depth of fruit, with structure and a spice note. With its acidity, this is a wine that should age. Screwcap.
Name: Türk 2010 Kremser Sandgrube Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is concentrated fruity and very spicy. It has an intensity of fruit flavor, its nutmeg character balanced by crisp green apples, pear skins and a great depth of acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Rabl 2010 Käferberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A hugely-rich wine that is very concentrated, offering as much pepper flavor as fruit. With its weight and soft, velvety texture, there are notes of ripe yellow fruit and pear. This should age over several years. Screwcap.
Name: Felsner 2011 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A currant flavor pushes this wine to a rich, concentrated fruitiness. It is dry, although the superripe fruit gives an illusion of sweetness. The concentration and density of the fruit are impressive. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2010 Schiefer Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Pepper and spice notes dominate this wine. It has a full texture and a ripe character from the apricot and kiwi flavors. Concentrated and rich, it would benefit from a year of aging.
Name: Wieninger 2011 Herrenholz Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: This is an elegant wine that has a smooth, perfumed character, with a racy, peppery edge. It has a crisp element, white fruit and pineapple. This should age for several years. Screwcap.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2010 Von Stein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Made from grapes sourced from the Gebling Vineyard, this has broad, ripe yellow fruit and a touch of spice. With its rich mouthfeel, it is a serious wine, both complex and intense. Age for at least a year. Screwcap.
Name: Hermann Moser 2011 Fortissimo Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A wine that pushes the concept of Grüner to its limits. It is powerful, dense and concentrated, with spice, lychee and apricot flavors. This is full bodied, superrich. Screwcap.
Name: Nigl 2010 Senftenberger Pellingen Erste Lage Privat Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Big and rich, this is just settling into its stride. It has weight and richness, with taut acidity as well as a forward, concentrated, fruity character. For food and for aging.
Name: Felsner 2010 Vordernberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Harvested in December, this marries opulent flavors of honey and orange marmalade with intense acidity. Ready to drink in its youth, but it's likely to age for many years. Screwcap.
Name: Türk 2010 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Crisply fruity, this is delicate, with clean lines of acidity. It shows delicious flavors of green apple and bitter orange, with a tangy, zesty texture. The finish is dry and taut. Screwcap.
Name: Hermann Moser 2011 Karmeliterberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is beautifully crisp, with its acidity cutting the tense, mineral texture. It has a light touch, and is perfumed with green apple and pineapple notes that dance on the palate. Age 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Hirsch 2010 Kammerner Heiligenstein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Combining richness and freshness, this has a crisp apple flavor that mingles with smooth-textured yellow fruit. Its ripe while still preserving its taut finish. Screwcap.
Name: Allram 2010 Hasel Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Rounded yet fresh, this is a warm, intense, spicy wine with just the right balance between fruit and acidity. It has good minerality that lends texture. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Rich and rounded, this has notes of spice and ripe white and yellow fruit. Immediately attractive, it has complex acidity and a zesty texture. This should be ready to drink in 6 months. Screwcap.
Name: Loimer 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Rich and smooth, this wine shows weight with superripe fruit that offers a mellow take on Grüner. With its spice, pineapple and dried apricot flavors, this is both fruity and structured.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2010 Gottschelle Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is an intriguingly-spiced wine that shows a cinnamon flavor along with notes of concentrated, rich yellow fruit and lime. It's an exotic wine that will need two years to come together. Screwcap.
Name: Steininger 2011 Grand Cru Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is full bodied, ripe and creamy. It has flavors of tropical fruit, spiced pineapple and a touch of pepper. The underlying grapefruit acidity holds everything together. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2011 Schiefer Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Really ripe, this is a full-bodied wine that is full of tropical fruit contrasted with green apple flavor. It has weight, intensity and just a hint of spice. This should be aged 1–2 years at least. Screwcap.
Name: Nigl 2010 Herzstück vom Kirchenberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: With its pear and apricot fruits, this has a delicious full-bodied character, and the the grapefruit acidity keeps it fresh. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2010 Steinberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A wine that shows all the typicity of cool-climate Grüner. It has pear, baked-apple and lemon zest flavors that are combined in a delicious tangy texture. The wine is rich while remaining light and lively. Drink soon, or age over 1–2 years. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: This is rounded, with a creamy texture and fruity aromas. It's warm, with pear and baked-apple flavors set over wood spice. Worth aging for a few months. Screwcap.
Name: Höpler 2011 Guttenberg Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: This is smooth, with creamed apple and pink grapefruit notes. Textured and concentrated, this has delicious pure fruit flavor that's contrasted with a touch of pepper and intense acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2011 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: A smooth and rich wine, this has weight and concentration. At the same time, it has an attractive, light-hearted feel that's poised and elegant. The wine could age for a few years. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2010 Rotenpüllen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Delicately perfumed, this has ripe, intense aromas of apricot and pear. It is round and concentrated, with a full texture and minerality. Screwcap.
Name: Eichinger 2011 Hasel Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This has green apple and creamed pear flavors, with a lively, buoyant texture. It's worth aging for a few more months. Screwcap.
Name: Buchegger 2011 Holzgasse Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a mature Grüner that's rich, ripe and deliciously smooth. It has a great depth of flavor, with notes of wild herb and passion fruit that are balanced with mature acidity.
Name: Arndorfer 2008 Die Leidenschaft Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: With considerable depth of flavor, this is a rounded, smooth wine. Its green apple flavor is laced with notes of pink grapefruit, crisp pear and a touch of peppered kiwi. It's ready to drink but also worth aging for a few months. Screwcap.
Name: Hermann Moser 2011 Per Due Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a very herbal wine, with a green medicinal edge that contrasts the rich yellow-fruit flavor. There is concentration, dense fruits and a soft, ripe finish. Screwcap.
Name: Weixelbaum 2010 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: With its rich feel, this is a ripe and rounded wine. It has layers of yellow fruit and green apple flavor, with a crisp yet full character. Although it's drinkable now, it's worth aging for two years. Screwcap.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2011 Göttweiger Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The name is derived from the forbidden fruit of the Garden of Eden. Off dry, ripe and round, it's lightly honeyed, with tempting flavors of peach and pineapple. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2011 Forbidden Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A full-bodied, ripe wine, showing flavors of pepper and apricot. It feels rich and smooth, with a full texture and a good depth of green and yellow fruits. The finish has a fine lift of acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Buchegger 2011 Gebling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a crisp, green-fruited wine with all its flavors concentrated in a full, fruity character. It has citrus and lively mineral notes, with a juicy texture. Ripe and rich yet not heavy, it's almost drinkable now. Screwcap.
Name: Rabl 2011 Spiegl Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Rich and luscious, this is a tropical-fruited wine. Fruitiness is the driving force here, and the acidity keeps this full-bodied effort proportioned and crisp. Glass stopper.
Name: Steininger 2010 Kittmansberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A crisp wine that's full of acidity, this has flavors of green fruit and pepper. It feels rich while still showing its fruity and lively aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Felsner 2010 Rohrendorfer Gebling Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a pepper- and apple-flavored wine with refreshing acidity that cuts through its richness. Using grapes sourced from the Kogl Vineyard, this shows perfumed ripeness and intense crispness. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2011 Kremser Kogl Bergwein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A smooth and creamy wine, with a rich, fruity baked-apple character, and tense, tangy acidity. There is a touch of pepper that offers contrast. Drinkable now, this is also worth aging. Screwcap.
Name: Allram 2011 Strassertaler Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is ripe, with a creamy and peppery character that's balanced with intense red-apple and pineapple flavors. It's textured and infused with grapefruit acidity. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2011 Hochterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a light and fruity style of Grüner, with a crisp green-fruit flavor. It is immediately accessible, with a spice note and bright acidity on the finish. Screwcap.
Name: Weixelbaum 2011 Stephanus Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is a wine dominated by Grüner's signature pepper character. It is weighty and round, with its acidity cushioned by richness. Give this wine at least a year. Screwcap.
Name: Felsner 2010 Gedersdorfer Moosburgerin Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: There's very clean and pure fruit on this light, fresh wine. Tight with acidity, it has a green apple flavor and a good pinch of pepper. This is a great summer wine.
Name: Stadt Krems 2011 Weinzierlberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: An attractive, crisp wine that boasts all the right citrus and green herb flavors along with a hint of pepper. Bright and ready to drink. Screwcap
Name: Pratsch 2010 Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: This is a soft wine, with attractive acidity and clean green-fruit flavor. The wine is crisp, with green apples dominating the mineral texture. Screwcap.
Name: Thierry-Weber 2011 Animo Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Light and bright, this has pear and apple flavors. The acidity cuts through to balance the fruitiness, with a lively lemon-peel note and an edge of minerality.
Name: Wieninger 2011 Vienna Hills Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Warm and rounded, this is full of tropical fruit flavors. It has a zing of citrus, with its lively fruit remains balanced with a full, ripe feel. Age for a few months or drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Winzer Krems 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Soft and creamy, this has a crisp element that's nicely balanced by kiwi and baked-apple flavors. There's a hint of spice along with a bright and fresh finish. Screwcap.
Name: Felsner 2010 Lössterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Light and crisp, this has clean pear and grapefruit flavors. With its enticing acidity, this is a great summer quaff. Screwcap.
Name: Loimer 2011 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a floral effort perfumed with apple blossom. The palate is rich and creamy, with intense acidity balanced by peach and pear flavors. It has a smooth finish. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2011 Laurenz and Sophie Singing Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a soft, creamed-apple style of wine, with a great shaft of acidity cutting through the crisp fruit. Kiwi and gooseberry fruits are lifted on the bright, lively finish.
Name: Winzer Krems 2011 Kellermeister Privat Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Classically crisp, this is packed with attractive green fruits. It has a tang of citrus and a lively bite. Fruity and ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Winzer Krems 2011 Handverlesen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is very much in the light, fruity style of instantly-drinkable Grüner. It's packed with green apple flavor and bright acidity. The finish is marked with a tang of citrus. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2011 Grooner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Taut and crisp, this has tight acidity and a lively green-fruit character. It's full of attractive fruit, with a mouthwatering finish. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Brandl 2011 Pfaffenberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Light and crisp, this is a delicious green-fruited wine that has a crisp texture and lively acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Green Eyes 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A wine with attractive softness, this has a slight edge of sweetness and perfumed apple flavors. Crisp, with a gentle creamy finish.
Name: Steininger 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: This is crisp, clean and light. It is fruity with green apple flavor, and it has a tight texture. The finish is floral and aromatic. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2011 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: In the light style of value Austrian white wine, this is full of crisp, fresh flavors of apple and grapefruit, with just a touch of pepper. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2011 Lust & Laune Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This has fresh citrus and dried apricot flavors, with Grüner's typical peppery edge. For drinking now. Screwcap.
Name: Höpler 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: This wine has a crisp character, tangy with apples and laced with citrus fruits. It's totally ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2011 L & T Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a light wine, with a white fruit flavor and a taut, mineral character. It is all fruit with layer upon layer of pear and crisp acidity. Drink over the year as it's not meant for aging. Screwcap.
Name: Winzer Krems 2011 Ried Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a simple, fruity wine—great for quaffing as a summer apéritif. It is attractively crisp, fresh, and it's laced with grapefruit, apple and pepper flavors. Screwcap.
Name: Thierry-Weber 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Round and soft, this is immediately drinkable. Its acidity and green fruit flavors are well balanced; the wine dances easily on the palate. Screwcap.
Name: Brandl 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A rich wine, very balanced with ripe peach flavors enlivened by acidity, orange zest and an edge of spice. The wine is lush while also mineral and will likely develop over the next 3–4 years. The aftertaste is gorgeous and very ripe.
Name: Bründlmayer 2010 Loiser Berg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Tense, dry wine that brings out all the minerality of the Käferberg Vineyard. This is an impressive, ageworthy wine, dominated at this stage by citrus and green apple flavors. Likely to age over many years with its structure intact.
Name: Bründlmayer 2010 Käferberg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Intensely rich wine that flows opulently. Rounded warm and concentrated, it has spice, pepper as well as pineapple and peach fruit. It is not sweet but the unctuous character makes it feel so. Needs at least five years in bottle.
Name: Bründlmayer 2010 Kammerner Lamm Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Edging towards minerality, this is a textured wine, its acidity penetrating right through. This intense, crisp character is complimented by the balanced fruit with its ripe apricot and kiwi flavors. Age for 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Bründlmayer 2010 Berg Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Old vines give an extra concentration in this intensely spice- and green plum-flavored wine. With its considerable freshness it should age well, its rounded character likely to develop. For now, enjoy its beautiful purity of fruit.
Name: Bründlmayer 2010 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The most impressive of the range of wines from Laurenz Moser V. It is tight with minerality, pepper and apple skin flavors. With a steely texture and intense youthful acidity, it's a wine that needs to age for at least 2 years. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2010 Charming Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Sweet pure fruit, starring grapefruit flavors, is rounded with a more creamy character, and additional flavors of pear and fresh sliced melon, finished with pepper.
Name: Bründlmayer 2010 Kamptaler Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Bringing out the pepper character of Grüner, this is classically structured wine. It has all the right freshness along with a light poise and elegance. Green plums and lime clinch a final roundness. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2010 Laurenz and Anna Sunny Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: With taut acidity and a line of minerality, this is as fresh as possible but with a kick of structure and herbal texture. It's crisp, clean, well-made, with the fruit right in balance with the acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2010 Friendly Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A fresh, crisp wine that brings out the pepper character of Grüner along with an attractive creamy citrus flavor. The wine has good acidity and a final lemon zest.
Name: Berger 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Rounded, ripe, this Grüner is finely balanced, with apple flavors and a citric edge. It has intense acidity with a creamy character, and is ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2010 Laurenz and Sophie Singing Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Soft and a little musty, this does not have the sharpness and grace of the previous vintage. Maybe just young, but at the moment it is a simple, pleasantly quaffable white wine.
Name: Illahe 2010 Estate Grüner Veltliner (Willamette Valley)

Description: Rounded and creamy wine. It has an edge of pepper, its acidity melding easily into the apple and pear fruit flavors. It finishes easily with a ripe pineapple note. Screwcap.
Name: Ecker 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Austria)

Description: Superbly rich and sweet, this beautifully honeyed wine has peach and orange marmalade with pineapple acidity. It's a wine of concentration, great richness, the sweetness layered with a dry botrytis character. Age for many years.
Name: Bründlmayer 2009 Kammerner Lamm Trockenbeerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The term Auslese is really describing the superb richness of the wine rather than its sweetness. With warm currant and sweet pear flavors, the wine is balanced and has a burst of final acidity.
Name: Bründlmayer 2009 Kammerner Lamm Auslese Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A ripe wine, emphasizing the sweet apple and pear side of Grüner Veltliner, the acidity enveloped by rich fruits. There is a delicious freshness, with just a bite of citrus to sharpen the aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Sommer 2010 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Leithaberg)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: There may be some residual sugar here, or it may just be fruit sweetness that gives it a fruity, fleshy, full-bodied mouthfeel. Loaded with cinnamon-spiced apple and pear flavors. Though not especially Grüner-like, it's quite tasty.
Name: Reustle 2009 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Almost fat in the mouth—at least for a Grüner—this has round fruit flavors of apple and pear, finished with a lick of baking spice.
Name: Reustle 2009 Grüner Veltliner (Umpqua Valley)

Description: The essence of Grüner Veltliner is present in this magnificent wine. It is rich, the spice of the fruit translated into lychee exoticism. The acidity is always present, giving shape to this luscious (but dry) wine.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2010 Axpoint Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Gorgeously ripe fruit, full of pear, green plum and exotic spices. The wine is rich, with its smooth, rounded texture that is pierced with mouthwatering acidity and laced with steeliness. This is a wine with considerable aging potential.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2010 Honivogl Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Intensely mineral wine, with an austere edge of acidity and texture. It has a pure quality, its apple flavors shining through the outer shell. With its firm character, it will age many years.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2010 Rotes Tor Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Rich, smooth and opulent wine from the top Hundsleiten vineyard. It is driven by a taut line of acidity that is surrounded by ripe pear and melon flavors and a rounded, concentrated texture. Fruit is right to the fore in a refined way, and pepper on the finish.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2010 Hundsleiten Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A powerful wine, a serious conversation between ripe fruits, spice, a smooth creamy texture and underlying minerality. With its edge of toast, pepper and final acidity, it is a wine for aging. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2010 Berg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: This wine benefits from some time in bottle. Wood and fruit are integrated, bringing out the spice in the fruit, while leaving delicious apple and white currant fruits to blossom. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2008 Rabenstein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: There is impressive balance here—rich apple and pear flavors with a tang of minerality. It is smooth and concentrated on the one hand and edgy and nervy on the other. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2010 Aussere Bergen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A rich style of wine, very generous, ripely fruity. The classic pepper character of the grape is rounded out by pear, green apple and lime flavors, as well as a concentrated, textured center. Screwcap.
Name: Leth 2010 Scheiben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: The rich, exposed soils of the Wagram ridge give richness to this wine. From old vines, it is impressive with spice, red pepper, cinnamon as well as green plum and mango fruits. Six months wood aging rounds it out. Screwcap.
Name: Soellner 2010 Fumberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: The densely planted vineyard that gives this wine its name yields fine concentration, dense pear and melon flavors. The apple skin texture also shows a distinct bite of acidity. Wafts of fruitiness combine with pepper right to the end. An impressive, ageworthy wine.
Name: Setzer 2010 8000 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: From one of the top vineyard sites in Kremstal, this is powerful, concentrated, very spicy wine. It shows considerable pepper, tropical fruits, mango and lychee, along with a taut mineral structure. Screwcap.
Name: Türk 2009 Kremser Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Very spicy and mineral in character, this is a distinct terroir wine, speaking of the gravel and loam soils of the Traisental region. It has richness, complex lychee and mango fruits and a tight texture of acidity and pepper. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2010 Alte Setzen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Light wood aging gives this wine a very smooth character. It's acidity and varietal character are subsumed into an almost Chardonnay richness and weight. The balance and the ripe flavors are impressive, while the final taste does bring out the pepper character of the grape.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2009 Black Edition Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: From a vineyard selection, this is a powerful wine, very rich and opulent. With a year's age, it shows concentrated spice and ginger mixed in with orange peel, red apple and lime flavors.
Name: Türk 2009 Frechau Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This smooth and rich wine has spiced apple, white peach and pink grapefruit flavors, all mixed into a serious package. It's a wine worth aging to bring the beautiful fruit right to the fore. Screwcap.
Name: Maurer 2010 Stoitzenberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The rich style of a Setzer wine is here, married to tight acidity, a mineral edge and ripeness. Pepper and white currant flavors come together in a mellifluous whole. Age for a year.
Name: Setzer 2010 Die Lage Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A wine with a core of steel. It is taut, nervy, full of acidity, creamed apples and a mineral character. It's powered by richness, although totally restrained by its tightness. It is an impressive wine with a good aging potential. Screwcap.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2010 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A single-vineyard wine that displays creamed pear and apple flavors, softly touched with wood. It's an elegant wine, although whether wood aging and Grüner go together is a debateable point. Let the wood soften and it will show more of the ripe fruit. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2009 Rabenstein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Intense, crisp acidity shines on this young wine. It's concentrated citrus is like sucking a lemon. This character shows its potential for aging. It will will develop richer, secondary flavors over the next 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Leth 2010 Steinagrund Lagenreserve Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Full and rich wine, its acidity brightening peach, melon and spice flavors. It is an expressive wine characterized by its ripe fruits, intense pepper and ginger. Screwcap.
Name: Laurenz V. 2009 Charming Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Still closed up when tasted in June 2011, but showing great promise. It has weight, with vanilla and spice flavors to complement the rich apricot, pear and lime notes. They will give an impressive, full wine in a year. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2010 Obere Steigen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: The castle of the Hardegg family is a magnificent edifice near the Czech border with Austria. The wine from the castle vineyards is concentrated and rich, hinting at vanilla with intense ripe mango and peach flavors. There is pepper, acidity and ripe fruit. Screwcap.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2010 Vom Schloss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A single-vineyard wine that shows elegance and a fine pedigree. It is rich, while also restrained by its mineral and apple edge. Full of fruit with added complexity from a tannic structure. Age over two years.
Name: Winzer Krems 2010 Kremser Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A wine that needs some aging. It is restrained at the moment, holding back its rich, very textured fruit flavors, along with acidity and a core of citrus. Keep for 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Maurer 2010 Urkristal Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Complex, mineral wine, crisp but also very, very textured. Flavors of peach and red apples work with pink grapefruit to give the fruit character, while there is also a more serious complexity of green herbs. The finish is soft, still mineral. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: With fruit picked on January 7, 2009, this superrich wine shines with acidity that picks out the fuller honey flavors. It has an almost unctuous texture, very smooth, with orange zest and peach giving a fresh side to the wine.
Name: Türk 2008 Eiswein 375ml Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Smooth and rounded, with a ripe pear and cream texture lightened by attractive acidity. This is rich, full of fruit and just touched by spice. Worth aging for a year, this concentrated wine can also be drunk now. Screwcap.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2010 Kirchlissen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Old vines—in this case with an average age of 50 years—give an extra concentration to this impressively rich wine. It is full of beautifully ripe apple and apricot fruit flavor, with a great zing of acidity. Age for a year. Screwcap.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2010 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Coming from two vineyards, here is a full-bodied and rich wine that employs spice as well as fresh green fruit flavors. Touched by herbs, asparagus and textured with apple skins, this is a complex wine for aging for a year. Screwcap.
Name: Schwarzböck 2010 Sätzen-Furstenberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Melon and pear flavors give this rich and spicy wine just the necessary freshness. It is equally honey and dried fruits, very rich, with an unctuous, ripe character. Screwcap.
Name: Bauer 2009 Hinternberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Delicious apple aromas give a wine that is as fresh as possible, with a pear skin texture. It's bright with almost a prickle on the tongue. Apples, grapefruit and other citrus fruits dominate this mouth-watering wine. Screwcap.
Name: Maurer 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The freshest apples that are also rich and textured mark this wine, which is also packed with totally tangy citrus while also having some weight. It's a delicious style of wine for food. Screwcap.
Name: Bauer 2010 Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Properly rich wine, full of spice, almost sweetness, with hints of honey as well as pepper, mango and fine tannins. A wine like this is meant to be aged, at least over the next 3–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2010 Terrassen Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Crisp apples give the wine its tautness and apricot adds a richer touch. This is a balanced, full wine, the fruit tempered by a more herbal, spicy character.
Name: Winzer Krems 2010 Kellermeister Privat Kremser Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: If you want to experience the pepper in Grüner Veltliner, this is the wine to drink. It has plenty of fruit as well—pear and white fruits, elderflower and light acidity. A great food wine.
Name: Setzer 2010 Ausstich Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Full and ripe, classic Grüner. It has spice, with red apple and pear fruits and a rounded, just oily texture, giving zest with the taut acidity. Drink now, especially with food. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2010 Ried Neuberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The wine walks a fine balance between taut acidity and riper red apple and green plum flavors. It has a distinct mineral edge, while offering a very concentrated pepper and spice finish. Screwcap.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2010 Freiberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Intensely fruity, combining a spicy edge with ripe apples and grapefruit. It is deliciously crisp, with some richness. The fruitiness goes through and through the wine. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: An apple-oriented wine, with a concentrated extra core. There is an earthy edge here, packed with acidity, offering some classic Grüner spice, while keeping the wine rich. Screwcap.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2010 Hermanschachtern Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Tight citrus and apple fruits give a distinct texture to this single-vineyard wine. It has young acidity that will soften in a few months, layered with grapefruit and green apples. Screwcap.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2010 Von den Rieden Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Full-bodied wine, with rich, succulent green fruits, laced with pepper and a balance of acidity. It's pure apples and lemons, with a texture of fruit skins. It could even age for a few months. Screwcap.
Name: Pleil 2010 Pfaffenhözel Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The 12th century Klosterneuburg monastery is home to the main Austrian wine school. No wonder that its own wines have exemplary grades. This vineyard-designated wine has some richness, a ripe and full character with pear and sweet currant flavors. Glass stopper.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2010 Hengsberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: On the pepper side of Grüner Veltliner, this rich, smooth wine combines a lightness of touch with intense lemon zest, orange and lychee flavors. It's young at the moment and needs another 1–2 years. Screwcap.
Name: Türk 2010 Kremser Weinberge Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: There is weight here, and some extraction. The wine feels fleshy, full of juicy ripe green and white fruits. There is pepper, spice and the ripest of green plums. A definite food wine. Screwcap.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Smooth, creamy wine, very clean green fruits layering acidity with a taut nervy texture and citrus flavors. The wine has a purity of lime that offers a great drink-now experience. Screwcap.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2010 Vom Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Tight, mineral wine, with apple and spice flavors. There is some weight as well as clean green fruits. There is an attractive fresh feel here, very drinkable now, best with food. Screwcap.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2010 Bürsting Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: ). Phillip Zull's offering in the light, fresh Grüner Veltliner stakes is as light and fresh as they come. It's a burst of fruitiness across the palate, starring bright citrus and green fruits, with bone-dry acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2010 Lust & Laune Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: For its light alcohol, the wine feels full, with caramel as well as green apple fruit flavors. There is a tang here, almost a prickle on the tongue. Screwcap.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2010 Veltlinsky Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A full wine, with ripe pear as well as acidity, touched with pepper. A round wine, and very fruity. Screwcap.
Name: Glatzer 2009 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: There is a full-bodied feel to this wine, an extra richness, with flavors of apples, pink grapefruit, a strong citrus element. The finish glows with acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Martinshof 2010 Hausberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A light and fruity wine, with attractive baked apple and lime flavors. It has dance in its step, fresh and packed with forward, lip-smacking fruitiness. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Soellner 2010 Wogenrain Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Attractive, zingy wine, full of lemon zest acidity, crisp green apples and clean, pure fruitiness. It has just a hint of pepper, layering the creamy final taste. Screwcap.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A very citrusy wine, all lemon juice and pink grapefruit. It is totally refreshing, crisp, as light as a feather, but with a tight tangy complexity to give extra interest. Screwcap.
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2010 Birthal Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Crisp green apples, very fresh, with a positive zing. This is a light Grüner, packed with attractive forward fruit flavors and a bright finishing acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2010 L&T Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: With just the right weight, this is a warm, rich and ultimately deliciously refreshing wine. Creamed apples, a tangy texture of clean acidity. Good as an aperitif, also with food. Screwcap.
Name: Martinshof 2010 Grüner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Fresh, totally dry, very fruity, this is a great quaffing white wine. Enjoy the flavors of white peach, citrus, bright and vivid acidity. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2010 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Chremisa is the Roman name for Krems. This wine is more modern in its clean, bright fruits. There are also minerality, orange peel and lemon and white peach flavors.
Name: Winzer Krems 2010 Edition Chremisa Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Some of the best value in Austria comes in liter bottles of Grüner Veltliner like this. It is packed with fruity apple and grapefruit flavors crisp and bright, with only a hint of pepper.
Name: Martinshof 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Refreshing on the nose and palate with vibrant notes of freshly cut grass, tart gooseberries and underripe melon, this unusual Finger Lakes Grüner has a squeaky clean, lemon-lime vitality that makes it an excellent seafood pairing.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

Description: As always, this is a fresh, fruity, light-bodied wine, with apples and the crispest acidity, just touched by pepper. A great value from Austria.
Name: Berger 2009 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Soft, just off dry wine that packs in ripe apples, green plums and pineapple. It has a really tangy, crisp texture, a slight prickle on the tongue.
Name: Winzer Krems 2010 Sandgrube 13 Pulverturm Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Showing excellent varietal character, this light, textural, delicately spicy white wine is finished at just 12.8% alcohol, yet remains quite dry. There is a pleasing saltiness to the mouthfeel, almost like an Albariño, and the finish is crisp and nicely detailed.
Name: Syncline 2010 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: A full-bodied wine, layering delicious apricot and pear fruits with lemon zest and an apple skin texture. With a great bite of acidity, this is a ripe yet also mineral wine. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2009 Rotenpullen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A powerful, spicy and wood-aged wine, this is opulent, rounded, generous. The weight does overpower some Grüner character, although there is a pepper edge as a reminder.
Name: Pratsch 2009 Steinberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Warm style of wine, with a light prickle on the palate, the spice as well as the green fruit making it classic Grüner. Delicious, soft, open, while still refreshingly textured. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2009 Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Young, fruity and ready to drink this summer, this is a great wine for apéritifs with its lemon and grapefruit flavors, very pure fruit and crisp acidity.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2010 Terrassen Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This ultrafresh wine is in a very different style from Grüners of the Danube regions. It goes for the apple juice and lime flavors in a zingy texture, and needs to settle for a few more months. Glass stopper.
Name: Zantho 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Attractive green fruit and citrus flavors. It has just a touch of pepper to go with its intensely fresh apple-skin-textured character. Bone dry, with lively acidity.
Name: Nigl 2008 Kremser Freiheit Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A warm style of Grüner, although still full of crisp lemon juice and fresh pear and lime. There is just a hint of pepper. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Höpler 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: The primary fruit has morphed into a sweeter, softer style, with melon and pear flavors coming to the fore. The acidity goes through the wine, balancing the soft texture.
Name: Winzer Krems 2009 Edition Chremisa Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A deliciously fresh wine, bright with grapefruit, green apple and white berry acidity. It is light, fruity, with a definite zing to the palate. To drink this summer. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2010 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A light Grüner Veltliner, with soft apple juice flavor and good spicy acidity. More spice appears on the finish, with soft, ripe white fruits.
Name: Laurenz V. 2009 Laurenz and Sophie Singing Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Impressively compact, complex wine. It has rich flavors of peach, spiced pear to go with the intense acidity that is under the full-bodied surface. It should be aged three years or more.
Name: Forstreiter 2009 Grande Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Big, serious, powerful wine, as complex as Grüner can be. It's powered by ripe apples and thyme, seasoned with pepper. The acidity sets the scene for a wine that can age.
Name: Forstreiter 2009 Tabor Reserve Die Räritat Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: While the aromas are luscious, what emerges on the palate is more austere, mineral in texture. The wine has a tight, nervy character, its white fruit and spice flavors laced with tense acidity. It needs 3-4 years.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2009 Lindberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Aromas of peach and mango waft from the glass. This is a rich wine, although dry, with a smooth, almost oily texture. Its ripe fruit is intense, with the yellow fruit flavors dominating acidity and pepper. It could age for several years.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2009 Von Stein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Von Schloss means that the wine comes from the Hardegg castle vineyards. A rich and complex wine, its creamed apple flavors given point by pineapple acidity. It has weight, ripe fruits, a hint of spice and a round, full texture on the finish.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2009 Vom Schloss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A rich wine, full of peach and pineapple flavors, with an herbal, spicy edge. It's full in the mouth, the texture oily and unctuous. At the end, the pepper character thrusts out of the glass.
Name: Forstreiter 2009 Schiefer Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A tightly textured wine, packed with acidity. Its grapefruit and green apple fruit lend a lively character layered with grainy acidity. There is a final touch of pepper and yeast.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2009 Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: From vines close to the Czech border, this wine is soft and yeasty in character, with juicy fruit, a ripe texture, citrus and bell pepper flavors. Age for 2-3 years.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2009 Steinbügel Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: An attractive wine, its fruit in the white currants and pear juice category. The acidity is finely integrated into this ripe fruit, with a warm, rich core. It's ready to drink, but the acidity will help it age.
Name: Forstreiter 2009 Kremser Kögl Bergwein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A wine that brings out characteristic pepper flavors to spice up the smooth white fruits. There is a crisp citrus element along with apple skins. Ready to drink now.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2009 Wiedenberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Typical pepper and spice flavors mark this wine as a classic, fresh, ready-to-drink Grüner. It's all about bright acidity and hints of minerality.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2009 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A wine that is pure, quaffable pleasure. There is no complexity, just clean, soft pear and pepper flavored fruit. The acidity is finely integrated into this ripe, mouthwatering wine.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2009 Austrian Pepper Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A soft, creamy wine, lightly textured with pear and apple juice flavors. It's immediately attractive, a delicious wine for apéritifs.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2009 Veltlinsky Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Light, fresh and bright, this is a delicious green-fruit wine, touched by pepper. The acidity dances through the wine, leaving a lively aftertaste.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2009 Hochterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Created for the American market, this wine does everything a fresh, lively Grüner Veltliner is supposed to. Light and ripe, with green apples and lime juice. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2009 Grooner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The Knoll Grüner style is for a hint of steel, doses of minerality and not too much ornateness despite the wonderfully elaborate traditional bottle labels. The intense fruit, spice and peach character is balanced by acidity, a taut, nervy edge. It will certainly age for 5–6 years.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2008 Ried Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Superb, rich, fruited wine that has an intense creamy character to go with spice and ripe apples, peach and greengage. It has great elegance, a very stylish character, keeping the richness beautifully in balance. Age this wine for 3–4 years.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2008 Ried Kreutles Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: In the creamy rich style that is the hallmark of many Kamptal Grüners, Fred Loimer's blend from different vineyards has ripe, juicy fruits, a delicious combination of mango, pear and crisper apple skins. Age for 2–3 years.
Name: Loimer 2009 Terrassen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is powerful, rich Grüner, one that brings out the pepper character as well as apricot and honey. There is a dense texture in this concentrated and well-balanced wine. It needs to age for 3–4 years.
Name: Stadt Krems 2009 Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The Herrenberg vineyard has a produced a wonderfully rich Grüner, its rich tropical character broad but never far from freshness. Pear juice and peaches dominate, with just a fleck of spice, pierced through with mouth watering acidity.
Name: Wieninger 2009 Herrenholz Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: A mineral, textured wine, peppery and tightly wrought with distinct acidity over the green fruits and vivid acidity. The wine is full, but powered by acidity to keep it crisp.
Name: Stadt Krems 2009 Weinzierlberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Rounded and rich from the top vineyard site of the Göttweig monastery, the wine has an impressive concentration, yellow fruit flavors and the lightest hint of spice with final acidity.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2009 Gottschelle Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: From Minick Family estate vineyards, this intense and thrilling Riesling has a Germanic 8.5% alcohol and 5.5% residual sugar balance, yet with acids so vivid and juicy that its sweetness is completely counterbalanced. Loaded with spicy pear and tart tangerine fruit flavors, it's a penetrating, dense and highly refreshing wine that explores a style that is both complex and user friendly.
Name: Winzer Krems 2009 Kremser Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Far and away the best yet from this five-year-old site, Syncline's 2009 GV is a remarkable wine. While retaining clear varietal character—light pepper, green herb, and a floral/citrus palate—it brings the vivid brightness of Washington fruit into play, along with a searing acidity and surprising body. All this and low (12.5%) alcohol.
Name: Syncline 2009 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: A steely side of Grüner here, very crisp with a strong mineral element. The wine is razor sharp and bright, with a brittle texture. With its vibrant acidity, this is a great food-pairing wine. Screw cap.
Name: Machherndl 2008 Kollmütz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Described by the producer as the crème de la crème of Veltliners, this is certainly concentrated, rich and spicy. It has baked apple, nutmeg, a touch of ginger to go with the ripe fruit. It's a food wine, best with rich fish or creamy cheeses. Screw cap.
Name: Felsner 2009 Gedersdorfer Vordernberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Full-bodied Grüner, packed with apricots and pineapple flavors to go with the crisp edge of acidity. It is ripe and vibrant, with a creamy, smooth aftertaste. Screw cap.
Name: Loimer 2009 Schellmann Ossi Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A rich and creamy character, underlined by pepper, sets this wine on a broad road. It has fine acidity as well, but it is the ripe structure that gives the wine character. There are delicious final apricot fruit flavors.
Name: Winzer Krems 2009 Edition Chremisa Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The Hengsberg vineyard, close to the Klosterneuburg monastery, produces this luscious Grüner, very concentrated and rich. Apples and pear flavors dominate, although underneath there is spice to add complexity. Worth aging for 1–2 years. Glass stopper.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2009 Hengsberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A racy Grüner, crisply fruity and packed with both acidity and the typical varietal spice. It has fine balance with ripe apples adding to the mix, leaving a wine with a great final tang. Screw cap.
Name: Wieninger 2009 Vienna Hills Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: A smooth wine, very focused on ripe fruit. It has apricot and pear flavors along with a lime-zest bite. This is pure Grüner, finishing both rich and crisp. Screw cap.
Name: Loimer 2009 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A very herbaceous Grüner, with grassy flavors as well as green fruit. It's fresh and refreshing, the cream and spice only coming through after a while. There is a fine line in bright, final acidity.
Name: Stift Göttweig 2009 Göttweiger Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The lightest Grüner, crisp with fresh apple, it has just a touch of spice, focusing more on tightly clean fruit. A perfect apéritif style. Screw cap.
Name: Loimer 2009 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: From rich soil on the lower terraces of the Kremstal, this is a classic Grüner, clean, crisp, fruity with apples and green plums and a touch of spice. Screw cap.
Name: Felsner 2009 Lössterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: An enticing apple aroma sets the scene for a fresh, crisp and deliciously refreshing sparkling wine. It preserves the natural acidity of the Grüner Veltliner, while adding a literally bubbly character, breezy, perfect for an apéritif.
Name: Szigeti NV Brut Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: The lightest wine from the 500-year-old Stadt Krems winery. It has an attractive edge of spice to go with its apple and cream texture. Not for aging, but a delicious apéritif wine.
Name: Stadt Krems 2009 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A firm and closed wine, packed with quince, pear, spice held in a mineral structure. It is potentially rich, but is still closed, needing several months to broaden out in all its richness.
Name: Markus Huber 2009 Berg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Both crisp and rich, a magical combination with beautiful acidity, light currants, the whole wine infused with honey. The final acidity leaves a long-lasting aftertaste.
Name: Norbert Bauer 2008 Eiswein 375ml Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A very focused wine with a core of strong structure along with apple, tight acidity and citrus. This is powerful, intense, with impressive aging potential.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2009 Singerriedel Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Harvested on December 15, this rich and sweet wine is light on acidity but heavy on concentrated apricot jam and honey flavors. It is opulent, intense, with a bright ginger spice aftertaste.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2009 Eiswein 375ml Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Initially smooth and rich, this slowly reveals a taut mineral character that acts as a powerful structure. Yellow fruits and mangos are woven into this texture, leaving the final acidity to suggest aging potential.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2009 Steinporz Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Planted with cuttings from many Austrian wine regions, the Aussere Bergen vineyard produces a ripe, full wine, packed with yellow fruits, spice and a feeling of opulence, while always balanced.
Name: Zull 2009 Aussere Bergen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A wood-aged Grüner, with a definite toast and caramel element, concentrated ripe plums and greengage. The aftertaste reveals fresher fruit and acidity.
Name: Norbert Bauer 2009 Haidberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Smooth and rich, with ripe, spiced peach as well as a mineral edge. The acidity tightens the generous texture of this powerful wine, leaving the concentration deliciously fresh.
Name: Markus Huber 2009 Alte Setzen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: From cool vineyards, this is an impressive, steely, crisp wine, mineral in texture, with tight fruit, fresh but always in tension.
Name: Norbert Bauer 2009 Kellerberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Very mineral in character, this tastes of the stones of the steep Singerriedel vineyard. The wine shows tight texture—acidity along with green fruit flavors. The aftertaste brings out citrus freshness.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2009 Singerriedel Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A beautifully rich wine, packed with pear juice and light acidity. The soft texture balances well with ripe green plum flavors and a final creamy character.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2009 Hohenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: A powerful, full and ripe style that still manages to preserve bright apple and green herb flavors. Crisp fruit and mineral combine harmoniously.
Name: Zull 2009 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: In a ripe style, this is soft, with creamed apple and pear flavors, smooth and light. There is a touch of attractive spice to go with the final acidity.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2009 Axpoint Fedespiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Soft and fresh style of wine that feels full without losing its light touch. Delicious baked apple and nutmeg flavors finish this bright wine.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2009 Von den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Very fresh, crisp fruit, light and with a soft, green plum skin texture. The aftertaste is lively, bright.
Name: Norbert Bauer 2009 Altenberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Attractive fresh fruit, crisp apples and vivid acidity make a great citrus wine, perfect as an apéritif.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2009 Kalmuck Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fresh and light, with acidity, citrus and grapefruit flavors plus a touch of pear.
Name: Zull 2009 Lust & Laune Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is the third vintage of Rudi Pichler's Reserve from the Kollmutz Vineyard. It shows an extra richness over the already concentrated Smaragd, a powerhouse of intensity, spice, mango, oregano and lemon verbena crispness. The balance is already there, now the wine needs to mature.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2008 Wösendorfer Kollmutz Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: An evocative spice and caramel aroma combine with ripe yellow peach. To taste, the peach comes through strongly, while the fabulous taut structure keeps the wine tightly wound with acidity and minerality. The final taste is just off dry.
Name: F X Pichler 2008 Dürnsteiner Kellerberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: M stands for Monumental as in powerful, impressive. This ripe, sweet Grüner is certainly that, a late-harvest wine of impeccable purity. Figs, mango and intense spice give an exotic feel to this opulent wine. It is beautifully layered, peeling back wonderful flavors.
Name: F X Pichler 2008 M Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Stunningly beautiful wine, its pure fruit driven by its mineral and spice texture. This is impressive Grüner, tasting of the hard rocks and heat of the Wachau while keeping bright yellow and apple flavors. Age for 4–5 years or more.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2008 Wösendorfer Hochrain Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A parcel of old vines in the Achleiten Vineyard is trained on individual posts rather than wires. Somehow this brings out enormous minerality, the steely feel to the wine suggesting long aging.
Name: Prager 2009 Achleiten Stockkultur Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Pepper and minerality dominate this elegant wine. It is still extraordinarily young, its structure more important than the beautiful green and white fruit flavors, crispened by pineapple acidity. It will age for many years.
Name: F X Pichler 2008 Loibner Berg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Smooth wine, its smoky aromas leading to a ripe texture of spiced peach, baked apples and a fresh asparagus intensity. The wine has weight without any loss of freshness. Age for 4–5 years.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2008 Wösendorfer Kollmutz Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Full in the mouth, packed with spice along with tight acidity, white fruit juice and a lively edge of acidity. This is an impressively rich wine that preserves the tension of Wachau Grüner.
Name: Prager 2009 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Rounded, creamy style, flavors of spice, pear juice, green herbs and uplifting acidity. There is a taut mineral structure that gives the wine bite along with final acidity.
Name: Schmelz 2008 Pichl Point Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Brilliant, fresh wine, crisp and showing rich fruit that bursts out of the glass. It has fresh-cut grass aromas, green fruits, a hint of pepper and the brightest acidity.
Name: Schmelz 2008 Höhereck Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Powerful, creamy wine with intense spice, quince and lychee flavors, the acidity coming slowly through but never very apparent. Richness, concentration, with aging potenial.
Name: Rainer Wess 2009 Loibenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: From vineyards at 1500 feet, this has a cool mountain feel to it. The minerality, flint and acidity are major elements in this wonderfully crisp-textured wine, spiced with pepper and salt.
Name: Prager 2009 Wachstum Bodenstein Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A brilliant, fresh wine, beautifully integrated, bringing together green apple, papaya and intense acidity. The texture has spice, nutmeg and ginger to go with the taut minerality. A wine for aging.
Name: Alzinger 2008 Steinertal Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A wonderful viscous texture underlies a wine that is beautifully balanced between sweetness and crispness. The honeyed flavors go with ripe yellow nectarines and the wine glides around the mouth. Delicious now, but it will surely age. Screwcap.
Name: Nigl 2008 Trockenbeerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Full, ripe wine, given great freshness from its green fruit flavors. It is textured, with a fine edginess followed by a light layer of acidity. The aftertaste is mineral, austere.
Name: Rainer Wess 2009 Pfaffenberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A beautiful wine that manages to have a great panoply of rich fruits and spices along with pure green apple acidity. It is intense, but so balanced and poised.
Name: Nikolaihof 2008 Im Weingebirge Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: An aroma that is as much light citrus as richer fruit sets the scene for this tight, mineral-driven wine. It has ripe, concentrated fruit, with definite acidity. Give it three years for the taut structure to broaden out. Screwcap.
Name: Nigl 2009 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Powerful, cream-textured wine, with a dry core of spice and tight mineral acidity. It has pear and baked apple flavors, with dried apricot richness. An intense finish.
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2008 Dürnsteiner Supperlin Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Big and rich, very concentrated wine. It packs smooth pear, quince and green plum fruits along with a touch of spice. The acidity fits well in this delicious wine.
Name: Felsner 2009 Alte Reben Rohrendorfer Leithen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Intensely flavored wine, packed with both spice and acidity. The fruit is an extension of the fresh face of the wine that contrasts with weight and concentrated pepper and nutmeg flavors.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2009 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Despite its richness, this is so fresh, the acidity a delicious counterpoint to the rounded fruits. Soft spice and layers of pear juice give extra complexity. Screwcap.
Name: Nigl 2009 Senftenberger Pellingen Privat Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: A rare wine in the Northwest. It is a lightly floral, mineral-infused, vivid wine, with the white peppery character of the grape, and a mix of citrus fruit flavors somewhat reminiscent of New Zealand Sauvignon Blancs. Excellent penetration and structure.
Name: Viento 2009 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Why not an Oregon Grüner? With its nuanced aromas trailing flint and smoke through a core of grapefruit, pineapple and melon, this is a welcome warm weather wine. Just 12.5% alcohol, a solid midpalate and a hint of vanilla cookie in the lingering finish.
Name: Illahe 2009 Estate Grüner Veltliner (Willamette Valley)

Description: This bright wine bursts with crisp acidity as well as layered pear and apple fruits. It is already a delicious wine, its vivid texture a foil to the edge of spice. Screwcap.
Name: Nigl 2009 Senftenberger Piri Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: While it has a rounded, rich texture, the wine also has just the right amount of freshness, allied to a pinch of spice. Yellow fruits, sprinkled with pepper, are given a firm lift of acidity.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2009 Terrassen Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: On the fresh side, with some rich texture, this is a finely balanced wine. Smooth flavors of pear, mango and ginger go with grapefruit acidity.
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2008 Loibner Klostersatz Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A broad, rich wine with spice, pepper and a fine, fresh acidity. This is ripe, retaining a good balance. Screwcap.
Name: Felsner 2009 Gedersdorfer Moosburgerin Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Typical light and fresh Grüner, with an attractive burst of lemon acidity as well as a creamy texture. Delicious, crisp wine. Screwcap.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2009 Terrassen Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fresh lime and lemon aromas lead into a soft and creamy wine, with just a hint of spice and lychee. Final grapefruit acidity renders the wine as crisp as possible. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2008 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Not so much sweet as intensely rich, peppery and zesty with orange peel and spiced pear juice flavors. It is concentrated, intense, likely to last for many years.
Name: Nigl 2007 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Spiced fruit, creamed apples and some ripe tangy character all work together to give a bright, peppery wine, delicious now but worth aging for 1–2 years. The wine has great intensity, but seems to float easily between the fruit and the taut ageworthy character. Screwcap.
Name: Bründlmayer 2009 Berg Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Very mineral in style, but quite warm, with a lime and final grapefruit core. Fresh in character, but at the same time it is concentrated, and could age for a couple of years.
Name: Markus Huber 2009 Obere Steigen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Described as the “wine served at the Vienna Opera Ball,” Austria's most glittering social occasion, this is a smooth style of Grüner Veltliner. It floats easily with pear and green plum flavors topped with a serving of cream.
Name: Winzer Krems 2009 Kellermeister Privat Kremser Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is pure, crisp Grüner, with a lovely acidity and citrus fruit along with green apple skins. A very transparent, mineral wine, packed with intensity. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2009 Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Josef Gritsch's vineyards are in Spitz at the western, cool end of the Wachau. So although this a richer, Smaragd style of wine, it is still crisp, cool and fresh. The green fruits dominate, with just a hint of sweeter spiced pineapple.
Name: Graben-Gritsch 2008 Schön Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Crisp Grüner, bright, packed with tight, lively green fruits, laced with acidity. The wine is clean, fresh and has a lively finish. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2008 Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A full-in-the-mouth, fat, oily-textured wine, the acidity going with spice and a peppered pear fruit character. It's ripe, still young, with a very clean character and a waft of fresh acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2008 Steinberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is very soft, open and opulent. It has a generous character, with apricots and tangy acidity. The final burst is of grapefruit and orange zest.
Name: Bründlmayer 2009 Kamptaler Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: While it is certainly fresh, the wine has a broad character, showing ripe white fruits alongside bright white currants. There is a fine depth to the fruit and the balancing acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2008 Vom Leithagebirge Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: A delicious, fresh wine, just lightly peppery and featuring the crispest apple texture, so fresh and bright, with an aftertaste that is soft. For drinking now, to keep all that vivid flavor. Screwcap.
Name: Winzer Krems 2009 Pulverturm Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Despite its Kabinett (off dry) designation, this tastes bone dry, allowing all the crispness of the fruit to shine. It is full of white fruit, lemon and grapefruit flavors, a great burst of freshness. Screwcap.
Name: Winzer Krems 2009 Ried Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This wine exhibits a fresh apples and citrus character, with light, bright acidity, just a touch of pepper and a light, creamy finish.
Name: Berger 2008 Grüner Veltliner 1 liter Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: On the creamy side of Grüner, a wine that brings fresh acidity, green fruits and an edge of richer white fruits. There is a pleasing smoothness, well enlivened by acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2008 Rötenpullen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Very crisp fruit, with light acidity and a taut character. A lively wine, bright and vivacious, packed with citrus. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2009 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
