Description: A deliciously crisp, clean style, offering peppered apple and spice with a fine grapefruit acidity. Great apéritif style, bright and fresh. Screwcap.
Name: Hugl-Wimmer 2008 Hugl Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Light and very fresh, crystal-clear wine, with light, bright acidity and very soft creamy pear flavors. A perfect apéritif style. Screwcap.
Name: Nigl 2009 Kremser Freiheit Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A wine with wonderful citrus character, the fruit creamy with a great ripe swathe of honey and spice. The Käferberg vineyard, on a granite shoulder with clay topsoil, gives this warm, rich style of wine. Age for at least 3–4 years for a great Grüner Veltliner.
Name: Bründlmayer 2008 Käferberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The concentration here is enormous, from low-yielding old vines. The wine has the characteristic pepper edge, but the creamy character, the ripe lychees and green plums, are all more dominant. At the end, a distinct spiciness shows through. Age ideally for 3–4 years.
Name: Weinrieder 2007 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A bold Grüner Veltliner, with spice and minerality to go with the rich fruit. There is a steely edge that suggests the wine needs a year's aging, to bring on greater richness. Big and impressive.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2008 Hundsleiten Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A great oily texture, pierced by the most wonderful acidity, supports a pure assembly of tropical fruits and crisp freshness. It is a concentrated elixir, every drop to be savored.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2007 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: There is power here, the weight of fruit packing white peach and currant flavors structured around a mineral core. The wine is for aging, with its strong texture, its edge of apple skins and its layered acidity.
Name: Malat 2008 Gottschelle Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: With its ginger spice and lemon honey, this brings out both the nature of the Grüner and the intense sweetness of the botrytis. Lime marmalade flavors give richness, acidity gives balance. An impressive wine, for aging.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2007 Beerenauslesel Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This is impressive, both from its richness and alcohol (the narrow Krems River Valley is an oven in summer) and from its pure fruit and balance. The texture is smooth, with apricot, white peach, caramel and pepper. It never loses a sense of freshness, the acidity floating over the rich fruit flavors.
Name: Proidl 2007 Ehrenfels vom Urgenstein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Reserve by name, reserved by nature, a wine that is only now slowly coming out of its tight shell of mineral acidity. There are hints of pears, green fruits and spice. It will be another year before it begins to show its true character.
Name: Weinrieder 2007 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: In a creamy style, with green plum and pear flavors spiced with green pepper sauce, the wine rolls richly around the mouth. The finish is freshened deliciously by acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Anton Bauer 2008 Grande Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: On a Steininger label, Grand Grü means wood aged—in this case large acacia wood barrels. This is a beautifully ripe wine, full-bodied, packed with apricot, pear and richness. There is light sweetness from the richness of the fruit, finishing with vivid spice and lime.
Name: Steininger 2008 Grand Grü Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Creamy and rich, with flavors of almonds, apples and cream. Apricots steal in, along with honey and a vivid final tang of citrus zest. The minerality gives a powerful pull to the wine, offering the driest of finishes.
Name: Stadt Krems 2008 Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Named after the wine museum in Langenlois, the wine is full, bringing out the spice and pepper of the grape, extracting yellow fruits. The finish is more tangy, zesty, bright. Glass stopper.
Name: Steininger 2008 Loisium Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A fresh delicate style, the sweetness fleeting over the fruit, giving an orange marmalade character, but retaining lightness, lifted by a final acidity.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2007 Auslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: There's great ripe fruit here, a wine that has both intense pepperiness and fresh acidity, speaking of terroir. While the wine is intense, it is also as crisp as possible, finally well concentrated and firm. Screwcap.
Name: Anton Bauer 2008 Rosenberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: “Light but ripe” seems a great combination, and this wine fits that bill well. It has the richness, with apples and cream flavors, and a good layer of spice and caramel. But the freshness is pervasive, giving deliciously light flavors through the finish.
Name: Proidl 2008 Senftenberger Rameln Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A rounded wine, expressing its attractive, somehow creamy texture through apple and grapefruit flavors. It is poised, certainly not heavy, great as an apéritif wine.
Name: Malat 2008 Höhlgraben Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fine green fruit gives great freshness in this crisp, citrus and apple flavored wine, lightly softened with melon. Pure, clean, a lively, bright wine.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2008 Haidviertel Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: From young vines on valley floor vineyards, this is a simple but delicious wine. Ginger, cinnamon and lime come together to give freshness with a twist. The finish is crisp. Screwcap.
Name: Loimer 2008 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This wine is just right, with its rich but mineral character bringing out the warmth of the Kremstal vineyards. Flavors of green plums and sweet lychee dominate the purest of fruit flavors.
Name: Stadt Krems 2008 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Spicy, creamy, floral wine, with yeast flavors and a prominent spice character. The mousse prickles the palate, with lemongrass and citric zest flavors. The wine feels full-bodied, with final richness.
Name: Steininger 2007 Grüner Veltliner Sekt Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fresh apple and pear flavored wine, very creamy, toasty almost, with only just a pinch of pepper to go with the richness of the fruit. A warm, rounded wine, easily finished with acidity. Screwcap.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2008 Austrian Pepper Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is the lightest of the Grüners from Proidl, offering a refreshing burst of crisp acidity along with the freshest spice. There is a fine tang of lemon, to keep the whole wine as bright as possible.
Name: Proidl 2008 Senftenberger Freiheit Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The slopes below the Stift Gottweig monastery are the source of this attractively crisp, light wine, its acidity and fresh fruit a pure pleasure to drink. There is a twist of minerality here, just to add extra interest. Screwcap.
Name: Malat 2008 Gottweiger Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A selection made at the end of the harvest (hence its name, The Best). It is an opulent, ripe wine, with fruit that has concentration, dark spice and pepper and rich, full-bodied texture. There is no mistaking the depth of flavor of this impressive wine.
Name: Malat 2008 Das Beste Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Ripe, rounded, creamy wine, with sweet spice, but still with a reservoir of the freshest acidity. Green apple fruits add crispness, while the wine finishes in a golden afterglow. Screwcap.
Name: Sepp Moser 2008 Breiter Rain Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Rich in style, this wine comes from three different vineyards. It has white currant and spice and a great lively swathe of tight fruit. With power and concentration, this is a wine with fine potential.
Name: Malat 2008 Dreigärten Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A single vineyard wine, firm and steely with pear and spice hints. It is beautifully defined, structured, finishing with some hints of secondary flavors of almonds.
Name: Sepp Moser 2007 Schnabel Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: With aromas of spice and ginger, this fresh, lightly acid wine has attractive mineral characters, but with a creamy, rich undertow. Very pure in character, with a delightful floral aftertaste. Screwcap
Name: Sepp Moser 2008 Gebling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A powerful wine, with acidity, tight fresh fruit and prominent acidity. That green herbal element is balanced with ripe and rich white and yellow fruits. A wine for long-term aging.
Name: Ludwig Neumayer 2008 Zwirch Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: Rich and smooth, the concentration from old vines giving powerful white fruit and spice flavors. The acidity is there, a thread through the whole wine, finishing with freshness.
Name: Proidl 2008 Senftenberger Pellingen Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A full, dominantly spicy wine, with ripe caramel and apples and freshness. It is a bright, lively wine, which keeps good weight and concentration.
Name: Proidl 2008 Senftenberger Burg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A light, fresh wine with fine acidity and a good line in steely minerality. The green apple fruits give an extra dimension of crispness. Screwcap.
Name: Sepp Moser 2008 Von den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A crisp, tight, beautifully clean wine, very fresh, with apple skin characters to go with its lively acidity. While it is not for aging, it certainly packs a great glass of delicious fruit.
Name: Markus Huber 2008 Obere Steigen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)

Description: The Lamm vineyard, next door to the Riesling vineyard of Heiligenstein, produces powerful Grüners, and this 2008 is a fine example. It is opulent without being overpowering, the white currants and pears layered with acidity to give balance and texture. As with other great Bründlmayers, this needs aging. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Bründlmayer 2008 Ried Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A glorious, ripe, spicy wine that keeps its origins clear with its tight edge of stone and steel, which brings the acidity under the sweet pear and yellow berry fruits. With its rich, round finale, this is a firm but opulent wine. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Prager 2007 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Johann Schmelz has produced a voluptuous wine, full of ripe fruits and a velvet texture. Of course, the acidity is there, giving the wine a crisp edge, but it is the rich structure and flavors of apricots, red apples and spice that blend together in a harmonious, balanced whole. Imported by Blue Danube Wine Co.
Name: Schmelz 2007 Pichl Point Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A structured, powerful wine from the Lamm single vineyard. Big white fruits are spiced with coriander, lifted by green pea flavors and bright acidity. It is very rich but totally disciplined, keeping its intensity in a tight minerality. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2008 Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The Höhereck vineyard is close to Dürnstein castle, where the English king Richard the Lionheart was imprisoned in the 12th century. This Smaragd, richly endowed with yellow fruits, fennel and delicious acidity, is keen to escape from the glass, bringing a waft of hedgerow flowers and a final layer of spice. Imported by Blue Danube Wine Co.
Name: Schmelz 2007 Höhereck Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: From a rare collection of old, post-trained vines, (each trained on its own post), this is a half-dry wine, its fresh currant flavors rounded by honey, spice and a sharp surge of minerality from the soil. There is a lovely, smooth, almost velvet finish. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Prager 2007 Achleiten Stockkultur Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: At 1500 feet, this vineyard is the highest in the Wachau. The wine has elegance as well as richness, an impressive combination of white pear spice, citrus acidity and a final burst of mango. Definitely for aging. Imported by Vin Divino
Name: Prager 2007 Wachstum Bodenstein Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The late-harvest Aurum is Josef Ehmoser's flagship. The newly released 2008 is bold and ripe, the acidity of the intense fruit cutting through herbs, spice, vanilla and tropical fruits. It is definitely from super-ripe fruit, but Ehmoser manages to retain a delicious balance. Screwcap. Imported by Magellan Wine Imports.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2008 Aurum Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: A round, smooth-texture wine, offering a generous mix of citrus and honey flavors, filling out the structure. The acidity supports the flavors of ripe yellow fruits, pear and pepper. It is beginning to develop into a concentrated, impressive wine. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Loimer 2007 Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The schist soil of the vineyard shows in the smoky, spicy character of the wine. It is full of life, ready to set out on a long journey of development, as the blackcurrant and ripe berry fruits mingle with nutmeg, the whole shot through with fresh fruit acidity. The final is rich, long lasting.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2008 Renner Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A real terroir wine, driven by minerality, fresh fruit—concentrated pear and citrus—and a tight green plum skin texture and taut tannins. This is a wine with great potential. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Bründlmayer 2008 Berg Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The vineyard is planted with a density of 8000 plants per hectare, reducing yields but increasing intensity. With enormous concentration, it is super-rich but not quite over the top. Yellow fruits are the evident hallmark here, with pineapple acidity and a dash of pepper. Age for at least five years. Screwcap. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines. Cellar Selection.
Name: Setzer 2008 8000 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Its grapes picked at the end of November, this is a wine that plays between dryness and sweetness. Much of the fruit is on the dry side—citrus, grapefruit, green plums—but then there is a sweeter, spicy pear element, which adds to the roundness from a period of wood aging. Give it a few months to reconcile the two elements completely and there will be a powerful, delicious wine. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2008 Steinsetz Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A delicious, crisp wine, with depth of flavor and the lightest touch of spice. It has a lively, crisp, mineral texture, the acidity going right through the green plum and gooseberry flavors. There is a great waft of fresh fruit on the finish. Screwcap. Imported by Blue Danube Wine Co.
Name: Schmelz 2007 Pichl Point Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Harvested in December 2008, this is almost late harvest in its intensity of fruit, yet remains dry. It is rich, peppery, smooth and ripe at the same time. Flavors are of pear and apricot, with concentrated spice and creamy smoothness. Screwcap. Imported by Blue Danube Wine Co.
Name: Weinrieder 2008 Schneiderberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Full in the mouth, this is a rounded wine, bringing out the warmth of the Loiben vineyards. It has flavors of peach, apricot and melon, followed by spice. Crispness comes right at the end, leaving a lively, lifted aftertaste. Screwcap. Imported by Blue Danube Wine Co.
Name: Schmelz 2007 Loibner Gärten Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Made in a style that consciously echoes the 19th century, this wine, with its weight, its wood and its caramel flavors, is very different from any others in the Gobelsburg range—or, indeed, anything else in Kamptal. But it is not just a curiosity, because its richness and round texture are welcoming, ripe and full of yellow fruits. Already a pleasure to drink. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2007 Tradition Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fifty-year old vines form the basis of this rich wine. It brings out an exotic, concentrated spicy character along with green plum, pear fruits and bright acidity. The smooth texture sits on an ageworthy wine. Give it 2–3 years. Screwcap. Imported by Grape Expectations (CA).
Name: Felsner 2007 Alte Reben Rohrendorfer Leithen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a rich wine, presenting concentrated white peach and Bartlett pear flavors in a generous, creamy texture, smooth and round. That's not to forget the crisp acidity that offers a fresh, but still full-bodied, finale. Imported by Total Wine & More.
Name: Winzer Krems 2008 Kremser Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A blockbuster of a wine, the fruit dominated by ripe yellow pears, with hints of honey. Initially, it seems almost too much, but then you taste the juicy acidity. The spice element is as if it came from a shaker, sprinkled over this rich wine. Imported by Domaine Select Wine Estates.
Name: Leth 2008 Scheiben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: A crisp wine that shows fresh plum and green berry fruits over a tight structure. It is restrained initially and then bursts with acidity. A definite wine of terroir, marked by finishing minerality. Imported by Weygandt-Metzler.
Name: Jäger 2007 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: An intense and spicy wine, with textures of cream and flavors of pepper. Very dry, it doesn't stray far from its mineral character, giving richness as much as freshness. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Loimer 2007 Langenlois Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: From the Eichholz south-facing single vineyard, this is a wine that takes its minerality from limestone soil, which gives it concentration. White fruits are sprinkled with pepper and balanced with intense acidity. It is, of course, still young, needing 2–3 years. Screwcap. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Setzer 2008 Die Lage Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: An intense, smooth, single-vineyard wine, packed with ripe white fruits, yeast, white peaches and a smoky, vanilla edge. The acidity is balanced with the richness, the green berries going with the tight, taut texture. For aging, at least three years.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2008 Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Wonderfully rich, edging towards—and just avoiding—being too much. It is full-bodied, fruity, offering flavors of yellow fruits, orange zest and pineapple juice, the citrus flavors cutting right through all the richness. Worth aging. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Loimer 2007 Käferberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ausstich means a personal selection, and this is Hans Setzer's favorite. It is crisp to the core, with concentration surrounding this steely interior. The texture is taut, leavened by pepper, giving a wine that bursts with freshness but is also well-rounded. Screwcap. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Setzer 2008 Ausstich Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Many Austrian producers have a wine they call Terrassen—a blend of different, sometimes lesser, vineyards. Somehow, Bründlmayer's sets a standard that's hard to beat. It epitomizes the crisp character of 2008, but adds in concentration, white fruits, spice and a delicious fresh, apple skin texture. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Bründlmayer 2008 Kamptaler Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A rich style of Grüner, with ripe pear and melon flavors broadened by a rounded texture. The freshness comes from a delicious core of white currant acidity that gives crispness to the final spice. Imported by Total Wine & More.
Name: Winzer Krems 2008 Edition Chremisa Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A big, ripe, full-bodied wine from a single vineyard on the slopes of the Wagram, this is dominated by pears, concentrated spice and a lively lift of tight acidity. It's an impressive, vital wine, still in its infancy. Screwcap. Imported by Magellan Wine Imports.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2008 Hohenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: With its enticing, fresh aromas, this is a delightfully crisp wine, the acidity sustaining a great mineral element and hinting at caramel roundness. Imported by Legendary Wine Company.
Name: Josef Fritz 2008 Himmelreich Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: A deliciously smooth, creamy wine, packed with concentrated, ripe yellow fruits with touches of fresh apricots, but balanced by a very crisp texture. A single-vineyard wine, this deals immediate pleasure and likely a few years' aging. Screwcap. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2008 Freiberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: While there is plenty of rich white fruit and even a touch of caramel, it is the steely core that gives the wine its lively freshness and its raciness. It is still young, though, so another few months would benefit it. Screwcap. Imported by Weygandt-Metzler.
Name: Jäger 2007 Ried Weitenberg Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A wine that brings out the spice in Grüner, with a tight, mineral and green fruit series of flavors. This is fresh, relatively delicate, but leaving a final juicy apple acidity. Screwcap. Imported by Blue Danube Wine Co.
Name: Schmelz 2007 Steinwand Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is barely 12% alcohol, from a cool site in the Columbia Gorge AVA. It is searingly tart, with sharp lime, barely ripe pineapple, green apple flavors, and a hint of white pepper in the nose. A fine wine for oysters.
Name: Syncline 2008 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: Concentrated, dry, tight but fresh fruit, a touch of acidity, apple skin  texture and a final edge of minerality are all on display in this clean, green wine. Screwcap. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2008 Vom Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Manfred Felsner coaxes the ripest, creamiest character out of Grüner Veltliner. This single-vineyard wine has an almost unctuous, certainly ultra-smooth texture. Yes, there is a touch of spice, the finish has attractive acidity, but that soft floating texture is the hallmark. Screwcap. Imported by Grape Expectations (CA).
Name: Felsner 2008 Gedersdorfer Moosburgerin Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Crisp, very dry, light in some ways, but also with a rounded element. There is a good depth of flavor here over lively apple skin tannins. The wine is made from young vines as well as purchased grapes. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2008 Gobelsburger Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Karl Fritsch's base Grüner sums up his style perfectly. Freshness, lightness of touch, bright and easy to drink, but at the same time capturing the crisp edge of the grape and the warmth of the vineyard. Crisp, green fruits bring the whole wine together.
Name: Weinberghof Fritsch 2008 Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: This is apéritif Grüner, a light, joyous wine, piled with flavors of apples, herbs and green fruits—a style that is totally refreshing. It is vivacious, fruity and easy drinking. Imported by Domaine Select Wine Estates.
Name: Leth 2008 Steinagrund Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Bright green fruits, touches of green pepper, lemon zest: this wine is all about primary fresh tastes. It is crispy clean, spiced with pepper and well filled out with white plums. Drink this year. Imported by Legendary Wine Company.
Name: Josef Fritz 2008 Schafberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Fresh, crisp, green fruits with a definite spicy character are followed by a burst of green apple acidity and a light prickle on the tongue. Light and delicious. Imported by Total Wine & More
Name: Winzer Krems 2008 Kellermeister Privat Kremser Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A wine that exhibits the creamy side of Grüner, all pears and cream with a baked apple skin texture over a soft hint of spice. It is still young and needs a few more months to settle down. Screwcap. Imported by Grape Expectations (CA). Best Buy.
Name: Felsner 2008 Lössterrassen Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Made from purchased grapes, this is a delicious, simple, crisp wine, with apple and pear flavors, some weight, but more to do with easy, fresh drinking. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2008 Domäne Gobelsburg Grüner Veltliner (Austria)

Description: Fresh and crisp, with a classic touch of pepper, wonderfully light in character. This is a real quaffing wine, with refreshing green citrus character and a smoother final layer of creaminess. Screwcap. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2008 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a wonderful apéritif, light in style and totally quaffable. Lychee, apples and cream are lifted by spice and pepper in the most delicate quantities. It is easy and crisp, benefiting from a cooler, east-facing vineyard. Screwcap. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Setzer 2008 Vesper Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Loimer's entry-level Grüner is charming, fresh and crisp, a modern reinterpretation of the heurige wine, the new wine served in country pubs. Of course, this is more sophisticated, but it has the same easy-going character, with citrus, crispness and a fresh finish. Screwcap. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Loimer 2008 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The crispest wine, with a youthful freshness, so light and easy. There is just a hint of sweetness here, a curve of roundness. This is Grüner at its enjoyable simplest. Screwcap. Imported by Winesellers Ltd..
Name: Pratsch 2008 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A deliciously light, fresh, grassy Grüner, crisp, with a great label, lively level of acidity and bright green plum flavors. There is just a touch of pepper to make this a friendly food wine. Imported by Frederick Wildman & Sons, Ltd.
Name: Forstreiter 2008 Grooner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: From a 12-acre vineyard, this is a soft, round wine with white pear spice, marked by a farmyard character that is not completely clean. Screwcap. Imported by Winesellers Ltd.
Name: Pratsch 2007 Rotenpüllen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Unctuous-textured wine, opulent, with impressively ripe fruit, this starts powerfully and continues that way. The big spicy dried fruits are right up front, with a dry core of tannins at the center. A fine, rounded wine, just freshened with some finishing acidity.
Name: Rainer Wess 2007 Loibenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: From Nikolaihof's reserve library collection, this is living, vivid proof of the aging ability of Grüner Veltliner. The wine is still fresh, a lively line of acidity giving bite and shape to flavors of fresh almonds, dried fruits and a rounded final caramel taste. This is a wine to savor, to sip and relish.
Name: Nikolaihof 1993 Vinothek Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A full-bodied, spicy style of Grüner that still keeps its sense of minerality and structure. The wine is fruity, its pear flavors dominant at first. But then the concentration and the freshness both deepen the taste and lift it at the same time. An impressive wine, epitomizing both rich Grüner and a taut, cool-climate character.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2007 Axpoint Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The heat of the Pfaffenberg vineyard shows strongly in this wine. This is a big, concentrated waft of yellow fruits, given some spice and finished with a tight pear skin texture. Worth aging, to bring the spice fully into balance.
Name: Rainer Wess 2007 Pfaffenberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Martin Mittelbach rolls out this intense, concentrated wine, which packs spice, ripe pineapple and apricots and a final floral character that fills the mouth. A wine to age for at least four years. Screwcap.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2008 Höhereck Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Franz Hirtzberger tells us about harvest dates on his back labels: the fruit for this wine was harvested up to November 21, the result of the cool year. But the late harvest has brought out a wonderful richness of fruit flavors, the wine packed with spice, yellow fruits, livened up by sweet acidity. For aging—give it four years at least.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2007 Honivogl Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Finely balanced, a wine that exudes class and freshness. The green and yellow fruits fill the mouth, round but always with a layer of crispness. Everything comes together, the fruit, the acidity and the rich undertow of spice. Screwcap.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2008 Loibenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The wine has richness, but it is the balancing freshness that makes this wine so delicious. There is also a core of tight structure, a layer of spice that comes through strongly. But that tense freshness holds the wine together and promises aging.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2007 Ried Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: You can feel the richness of this wine as it rolls opulently around the mouth. The Grüner spice character is dominant, giving intense concentration to go with the yellow fruits. Acidity is a balanced addition to the mix on this impressive wine.
Name: Alzinger 2007 Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A fine, dry combination of richness and freshness, with intense green fruits, showing some spice but mostly a pure line of acidity, ripeness and a tight edge of apple skins. There is a great, juicy finish, clean and fresh.
Name: Nikolaihof 2007 Im Weingebirge Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: There's power in this concentrated wine. The texture is rich, velvet, touched by pepper, ripe acidity and pear skins. Along with its creamy, rounded character, the wine has the bite of tight spice and a dry, firm core.
Name: Alzinger 2007 Steinertal Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Intense, creamy aromas set the scene for an impressively rich wine that brings out plenty of stops. While the fruit is fresh, it is also dense, concentrated, a welter of white and yellow fruit flavors over acidity. There is a pure sense of terroir wine, the fruit a real expression of the land.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2007 Rotes Tor Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Rich, full-bodied, packed with pear, apricot and white peach flavors and spiced with cinnamon, this is intense Grüner Veltliner, its concentration coming from ripe fruits. The acidity is all there, but the flavors give it an almost sweet character. It could even be aged for a couple of years. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2008 Aussere Bergen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Unlike some other Wachau producers, Knoll restrains the alcohol even in the ripest wines. That means a wine like this has great freshness to go with the rich fruit. The balance is the thing – fresh citrus, ripe pears and spice and a fine depth of flavor. The acidity comes bursting through the finish.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2007 Ried Kreutles Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Karl Holzapfel is rapidly moving up the ranks of top Wachau producers, as a wine this ripe and creamy retains the freshness of 2007, but gives weight, depth of flavor, layers of pear and spice and a tight, slate structure. A powerful wine, but one that also retains a lively character. Screwcap.
Name: Holzapfel 2007 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Offering a spicy, creamy view of Grüner, this is a well-rounded, rich, white fruit-flavored wine. The acidity is a thought in the background initially, but then gives the wine a final, light lift. Screwcap.
Name: Rainer Wess 2007 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This has all creamy crispness, featherlight, a wine that floats onto the palate. There is some tight acidity, but the fresh white fruits are soft, ripe, open, already ready to drink. This is a great summer apéritif wine. Screwcap.
Name: Nikolaihof 2008 Im Weingebirge Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Light, fresh crisp wine, showing a lively series of green fruits, bright acidity and a texture of tight apple skins. A deliciously light, vivid wine. Screwcap.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2008 Frauenweingarten Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: So crisp, so fresh, the Federspiel style at its best. The wine floats easily over the palate, brushing it with citrus, some light spice, bright white currants and a final burst of acidity.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2008 Ried Kreutles Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Crisp, fresh, but concentrated Grüner. From one of the Wachau's best vineyards, it comes complete with a vivid citrus character, livened by acidity and a fine apple skin structure. Screwcap.
Name: Holzapfel 2007 Achleiten Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A piercingly fresh wine, lifted by delicious green apple and citrus flavors. The wine is lively, light, but given backbone by a crisp, cool minerality, a steely core.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2007 Rotes Tor Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A second bottling of this soft wine, this time with a cork. It has classic pepper and creamy apple flavors and ripeness, the fruit warm, generous, but remaining fresh, just softened with some sweetness to finish.
Name: Felsner 2007 Röhrendorfer Leithen Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A pure, apple- and grapefruit-flavored, concentrated wine, deliciously citric and spiced with pepper. The acidity cuts right through the wine, like a knife, giving it a sparkle and final freshness. Screwcap.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2008 Von den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: This is all about fruit—fresh crisp citrus, lively acidity, just cushioned by a creamy, ripe texture. The flavors are vivid, clean, light and ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Michlits 2008 Biokult Grüner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A very appley wine, both with its fresh green aromas and its soft, crisp and creamy flavor. It is light, as its name suggests, a just spicy texture to add extra character. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2008 Lust & Laune Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)

Description: One of the new generation of regional wines, this Grüner Veltliner exhibits all the open flavors of the variety, with some spice and pepper, pear skin texture and a fresh, flowery acidity. Drink this summer. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2008 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A wonderful, rich wine that brings out apricot and peach flavors, topped with ginger, spice and dense black pepper. The acidity is balanced well with the ripe flavors. It is full, concentrated and worth aging for at least two years. Glass stopper.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2007 Von Stein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Ripe, creamy aromas introduce a deliciously full-bodied Grüner. It has freshness, but also soft apple flavors and a cream character, while its pepper and spice is prominent. The finish is clean, with green plums and apple skin tannins. Screwcap.
Name: Sommer 2007 Leithaberg Weiss Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: A concentrated, rich wine, its pepper and cream flavors coming from a smooth, ripe core of green plum, apricot and dry spice. An impressive, textured, mineral wine that is totally rooted in the stony soil of the vineyard. Glass stopper.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2007 Lindberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A pure line of fresh green fruits goes right through this mineral, bone-dry wine. The texture shows citrus and green apple skins, with a tight freshness that is still young. You can almost taste the stones in the concentrated flavor. Age for at least a year.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2007 Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A wine that brings out the peppery character of Grüner, layering this on top of the ripe pear and green plum fruit flavors. The acidity gives a lift to the whole texture, its freshness finishing the wine vividly. Glass stopper.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2007 Wieden Tradition Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A soft, gentle, open wine that just lights on the palate. The texture is full, with acidity combining easily with pepper and green apple flavors. Screwcap.
Name: Sommer 2007 Bergweingarten Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Crisp, fresh wine, with a creamy texture, full of green apples with a pear pepperiness. The wine is light, very drinkable, a great aperitif style. Screwcap.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2007 Hochterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: For an ice wine, this is relatively rich. But it certainly doesn't take away from the pure acidity that lifts the sweet fruit, giving the ripe peach and dried apricot flavors a great frame. It is ready to drink now, but another year and it will be even better focused.
Name: Höpler 2004 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: This rich but dry wine brings out Grüner Veltliner's peppery character, which shows on top of the pear and quince flavors. The acidity offers a lift to this intense, concentrated wine.
Name: Machherndl 2007 Kollmitz Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Taking its cue from the cool 2007 vintage, this Smaragd is very pure in its fine white fruit flavors, bone-dry with a definite fruit skin texture. It is crisp as much as rich, leaving fresh acidity to finish. Screwcap.
Name: Machherndl 2007 Steinwand Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This lightly sweet wine offers apples and cream and ripe apricot flavors. It is rich, but not obvious, the acidity and freshness just as important as the sweet fruit. It is clean, with a soft, ripe aftertaste.
Name: Höpler 2006 Guttenberg Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Höpler's entry-level Grüner is fresh, green, structured with crisp apple skins—a delicious, apéritif-style wine. It offers all the fruitiness of the grape, a lively acidity adding to the pleasure. Screwcap.
Name: Höpler 2007 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: A vibrantly fresh wine, its green fruit flavors positively glowing with acidity and lemon and tangerine flavors. There is some depth beneath all this fruitiness, giving structure. But, in the end, this is a lively, crisp wine. Screwcap.
Name: Machherndl 2007 Kollmutz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: For an icewine, this is ultra-sweet. 2003 was a tough year for icewine, because there was not enough autumn mist, but the fruit was very ripe. This shows in the intense honey and burnt toffee flavors here, the acidity a mere hint.
Name: Hafner 2003 Essencia Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: As with the winery's first release of this wine, it's a fragrant effort that brings in clearly identifiable varietal attributes. It opens with mixed scents of lemon wax, acacia flowers and green apples, then fills in the palate with tart apple flavors tinged with peppery herbs. It's 100% Gruner, high acid, and ready for sushi, salmon or steak tartare.
Name: Daedalus Cellars 2007 Elton Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Willamette Valley)

Description: A full-bodied, mouth-filling wine that bursts with melon, peach, peppery pear skin and nutmeg flavors. It is ripe, rich, a fruit salad whose final freshness and acidity suggest aging for 3–5 years.
Name: Högl 2007 Ried Schön Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: An impressive, powerful pepper- and yellow fruit-flavored wine, which has been given a considerable depth of flavor by the wood fermentation and lees aging. The balance is great. It is a wine that shows class and aging potential.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2006 Vom Schloss Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The Hundsleiten vineyard is on the last slopes of the Weinviertel looking across the Danube Valley. With its great exposure, it produces a rich style of Grüner, with added structure and minerality. In 2007, the vintage exposed the terroir, giving a flinty edge to the still-rich character.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2007 Hundsleiten Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Weinrieder's Alte Reben (old vines) needs at least a couple of years to really show at its best. This is now a complete wine, the obvious richness subsumed into the beautiful pineapple and pear skin flavors, with a rounding of vanilla. It is certainly drinkable now, but should age well over 3–4 years.
Name: Weinrieder 2006 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: With the extra crispness of the 2007 vintage, this wine has lost its usual opulent character, but it has gained a great definition of structured fruit and flavors of cream, caramel, spice and pear. A benchmark Grüner from its home territory.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2007 Goldjoch Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a gorgeously rich wine, smooth and concentrated. The tropical fruits, added to apricots and green plums, and the spicy edge, fill the mouth with a creamy texture. There is light acidity, just enough to give a final shape to the wine. Screwcap.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2007 Spitzer Point Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: An impressively rich wine with slight sweetness that brings out an initial chalky character, followed swiftly by flavors of almonds and nutmeg on pears. The final softness is deceptive—this is a concentrated wine that needs to age.
Name: Högl 2007 Ried Schön Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The richest of the Grüner Veltliners from the Krems cooperative, this has power as well as the ripest fruit. The flavors are of pear, melon and freshly ground spice, edged with a green apple skin texture. There is depth of flavor, the fruits going right into the core of the wine.
Name: Winzer Krems 2007 Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The wine's name refers to the high density—8,000 plants per hectare (3,200 per acre). Hans Setzer follows the current wisdom that high density planting produces greater concentration. And this is definitely a powerful expression of ripe fruit, herbs, spice, ripe red apples and some wood. Big and rich, it finishes with a burst of pepper.
Name: Setzer 2007 Cuvée 8000 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A gorgeous wine, its richness fuelled by the concentration that comes from old vines. The wine rolls opulently around the mouth, showing apricot flavors over almonds and spice. A final burst of freshness gives it a delicious lift.
Name: Weinrieder 2007 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: It says something for the ripeness of the grapes that at 14.5% the wine still has some residual sugar to give roundness and sweetness. Despite its rich character, defined by cantaloupe melon and apricots, it still has enjoyable freshness. A wine to savor and sip.
Name: Weinrieder 2007 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is purest Grüner Veltliner from one of the best vineyards in the northern Weinviertel. It is ripe, concentrated, an explosion of spice, pepper and fresh pears to go with the lively acidity of crisp apples.
Name: Weinrieder 2007 Schneiderberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A ripe, highly perfumed wine, full of pear and apricot and pepper flavors, layered with refreshing acidity. It is certainly rich in style, but there is also a lightness that gives it a finishing lift. Screwcap.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2007 Berglage Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: An impressive blend of two vineyards, offering ripe melon and pear flavors, luscious and rich. It is rounded, but there is also a core of structure from pear skins and citrus, just hinting at nutmeg. It is worth aging this wine for 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Schwarzböck 2007 Sätzen-Fürstenberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A wine launched to celebrate the foundation of Krems (Chremisa) in 995, this full-bodied, rich wine is packed with tropical fruits, just a touch of spice and a rounded texture. Flavors are of pineapple, mango, apricots and melon. The ripe acidity gives a great finishing lift.
Name: Winzer Krems 2007 Sandgrube 13 Edition Chremisa Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Flavors of melon, apricot and spice are the hallmarks of this single-vineyard wine. It has rounded, ripe fruit, given freshness by a pink grapefruit piquancy, and finishes with classic Grüner Veltliner pepper.
Name: Setzer 2007 Die Lage Eichholz Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A blend from three of Josef Högl's vineyards, this brings together fruit from the cool west, the center and the warm east of the Wachau. Less focused than other Högl Grüners, it gains from a warmth and roundness, emphasizing sweet melon and pineapple flavors, and a soft finishing acidity and spice.
Name: Högl 2007 Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: There is a definite smoothness and richness to this Grüner, which comes from aging a proportion in wood, a definite step up in quality from past vintages. It doesn't detract from the citrus acidity, but does add an element of pear and peach, and a round, soft aftertaste.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2007 Vom Schloss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A vibrant, crisp wine that shows some depth of pepper and spice as well as very fresh, green acidity. The grapefruit and citrus fruit flavors dominate, while the texture remains tight, promising aging for 2–3 years.
Name: Winzer Krems 2007 Kellermeister Privat Kremser Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The Kirchberg vineyard just to the west of Vienna produces distinctly smoky, mineral wines that give a tight, coiled, peppery style of Grüner Veltliner. This is a powerful wine that shows considerable ripeness, finishing with vanilla and spice. Screwcap.
Name: Schwarzböck 2007 Kirchberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: There is a fine combination of lightness and richness in this wine. The lightness comes from its fresh, crisp green flavors. The richness comes from the concentration, the flavor going deep down into the taut palate, acidity, mouth-filling green plums and spice. Screwcap.
Name: Högl 2007 Ried Schön Viessling Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: In the hands of the Pfaffl family, this simple Grüner Veltliner has taken on a rich, almost sumptuous character that gives a depth of flavor to the acidity and crisp green apple flavors. The fruit is open, generous and ripe.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2007 Haidviertel Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A soft, rounded wine with lifted fresh, creamy apple and pear flavors, over an intense layer of citrus. The ripeness of the fruit comes through the crispness to give a finely textured aftertaste.
Name: Weinrieder 2007 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The simplest wine in the Donabaum portfolio, a lively, fresh apples and cream flavored wine that makes a great apéritif style. There's just the right edge of crispness to add to the pleasure. Screwcap.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2007 Johann Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The lightest in a range of Grüner Veltliner from Hans Setzer. This is a green apple and grapefruit flavored wine, all lightness, freshness and crispness. There is a green plum skin tang to it, added to citrus.
Name: Setzer 2007 Vesper Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: One of the original in the new generation of light, fresh Grüner Veltliner, Veltlinsky is a good example. With its green apple directness and smooth structure, it is a wine for the year, a fine apéritif or seafood partner. Screwcap.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2007 Veltlinsky Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The name refers to the address of Winzer Krems, a winery that is among the best cooperatives in Austria. This bright, freshly green Grüner Veltliner is sprightly, with a slight spritz and fresh citrus and pear flavors. The aftertaste is crisp.
Name: Winzer Krems 2007 Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Crisp in style, hinting at minerality, with great green fruit flavors and intense acidity. There is freshness, as well as rich spice and pepper. The wine shows delicious fish-friendly acidity and tautness.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2006 Kammerner Renner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A big-hearted wine, packed with intense fruits and sweet green plum flavors. There is acidity, but the wine shows a sunny character, with richness and some spice. The wine comes from the deep loess soil of the Grub vineyard, just north of the wine capital Langenlois.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2006 Kammerner Grub Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: An oak-aged Grüner, which seems to turn the grape, chameleon-like, into a peppery Chardonnay. That gives it a power and richness, with tropical fruits offset by nutmeg and coconut milk. It is big and intense, shot through with spice.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2006 Kammerner Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The tough rocks of the Achleiten vineyard come through in this intense wine. It has grapefruit, citrus and vivid acidity, while the Grüner's pepper character just shows through as a touch on the tongue. Fine wine, very structured.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2007 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Bright and fresh wine, but with delicious depth of apricot and green plum flavors. It's full with outstanding richness, while the fruit flavors have a great lift. Part of Schloss Gobelsburg's Tradition series, in which wines are aged longer before release.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2005 Tradition Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: From the Kellerberg vineyard, this is a powerfully rich wine, with its cream and nutmeg flavors complemented by creamed baked apples. There is strong pepper and spice character here.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2007 Kellerberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Though Grüner doesn't have a reputation in Austria for ice wine as do other varieties, based on the strength of this wine, maybe it should. It has a great balance between toffee sweetness and high acidity, the intensity softened and broadened by spice and toffee.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2006 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Here's a wine that just fills the mouth with good things. This wine revels in its richness, which is balanced by fresh acidity, keeping the wine crisp.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2007 Terrassen Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: There is good depth of flavor in this delicious wine. The creamy apple flavors are crisp alongside pear skin tannins, while the touch of pepper gives some intrigue to the aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2007 Aussere Bergen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is the first Grüner fruit from Underwood Mountain, and it promises good—maybe great—things to come. Sleek and stony, the wine epitomizes the racy, slightly grassy, slightly peppery quality of classic Austrian Grüner, with a Pacific Northwest twist—a certain brilliant intensity to the fruit that reflects this northern latitude. Clearly the best Grüner from Oregon or Washington to date.
Name: Viento 2007 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: In a lighter style than other Grüners in the single-vineyard range, this comes from a gravel and loess vineyard close to the Schloss. The wine is fresh, erring on crisp, emphasizing the green and spice Grüner flavors. The aftertaste brings out the acidity.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2006 Gobelsburger Steinsetz Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The Singerriedl is the most renowned vineyard in Spitz, and this ripe but cool example shows its great minerality and taut apple skin tannin structure. Rounding the wine out is an attractive, creamy finish.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2007 Singerriedl Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Very Grüner, with its spice, pear skin and pepper and rounded, creamy character. A delicious wine, quite light, with flavors of crushed grapefruit coming through in the form of fresh acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2007 Terrassen Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This is one of the everyday drinking range from Schloss Gobelsburg. It has freshness, light green and white fruits and an exuberant burst of acidity. It is cool, green and a great apéritif style. Screwcap.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2007 Domäne Gobelsburg Grüner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Bright, fresh, green fruits and creamy acidity set this wine happily on its course as a delicious apéritif drink. The crisp fruit is great, while the finish is certainly green. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2007 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Named after a traditional costume of the Wachau, the Kalmuck range of wines offers bright, crisp fruit and green berry flavors. There is an attractive touch of pepper, but this is more about primary, refreshing fruit flavors.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2007 Kalmuck Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A fresh, green apple-and-cream style of wine, made to be drunk young. It's crisp, lively and light with a touch of pepper and spice. Screwcap.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2007 Wachau Collection Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The sweetness is initially overwhelming, like drinking syrup. But this is still a balanced wine, its acidity, spice and apricots and honey flavors all contributing to considerable complexity. The finish is still sweet, but the spice gives a parting lift.
Name: Bründlmayer 2004 Ried Loiser Berg Trockenbeerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The Heiligenstein vineyard is better known for its Rieslings, but it obviously is capable of producing impressive Grüner Veltliners. The pure, mineral character is very obvious and delicious, and cuts through the more delicate green fruits, intensely fresh acidity and green citrus kick. Ageworthy. Screwcap.
Name: Hirsch 2007 Kammerner Heiligenstein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A superlative Grüner, showing off its exotic spices as well as its green, crisp freshness. The whole is in balance, with some richness but more elegance. It is delicious but also intense, a synergy between green fruits and tropical apricots.
Name: Bründlmayer 2007 Ried Loiser Berg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A superbly ripe wine, with its acidity given a rich boost by yellow fruits, the spice a layer of fruit cake richness. It has power, some minerality and a great waft of orange to finish. Should age well over 4–5 years. Screwcap.
Name: Hirsch 2006 Kammerner Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: You can feel the unctuous, oily richness as soon as this wine reaches the tongue. It is dense and concentrated, with sweet green plums and a creamy texture. The old-vine fruit, enveloping the mouth, just leaves a hint of spice.
Name: Bründlmayer 2007 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Smooth, creamy aromas are followed by a rich, concentrated mouthful, with spice showing through the green berry fruits, apples and cream flavors. This tastes warm, inviting, with yellow fruits adding an exotic element in the aftertaste.
Name: Bründlmayer 2007 Langenloiser Berg-Vogelsang Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This huge, rich wine is great Grüner Veltliner. Despite the alcohol, Rupert Summerer has managed to keep the intense freshness, the lifted, crisp pear flavors and the exuberant pepper in control. Impressive.
Name: Summerer 2006 Käferberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Terrassen are the equivalent of hillside vineyards, producing the best fruit in the Kamptal. This delicious Grüner is balanced, heading toward rich but steering clear of too much. The white fruit flavors are spiced up with pepper, while the acidity keeps the whole thing crisp and fresh.
Name: Loimer 2006 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A big, super-rich wine that concentrates on its vanilla and spice aspects, the fruit coming through as ripe quince and apricots flavored with pepper. The acidity is muted, appearing only at the end, to give a vibrant lift to this impressive wine. Glass stopper.
Name: Steininger 2007 Grand Grü Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A big power-driven wine, all concentrated spice and sweet fruit. Lovers of Alsace wines will appreciate the richness of this wine, with its flavors of white fruits touched with pepper and its rounded, opulent texture.
Name: Summerer 2006 Schenkenbichl Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A ripe, fragrant wine that also manages to retain fine crispness. There is some Grüner pepper and spice, but the freshness of the wine allows it to show grapefruit and other citrus characters as well as tense acidity.
Name: Steininger 2006 Brut Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fresh but rich, this young wine has structured edges, great purity of green currant fruits as well as fine concentration. The roundness of the palate is matched by its delicious acidity. Glass stopper.
Name: Summerer 2007 Steinhaus Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This single-vineyard Grüner is powerful, with concentrated white fruit flavors, floral aromas and great, crisp, fresh acidity. The fruit is ripe, hinting at creamy, with a soft green aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2006 Aussere Bergen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is the lightest of the Bründlmayer Grüners and refreshing and crisp it is, too. It has green herb freshness and a tense, citrus aftertaste. Pure green fruits dominate. Screwcap.
Name: Bründlmayer 2007 Kamptaler Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A rich style of Grüner, showing tropical fruits, pears and classic pepper. It is rounded out with lively acidity and some green skin structure, but still leaves ripeness in the aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Felsner 2006 Kremser Gebling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Although there is some sweetness here, this wine is more about power and richness. The spices and the exotic lychee flavor dominate a super-ripe wine, dense and concentrated. Drink as a first-course wine, maybe with a pâté.
Name: Zimmermann 2006 Auslese Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Fresh, cut grass aromas precede green plum flavors under a layer of creaminess. This is verging on rich, a satisfying mouthful of green fruits and smooth acidity.
Name: Zimmermann 2007 Kremser Gelbling Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Karl Steininger's winery forms part of the new Loisium complex of wine exhibition and hotel in Langenlois, designed by New York architect Steven Holl (commemorated on the label). This wine comes from the adjacent vineyard. It's a full, rich style, rounded, with creamy apple flavors, touched by white currant acidity. Glass stopper.
Name: Steininger 2007 Loisiumweingarten Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: One of a series of single vineyard wines from Alois Zimmermann, this dense Grüner Veltliner is packed with ripe green plums, minerality and a rich structure. It has great freshness, but at the same time good concentration. Screwcap.
Name: Zimmermann 2007 Gernlüsen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The rich soils of the slopes of the Wagram give full-bodied wines. This Grüner Veltliner mixes white pears and peaches with spice, green herbs and red apple skins. It's fruity in the extreme, keeping its elegance and freshness in a cut grass aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2007 Von den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Intensely spicy wine, all pepper and almonds, with tropical fruits and a mineral-like concentration of apple skins, taut but also creamily rich. Screwcap.
Name: Felsner 2007 Gedersdorfer Vordernberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Loimer's classic Grüner is delightfully cool, a green apple- and pear-flavored wine, very pure, crisp and layered with intense acidity. The edge is decidedly green, but there is plenty of creamy texture along the way. Screwcap.
Name: Loimer 2007 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: One of the new generation of Grüners, reflecting the terroir of the Weinviertel of Lower Austria. It is fresh, crisp, clean—maybe a little too clean—but certainly showing green apple and pepper flavors touched with white fruits. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2006 Weinviertel DAC Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: One of the light, fresh and fun Grüners being made by many producers in the Kamptal. This is crisp, with a slight spritz, Austria's answer to dry Vinho Verde, all green apples and fresh citrus.
Name: Hirsch 2007 Trinkvergnügen No 6 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Manfred Felsner obviously enjoys the spicy character of Grüner Veltliner, because, like all his wines from this varietal, this has spice in spades. But it also has good fresh acidity, which emphasizes the green fruit character of the wine, bringing out the crispness of the year. Screwcap.
Name: Felsner 2007 Rohrendorfer Leithen Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Fresh, crisp, citrus and floral flavors make a light, easy Grüner Veltliner, a great summer drink of light white fruits and green berries. Screwcap.
Name: Schloss Halbturn 2006 Koenigsegg Velt. 1 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Tight, light and crisp, this is a great aperitif wine, all white fruits, citrus and layers of minerality. The aftertaste is vibrant with the acidity. Glass stopper.
Name: Summerer 2007 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Crisp, light, green wine. with flavors of green plums, grapefruit acidity and a pronounced layer of classic Grüner pepper. Screwcap.
Name: Felsner 2007 Lössterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Fresh, light, and deliciously refreshing, this summertime Grüner Veltliner is full of light, playful acidity and green currant fruits. It's crisp, easy to drink. Glass stopper.
Name: Summerer 2007 Grüne Lady Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This lightweight wine is fresh and flavored with limes, pears and a hint of spice. It's edgy but also rounded, with mouthfilling fruit flavors and acidity playing an important supporting role.
Name: Zimmermann 2007 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: In the new wave of light, fresh Grüner Veltliner, this charming, friendly wine is all lifted green fruits, crisply fresh, just touched by a structure of fresh apple skins. Screwcap.
Name: Loimer 2007 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A floral, aromatic wine, with flavors of crisp lemon and orange peel, green apple skins and grapefruit. There is just a hint of pepper in the aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Zimmermann 2007 Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Despite its label description of “dry,” this is off-dry, soft, very floral, light. There are pear and white currant fruits, with some yellow fruits adding to the pleasure.
Name: Bauer 2006 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Very forward fruity flavors of apricots and mandarins and soft, fresh acidity lead to a finish that is more toward grapefruit. But this is essentially a soft, aperitif Grüner.
Name: Bauer 2007 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This light, very fresh wine shows crispness, citrus and grapefruit flavors and lively acidity. An easy to drink, low in alcohol, summer afternoon wine. Screwcap.
Name: Zull 2007 Lust und Laune Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: From a flat vineyard with rich soil, this is a relatively sweet and rich wine, although the acidity gives a lift of freshness. Apricot, white fruits and concentration mark the finish.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2006 Axpoint Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Pepper and power mark this impressively rich wine. Tropical fruits, mangos and lychees are layered with minerality and acidity. A wine that needs some aging in order to release the full potential of its structure and fruit weight.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2006 Ried Schütt Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This is a great wine, proof that Grüner Veltliner can age magnificently. It was kept in large wood casks for 15 years before bottling, resulting in mature aromas with white flower perfumes. On the palate, the fresh currant flavors are dominant. The flavors come together to form a ripe, complex wine.
Name: Nikolaihof 1991 Vinothek Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: With its concentration and high alcohol, this wine almost overpowers in its richness. Lychees are the dominant fruit flavor, along with layers of sweetness and softness. At present, it still has to come together completely; drink 2013.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2006 Honivogl Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A wonderful, fresh wine, packed with ripe green fruits and pepper. The mineral character is very evident, a product of the gneiss soil of the Achleiten vineyard. On the finish there is a great, balanced fusion of fruit and structure.
Name: Prager 2006 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Rich, with superbly ripe, intense and concentrated fruit. This is still very young, the fresh fruit hinting at raw power. Keep until 2011, or decant before drinking.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2006 Rotestor Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Big, opulent and round, this is a superrich wine that manages to keep its sense of proportion through a rocky, stony interior structure. The tropical fruits, yellow peaches and apricots go with a powerful dose of pepper, leaving richness to finish.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2006 Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Closed, mineral and salty, this is potentially a rich and powerful wine, full-bodied but still retaining great varietal character. The aftertaste has great acidity, which cuts through the wine, leaving considerable aging ability.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2006 Höhereck Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A first from Pichler, this is a wine that stopped fermenting while still sweet and offers rich layers of honey, lychees and pepper are all here, as well yellow peaches and honeydew.
Name: F X Pichler 2006 Dürnsteiner Kellerberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Packed with superripe tropical fruits, this is a concentrated, powerful wine, with lychee and smoke flavors. There is intense acidity to counteract all the richness. Finishes sweet and ripe.
Name: F X Pichler 2006 Dürnsteiner Kellerberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Poised and elegant, this has deliciously restrained fruit that shows green plum flavors and a layer of pepper. To finish this finely balanced wine, there is a layer of fresh acidity. Needs another 3–4 years to develop and round out.
Name: Josef Jamek 2006 Ried Liebenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Smooth, rich and dense with a touch of sweetness, packed with intense flavors of sweet potatoes, pepper and honey. The texture is thick, creamy, weighty and concentrated. One of the library releases of selected wines, produced by Knoll in the best years.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2006 Vinotekfüllung Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: On the forefront are weight, superripe white fruits, intense pepper and considerable richness. It's rococo in its ornamentation and its exuberance.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2006 Wösendorfer Hochrain Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: With lively spice flavors and delicious red apple and white currant flavors, this is a spicy wine that just keeps cool and lively. There is some pepper and tropical fruit, but this is more about great, fresh, green fruits.
Name: Nikolaihof 2006 Weingebirge Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A wine that goes way over the top in its richness, power and concentration, and yet somehow keeps its balance and freshness. At the end, the pepper and fruit rather than the alcohol are dominant.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2006 Wösendorfer Kollmütz Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Produced from old vines, this is particularly concentrated, showing considerable varietal spice, along with the soft, ripe lychee flavors. With its intensity, the wine is powerful, the acidity less obvious than the structure and fruit.
Name: F X Pichler 2006 Loibner Berg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A powerful, rich and complex wine, with intense pear flavors and an impressively firm structure. There is spice as well, with a mineral character underneath the richness.
Name: Machherndl 2006 Steinwand Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fresh, green fruit is topped by a creamy texture. It is apples and cream, with a touch of cinnamon—just like mom used to bake. And at the same time, there is minerality and lively acidity.
Name: Josef Jamek 2006 Ried Achleiten Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: “M” stands for Monumental, and at 15% this is definitely a powered wine. The Pichlers wait to get the ripest healthy grapes, and the result is a big, opulent wine, with pineapple and mango flavors. Some acidity remains in all this rococo extravaganza.
Name: F X Pichler 2006 M Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The first vintage at Nikolaihof from this vineyard, the wine is off dry. There is a lively fruit character and green apple skins, along with a creamy, fresh aftertaste.
Name: Nikolaihof 2004 Schlossberg Jungfernlese Halbtrocken Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A blend of grapes from Tegenseerhof's top vineyards, this is a tropical fruit-flavored wine, with yellow fruits, and watermelon touched with pepper and spice.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2006 Bergdistel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Honied aromas, with apple, cream and pepper flavors. Crisp but warm with richness, great acidity, this is a finely balanced wine, very pure.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2006 Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A rich wine, touched by tropical fruit, pepper and light acidity. Although there is crispness, this wine is more about roundness, allied with weight, but finishing with fresh spiced pear flavors.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2006 Ried Kreutles Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A soft wine, with fresh fruit and floating, light acidity. There is a poised, balanced structure of green apple skins, and just a touch of pepper.
Name: Nikolaihof 2006 Weingebirge Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Very pure, creamy fruit with acidity and green plum flavors. There is a fine, underlying tension that translates into a tight acidity and spice to finish.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2006 Terrassen Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fresh, crisp currant and melon flavors, with lively acidity and intense, fresh fruit. This is a delicious fruit salad of tastes, light and vibrant.
Name: Nikolaihof 2006 Hefeabzug Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The glass gives off a great waft of delicate citrus and pear-flavored fruits, lightly perfumed and with a layer of minerality that sits easily underneath the freshness.
Name: F X Pichler 2006 Loibner Klostersatz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine manages to balance freshness with rich, concentrated fruit. It is certainly full-bodied, reveling in its ripe kiwi and pear flavors. But it also shows crispness, light acidity and a lively aftertaste.
Name: Josef Jamek 2006 Stein am Rain Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The tight, firm fruit is closed now, but there is a full structure that leaves the taste of fresh, clean kiwi fruit, citrus and pepper. This should develop well over the next 3–4 years.
Name: Machherndl 2005 Kollmitz Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Minimalist wine from the modern Pichler winery, this has freshness and crispness, providing structure over lithe green fruit flavors. The finish is lively and vibrant.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2006 Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The name means Tank 26. This is a wine offering fresh fruit, a creamy undertow and crispness. The acidity is prominent, with excellent fresh pepper and lime crispness.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2006 T26 Frauen Weingarten Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Offers a touch of citrus and yellow fruits. Although there is crispness, the main effect is of a full, generous wine, but one that is not weighted down.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2006 Ried Kreutles Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Soft, very fresh fruit, with a taste of white peaches. This is a deliciously fragrant wine, just touched by pepper.
Name: F X Pichler 2006 Loibner Frauenweingarten Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a solid effort, with good varietal character and definition. Half was fermented in stainless, half in neutral barrel, and the wine was given extended (130 days) lees contact. The herbal, peppery tang of the grape is clearly there, with intriguing hints of slate laced through the finish. This would be dynamite with sushi.
Name: Daedalus 2006 Elton Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Willamette Valley)

Description: Despite its high alcohol, this wine manages to preserve its balance. That's because the Grüner acidity creeps through the weight. With his top wine, Ehmoser goes for a tropical fruit profile here, with mangos on top of vanilla and spice. There's structure too, which suggests this powerful wine could age for 2–3 years.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2006 Aurum Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: A wonderfully pure, fresh and natural wine, limpid with minerality, green fruits, concentrated pepper and spice. This is a powerful expression of Grüner Veltliner, a rich, but freshly green wine. Glass stopper.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2006 Lindberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A creamy, smooth wine, flavored with pears, even lychees and full, ripe Grüner Veltliner. This shows the rich side of the grape, while still keeping its essential freshness. Typical pepper flavors come to finish. Glass stopper.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2006 Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Power and rich, spicy creaminess are the hallmarks of this full-bodied wine. Tropical fruit flavors of mango and lychee are spiced up with nutmeg. There is a fresh tingle on the palate, intriguing and leaving a positive question over its ageworthiness— 2–4 years.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2006 Dechant Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Pears and honey go together in this rich wine. Perhaps the power is too much, but it certainly impresses with its mineral structure, green spices and complex mix of exotic fruits and reined-in intensity. Screwcap.
Name: Leth 2006 Scheiben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: The loess slopes of the Wagram give typically full-bodied Grüner Veltliner. This rich wine, from the Hohenberg vineyard, is ripe, certainly full, with a classic edge of pepper and coriander. But the apple fruit freshness is also there. Screwcap.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2006 Hohenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: A ripe, creamy wine, full and with a pepper edge. The wine has structure, richness and flavors of quince, green plum and green beans and a likely ability to age. Glass stopper.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2006 Von Stein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Big spice is proper for a Grüner Veltliner Smaragd wine, the richest category in the Wachau. But Machherndl also manages not to forget white fruits, a layer of acidity, and a full, but crisp varietal character.
Name: Machherndl 2006 Smaragd Kollmitz Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The rock soils of the Kollmütz vineyard give a very lean, mineral, almost austere character to this wine, in its early development. This is going to broaden out—there are already the green plum, intense flavors and a bright, crisp acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Machherndl 2006 Kollmütz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: From a vineyard right in the city of Krems, this Grüner is all spice and mineral; very fresh, elegant, green and crisp. It's probably an early drinking wine, delicious now and for the next 3–4 years. Glass stopper.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2006 Wieden Tradition Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A smooth, creamy single-vineyard wine, with white fruits and delicious balancing acidity. There is some crispness as well as richness, and an edge of spice. Acidity dominates on the finish. Screwcap.
Name: Leth 2006 Steinagrund Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

Description: Ripe, creamy style of Grüner Veltliner, with green plums, fresh acidity and just a touch of textured spice. This is a delicious wine, lively but rich, finishing with a great, vibrant aftertaste.
Name: Felsner 2006 Gedersdorf Moosburgerin Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A lively, fresh wine that only just borders on sweetness, reserving some the botrytised fruit for richness instead. There are fine flavors of lychees, crispened up with white currants, while spice comes through but well in balance.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2006 Schenkenbichl Auslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Very pure, crisp fruit, flavored with green plums, fresh acidity and intense minerality. Delicious, if just on the wrong side of plump.
Name: Machherndl 2006 Smaragd Steinwand Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A simple but delicious Grüner Veltliner from terraced vineyards above the city of Stein. It's very fresh, but has a full-textured character, with kiwis and some spice. The finish is delicious clear and green. Glass stopper.
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2006 Hochterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A bone-dry, crisp wine, with green pears and only a hint of Grüner's pepper character. Attractive, creamy and fresh.
Name: Winzer Krems 2006 Kremser Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Big, bold and soft, this is way too heavy. Sure, the Grüner spice is all there, but it is at the expense of a fresh, racy character. The toast character doesn't quite work either.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2006 Schenkenbichl Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This powerful, intense, wood-aged Grüner Veltliner is Pfaffl's finest expression of the grape. It is opulent, rich, powerful, but intensely structured, the wood lending a counterpoint to the fresh acidity and pepper characters of the grape.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2005 Goldjoch Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The 8000 in the wine's name refers to the number of vines per hectare (the acre equivalent would be around 3,200); the very dense planting is to stress the vines and cut yields from individual plants. The result is a wine that is richly concentrated, smooth and dense, with the classic Grüner pepper, but powerful and creamy.
Name: Setzer 2004 Grüner Veltliner 8000 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A rich wine, with some wood flavors, and intense ripe, creamy fruit. Flavors of baked apples, of pears and ripe acidity give this wine both structure and density.
