Name: Graf Hardegg 2004 Reserve Vom Schloss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The Kollmitz's Joching vineyard is at the heart of Erich Machherndl's wines, producing both Riesling and Grüner Veltliner. This Grüner is impressively rich in a smooth, creamy style, with fresh green apples and white currant flavors. It should age well, its richness giving it the right structure.
Name: Machherndl 2005 Smaragd Kollmitz Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Organic wine from this family winery in Auersthal. It has deliciously fresh fruit, flavors of white plums and just a touch of grapefruit. Concentrated, with a delicious finish.
Name: H. & M. Hofer 2005 Grüner Veltliner Kirchlissen Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: From densely planted vines, this is a ripe, very fruity wine, with low acidity, emphasizing the cream and pepper character of the grape. It is not the style of Grüner that can be drunk too young—give it another year to be at its optimum.
Name: Setzer 2005 8000 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: The long slope of the Wagram, a relic of the ice age, gives its name to the Terrassen (Terraces) vineyard. This is classic, peppery Grüner, raised to a higher quality by the intensity of the pear flavors and the exotic spicy touch. Screwcap.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2006 Von den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: This is in the middle range from Hans Setzer's impressive collection of Grüner Veltliner. Fresh, but with good weight and intensity. Flavors of dry grapefruit and  citrus fruits, along with some light spice and pepper give a delicious, properly varietal character.
Name: Setzer 2005 1 Lage Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is from the premium range produced by the Winzer Krems cooperative. It is a freshly fruity, bramble-flavored wine, lifted with acidity, light flavors of wood and a good, fresh, juicy, spicy aftertaste.
Name: Winzer Krems 2006 Kellermeister Privat Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A gentle expression of eiswein, with more richness and less acidity than some. There is toffee and orange marmalade, and a soft aftertaste.
Name: Höpler 2004 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

Description: From the first vintage of Grüner Veltliner wines under the Weinviertel DAC, this offering from Hans Setzer is crisp, fresh and light, showing a little softness from age, but still full of vibrant white currants and pepper.
Name: Setzer 2002 Ried Eichholz Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: The Sandgrube vineyard is at the historic heart of the Kremstal appellation. This is soft, but with a mineral edge that gives it cool structure and fresh green pear flavors. There's a nice lightness to the aftertaste.
Name: Winzer Krems 2006 Ried Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A crisp, austere wine; it is a little lean, but does show fine varietal character. Treat this as a good food wine, rather than as an apéritif.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2005 Vom Schloss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Almost like drinking in a heurige, those Austrian taverns where you can sample the new wine, as this is so fresh, crisp and vividly fruity. A perfect summer wine.
Name: Höpler 2006 Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

Description: Very soft, very light, pleasantly acidic and fresh. This wine is designed to show how easy and drinkable Grüner Veltliner is (as if we needed any persuading). It's certainly attractive, but lacks real varietal focus. Screwcap.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2005 Veltlinsky Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: White pepper, bright and zippy tropical fruit flavors and a clean, food-friendly finish make this enjoyable Gruner from Hungary a great new everyday wine. It's affordable too, adding to its appeal. Imported by MHW Ltd.
Name: Craftsman 2006 Grüner Veltliner (Neszmély)

Description: Almost nectar, this wine is supremely rich and concentrated, with toffee and honey flavors combining with apricots, orange peel and refreshing acidity. This is a great example of a TBA because of its richness, silky texture and balance.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2004 Loiserberg Grüner Veltliner Trockenbeerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Ice wines from Grüner Veltliner are not often found in Burgenland, but with the fresh ripeness and poise of this wine, you wonder why. It has a great lift to it from the fresh acidity and the green pear fruit flavors.
Name: Manfred Weiss 2005 Grüner Veltliner Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee)

Description: A very light, fresh, delicate wine, that shows crispness, flavors of sweet apples and just a touch of pepper. Picked on December 13, 2005, at a temperature of 17 degrees, according to Sepp Mantler.
Name: Mantlerhof 2005 Grüner Veltliner Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Sweet quince jelly flavors, along with a touch of toffee, suggest a wine that is sweeter than it is. It finishes rich, but also with a layer of dryness. Seems to lack  acidity.
Name: Steininger 2000 Beerenauslese Grüner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Loiser Berg is a cool vineyard, facing south, to the west of Langenlois. Grüner Veltliner and Riesling grow well. This TBA is now maturing well, as its gold color proves. While the primary fruit flavors have gone, there is still great freshness, with honey and spices the main tastes. Judging by that freshness, it still has many years to go.
Name: Bründlmayer 2000 Ried Loiser Berg Trockenbeerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Grüner Veltliner's pepper is just below the surface of this fresh, but concentrated wine. It has lovely crispness, a burst of pear and orange peel flavors, and almost ethereal lightness. Ried Käferberg is a single vineyard just outside Langenlois.
Name: Bründlmayer 2004 Ried Käferberg Beerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: From botrytized grapes picked at the first frost on November 25, 2005, this is intensely sweet. But--as with all good Eiswein--it is poised on a knife-edge with acidity as intense as the sweetness. This is a fine, elegant wine, which will repay cellaring for at least three years.
Name: Türk 2005 Eiswein Vom Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Bernhard Ott is a Grüner Veltliner specialist, with 90% of his vineyard planted to Austria's national white varietal. This single vineyard wine is a lilting, dancing wine, with delicious green apple flavors layered with spice. Drink now, or age for 2-3 years.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2005 Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: Hugely rich, this powerful wine is very ripe, packed with lychees and spicy fruit flavors. The super-ripe fruit, selectively picked on November 30 in 2005, is dense, concentrated, medium sweet, but pierced through with fine, fresh acidity.
Name: Türk 2005 Frechau Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A single vineyard bottling from master Grüner Veltliner producer, Bernhard Ott. It is fresh, crisp, flowery, light and clean. A great aperitif wine.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2005 Am Berg Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: From the slopes of the Krems vineyards, above the Danube, this lively, fresh spicy Grüner has just the right mineral crispness along with some of the weight that comes from the Kremstal. At two years old, this wine is ready to drink, a great food accompaniment, ripeness balancing the poised acidity.
Name: Türk 2004 Vom Urgestein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: For sheer alcoholic power, there's not much to beat this wine. For the pleasure it gives, well that's harder. This is more about richness, with high levels of pepper, new wood and structure. An acquired taste.
Name: Wimmer-Czerny 2000 Grüner Veltliner Beerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: Big, rich and oily, with intense aromas of smoke and nut oil that build on the palate into flavors of peach kernel, spice and layers of minerality. A long, mouthcoating finish cinches this wine's quality. The only catch is that of 800 cases produced, only 25 are scheduled to be imported to the U.S.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2005 Hohenberg Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: A broad, mouthfilling Grüner Veltliner with distinctive scents of ginger and cinnamon backed by spice-drop flavors. This is satisfyingly warm and spice-driven, with a long, peppery finish.
Name: Felsner 2005 Gedersdorfer Vordernberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Makes an interesting contrast to the spice-driven flavors of Felsner's Vordernberg bottling, by offering honeyed stones and peaches in a medium-bodied format. Finishes with bright notes of citrus zest.
Name: Felsner 2005 Gedersdorfer Moosburgerin Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Although the wine inside might not be the most complex GV you'll ever sample, it's light, clean and fresh, with gingery, spicy nuances to the pear and apple flavors. Probably best as an apéritif, but it has enough intensity to match scallop or shrimp dishes.
Name: Graf Koenigsegg 2005 Velt 1 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Packed with green fruit and citrus flavors, this finely crafted wine, smooth and crisp at the same time, is fruity, spicy and immediately delicious to drink. A blend of grapes from two vineyards on the rolling plateau above the city of Krems, this wine is aged in stainless steel for eight months, and packed with freshness. The Türk family—vineyard owners since the 18th century—have changed their labels with this 2005 vintage, and the sunburst motif looks as elegant as the wine.
Name: Türk 2005 Vom Urgestein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Citric flavors dominate this floral, very focused wine, from the steep Achleiten vineyard. It has some sweetness, or more precisely, richness, but this is only a small part of the vibrant, lively structure of a delicious wine.
Name: Prager 2005 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: From 50-year-old vines, harvested at the end of November, this wine has definite late-harvest richness and intensity of flavor. Fruit tastes are less obvious than the perfumes, the flavors of almonds and complexity, what Friedrich Rieder calls a wine with character.
Name: Weinrieder 2004 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: A full, fat style of wine that packs opulent flavors, ripe fruits and smoky aromas. Lime, honey and minerals balance with the crisp acidity. To finish, the wine is soft and rounded.
Name: Alzinger 2005 Loibenberg Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: There is some wood here, particularly to smell, but it forms a seasoning for the intense concentrated flavors. Mandarin oranges and some smoky minerality are mixed in a creamy, rich blend. An impressive wine.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2005 Hundsleiten Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: Grapes from a small parcel of vineyard on the Nussberg hill go into this 100-case production wine. It has some wood aging, but the main element is the rich and concentrated fruit. This will certainly repay some bottle age. 100 cases produced.
Name: Wieninger 2005 Preussen Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: A vineyard high on the Nussberg hill gives this hugely concentrated wine perfumed flavors of ripe plums to go with its touch of pink grapefruit. Well structured and  outstanding.
Name: Wieninger 2005 Kaasgraben Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Smoky, peppery flavors, minerality and a firm structure all show the poor slate soil of the Achleiten vineyard. Yes, quince and grapefruit flavors are there, but they come through only slightly on this still-young wine.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2005 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This is a style of wine that gives the lie to the belief that Grüner Veltliner does not age. With its pure, ripe fruit, its complex flavors of spice, red apples, backed by a firm structure, this will certainly improve over the next two to three years. Not imported.
Name: Franz Leth 2005 Scheiben Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: Working mainly with purchased fruit, Rainer Wess has developed an enviable talent for wines from the Loibenberg vineyard. This is pure Grüner— with spicy, peppery, very pure fruit flavors—leaving understated elegance.
Name: Rainer Wess 2005 Loibenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: From 30-year-old vines, this steely style of Grüner comes from the Nussberg vineyard in western Vienna, near the Vienna woods. It is fresh and concentrated, with flavors of quince and a backbone of mineral and pepper flavors.
Name: Wieninger 2005 Nussberg Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: The vines for this wine have an average age of 40–50 years, giving a great concentration of flavors from low-yielding plants. For a Grüner it is monumental in character, packed with flavors of lychees, sage and pepper. With this intensity of flavor, this should be a wine for aging.
Name: Markowitsch 2005 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Weinrieder's hallmark purity of fruit is very evident with this wine's freshness and flavors of pears and green plums. It has good weight, great poise and a deliciously light aftertaste.
Name: Weinrieder 2005 Schneiderberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: In keeping with a cool year, this '04 has layered acidity, pepper and an intense lemon zest and light, poised flavors. It's vivid, fresh and ready to drink.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2004 Hundsleiten Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

Description: This big, opulent and generous wine is one of the few Heiligenstein wines made of Grüner Veltliner. Its peppery character is tempered with fresh acidity and mineral flavors.
Name: Hirsch 2005 Zöbinger Heiligenstein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Fresh and light, this wine reflects the relatively cool conditions of 2004. However, it still preserves much of the richness of the hot Loibenberg vineyard, with spice and green fruits pushing through bright acidity.
Name: Rainer Wess 2004 Loibenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A perfumed, pure, light-bodied wine that has touches of fine acidity and crisp fruits. To finish, there are flavors of pepper, limes and orange peel. This is a delicious, approachable wine that will age.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2005 Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: From the sandy Herrenholz vineyard north of Vienna, this is a full, open, fruity style of Grüner, from 35-year-old vines. It is ripe, generous and packed with fresh acidity.
Name: Wieninger 2005 Herrenholz Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Dry, crisp and very fresh, this wine is a lighter style of Grüner, but delicious. The grapefruit flavors are clean, poised and lightly elegant. Not imported
Name: Domäne Wachau 2005 Loibenberg Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: An attractively spicy wine, with clean lemon and bitter orange flavors, fresh acidity and a peppery aftertaste.
Name: Dinstlgut Loiben 2005 Loibenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fresh, creamy aromas, crisp fruit and layers of acidity and pepper create a very good wine. A great expression of Grüner in an area better known for red wines.
Name: Markowitsch 2005 Schanzäcker Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Roman Pfaffl is the leader in the new Weinviertel DAC appellation, based around Grüner Veltliner. This wine is medium-bodied, but has typical spice, pepper, apple and pear flavors. Demands instant pleasurable drinking.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2005 Zeisneck Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Spice, tobacco and pepper characterize this wine, with its floral aromas, full fruit and just a touch of acidity. Not a wine for aging, but one to drink today.
Name: Winzer Krems 2005 Kremser Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Hugely ripe, this is a powerhouse of a wine, giving minerality as well as intense yellow fruit flavors. The pepper of the Grüner is discreet, leaving a soft, juicy, fruity aftertaste.
Name: Rainer Wess 2005 Pfaffenberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A big, full-bodied wine, packed with spice, red currants and very ripe fruits. It's open, generous, soft and very pleasurable.
Name: Winzer Krems 2005 Kremser Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Intensely perfumed wine with concentrated, ripe flavors of bitter oranges and pepper. At the end, though, the primary taste is of freshness, with a lift of acidity.
Name: Weinrieder 2005 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Lush and ripe, but it still retains that signature white pepper-celery leaf note that's a sure sign of the variety. Tastes like peaches and melons rolled in crushed stones, with a long, warm finish that retains a sense of minerality.
Name: Prager 2004 Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Shows the ripeness of the vintage and its late-harvested style in its full weight and round, mouthfilling texture, but retains its essential Grüner-ness, combining spicy white pepper and celery leaf notes with just enough stone fruit. Long on the finish, where it adds a dose of minerality.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2003 Loibner Garten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Rather full and round, this is a plump wine that offers white pepper notes amply buttressed by ripe peach and melon fruit. Firms and shows more pepper on the finish, suggesting at least a few years' of ageability.
Name: Rainer Wess 2004 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Starts off with an intense blast of white pepper and celery leaf, but that's buffered by layers of ripe nectarines. Like most Knoll wines, it leans toward the lighter-weight side of things, yet doesn't lack for flavor or concentration, finishing with a refreshing, minerally character.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2004 Loibner Ried Kreutles Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Based on our tastings, this winery fared well in the heat of 2003. Sure, this federspiel is full and lush--more like a smaragd, but if you put that aside, what is in the bottle excels. Honts of pepper, smoke, honey, melon and nectarine give great complexity, while the long finish drives home with a firm edge honed in peppery spice.
Name: Högl 2003 Terrassen-Spitzergraben Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This easy-to-like wine offers a fullish, slightly oily mouthfeel to match with its peach-driven, mineral-tinged flavors. Grace notes of celery leaf and grapefruit provide focus and complexity on the long-lasting finish.
Name: Laurenz V. 2004 Charming Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: If you wish you could afford to drink more Grüner Veltliner, load up on this gem, which features varietally correct aromas of white pepper and celery leaf layered over ripe stone fruit. It's full-bodied and seems soft at first, but then adds acidity and mineral notes on the finish that provide a firm backbone. Crisp and refreshing on the finish; perfect for summertime.
Name: Stadt Krems 2004 Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A great value in Grüner Veltliner, this medium-bodied offering features a saliva-inducing blend of spices, garden herbs and ripe fruit, shot through with a dose of dry minerality. True to the grape, and true to the terroir--all for less than $10.
Name: Freie Weingärtner Wachau 2004 Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Could 2005 signal a new level of quality for Ehmoser? This entry-level Grüner augurs well, combining fresh citrus and tomato leaf with ripe stone fruits. Slightly creamy notes add textural interest, while the finish is crisp and clean. Good value.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2005 Von Den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: This wine packs plenty of varietal character into an elegant, lighter-bodied format. Leafy notes and white pepper aromas grace the nose, while the flavors add a slight foundation of melon and mineral. Drink now.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2004 Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Full-bodied, warm and round in the mouth, this honeyed Grüner Veltliner shows nary a hard edge, marrying melon and pear flavors in a soft, easy-drinking wine that's simply delicious. Drink now.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2003 Berglage Loiben Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Hard to mistake this for any other grape variety, given its prominently white-pepper and celery-leaf aromas. A bit austere on the palate, with chalky-mineral notes and leafy flavors. A notch below the excellent 2003, which showed more stone-fruit character, but still very good—and very fairly priced.
Name: Wieninger 2004 Herrenholz Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Starts off with deep petrol and mineral notes on the nose before becoming more fruit-driven on the plump, medium-weight palate. Ripe peach and plum flavors add hints of red berries, then turn stony on the finish.
Name: Rainer Wess 2004 Wachauer Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Smells intriguing, with minerally, corn-oil scents dominating, but graced by hints of honeyed orange sections. In the mouth, it's firmly built without being hard—like a sharp-edged table that's been padded at the corners. Picks up a leafy note on the finish, but it's mostly minerally.
Name: Malat 2004 Höhlgraben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The 2004 vintage didn't yield blockbuster Grüner Veltliners, but the lower-level wines seem particularly attractive. This offering boasts a pronounced leafiness, but also ripe, almost honeyed flavors and creamy texture. Some crisp acids on the finish give it the necessary edge to serve as an apéritif or alongside food.
Name: Felsner 2004 Lössterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Prager seemed to be a little inconsistent in 2004, or maybe I just had trouble understanding all of the wines. This one offers plenty of volume, combining passion fruit and pepper in a bold, loud cacophony that I didn't find find very harmonious. Bright and tangy on the finish.
Name: Prager 2004 Hinter Der Burg Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: My reactions to the various 2004s in the Prager lineup were a bit mixed, and this bottling was no exception. It possesses a light mouthfeel that hints at oiliness appropriate to a smaragd designation, but the flavors seem a bit sour and slightly underripe, ranging from quince to gooseberry and finishing with a tart edge.
Name: Prager 2004 Weitenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This well-priced wine boasts ripe aromas of nectarine and lime, then delivers more stone fruit on the palate. With its fresh, citrusy finish, this isn't a particularly peppery or complex Grüner, but one that provides a tasty introduction to the genre.
Name: Laurenz V. 2004 Laurenz and Sophie Singing Grüner Veltliner (Austria)

Description: Creamy-textured and more rounded than you might expect from a Grüner Veltliner, but mouthfilling and tasty. Hints of honey and melon are accented by ripe citrus, finally ending on a tangerine note.
Name: Schuberth 2003 Hintaus Kabinett Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Light and fresh, but seems to lack a bit of intensity, offering modest melon and white pepper flavors. Finishes a bit short.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2004 Loibner Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Not quite in synch, with hard, stony aromas yet a round mouthfeel. Citrus, melon and pepper aromas and flavors are solid, but finish a bit short.
Name: Machherndl 2003 Kollmütz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Slighty nutty-smelling at first, but that gives way to floral, fresh green notes alongside citrus and pear. It's on the full-bodied side, with pear and melon fruit accented by greens and a dusting of mineral. Long on the finish, seeming to build in intensity over time. Imported by Magellan Wine Imports.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2004 Aurum Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: A fantastic value in eiswein, this brilliantly balanced offering blends intense dried apricot, quince and bergamot aromas with flavors that are sweet but not cloying. Citrus and melon notes take charge of the midpalate. Because of its balancing acidity, serve this with foie gras rather than dessert. Imported by Winemonger.com.
Name: Manfred Weiss 1999 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: A bit reticent on the nose, offering little more than hints of honey and peppery spice. It's much more expressive in the mouth, where it delivers melon, pear and liquid minerals via a full, oily-textured mouthfeel. Imported by Broadbent Selections, Inc.
Name: Machherndl 2003 Smaragd Kollmitz Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Hints of jalapeñ¯ ¯il and stone fruits mingle easily on the nose of this intriguing wine. On the palate, big, mouthfilling flavors of mineral and peach end on a spicy-peppery note. True to the variety, and possessed of a distinct sense of harmony. Imported by Prescott Wines.
Name: Steininger 2004 Grand Gr?e= Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Rather tropical and exotic for Gr?with peach and melon aromas and a creamy texture. Flavor-wise, it?s fruit-forward, but still delivers enough spicy complexity to keep it interesting, finishing smoothly, elegantly and long. Imported by Prescott Wines.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2003 Bergdistel D?iner Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Full-bodied, with a soft, round mouthfeel that fits well with the scents of white pepper and ripe peaches. Mineral and melon flavors ease across the palate, ending on a long, minerally and subtly peppery note. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Rainer Wess 2004 Pfaffenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Rather herbal and peppery on the nose, instantly marking it as Grüner. Honey and green apple flavors merge easily on the weighty, slightly oily palate, finishing long and peppery. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2004 Rotes Tor Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: To me, Knoll's wines are always among the lightest-bodied of the major Wachau producers, but they are exquisitely detailed, presenting their scents and flavors in a fine filigree. This one offers hints of celery and lettuce greens, melon and white pepper edged with traces of honeyed richness. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2004 Ried Kreutles Loibner Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A joint venture between Johann Donabaum and Franz-Josef Gritsch, Kalmuck has produced a debut bottling that packs in substantial white pepper notes backed by melony underpinnings. Relatively light-bodied, with a refreshing lime and pepper finish. Imported by Winemonger.com.
Name: Kalmuck 2004 Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This medium-bodied GV is a textbook example, boasting hints of white pepper and anise on the nose, followed by flavors of apples, pears and spice. Finishes on a minerally note, with an almost dusty quality. Imported by Winemonger.com.
Name: Högl 2003 Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Ripe, fruity and intense on the nose, with aromas of lime, orange zest and peach. The palate develops more complexity, adding hints of pepper and dry minerals to bold tangerine flavors. Attractive and flashy, but just lacks a bit of length on the finish. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Stadt Krems 2004 Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This medium-bodied eiswein retains a strong sense of varietal character, layering white pepper aromas over sweet apricot and candied pineapple flavors. A bit short on the finish, but a solid effort overall. Imported by Grape Expectations (CA).
Name: Felsner 1999 Icon Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Smells fresh and citrusy, with hints of green apples, celery fronds and white pepper. Medium-bodied, with no hard edges, this easy-to-drink Grüner develops flavors of stone fruit as well, ending with a nice balance of ripe peach and white pepper. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Stadt Krems 2004 Weinzierlberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This nicely balanced GV features ripe pears and tropical fruit allied to citrus and white pepper, but just lacks that extra intensity and concentration of the best examples. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2004 Terrassen Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Reticent on the nose, yielding stony, waxy notes but little else. It's medium-bodied and a bit austere on the palate as well, but then the stone and melon flavors open out on the finish into lemon, hints of pepper and celery leaf. Imported by Prescott Wines.
Name: Anton Bauer 2003 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: Starts off well, with scents of honey and spice, broadening on the palate into ripe pears accented by anise and honeyed notes. Slightly oily in texture, this is a pretty wine that just falls short on the abbreviated finish. Imported by Winemonger.com.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2003 Spitzer Point Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Reasonably priced for the quality, this light, refreshing GV has aromas of wet stones and fresh greens, followed by crisp, minerally flavors and hints of lettuce leaf. A bit short on the finish, but that's a quibble. Imported by Magellan Wine Imports.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2004 Von Den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: Although this wine starts well, with scents of lime, stone fruit, gunmetal and mineral oil, it never really gets going on the palate, where the understated flavors of peach and pear end on a citrusy note. Imported by USA Wine Imports.
Name: Oriel 2004 Ortolan Falkenstein Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: As the name suggests, this is light and dry, filled with modest aromas and flavors of citrus and mild salad greens. Finishes on a tart note. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Wieninger 2004 Leicht & Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: Odd and jumbled on the nose, with apple and apricot scents, a hint of mint and maybe even a bit of volatile acidity, then creamed corn flavors on the palate. Not my cup of tea; an unusual misstep from Prager.
Name: Prager 2004 Zwerithaler Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Rated as one of the top Austrian red wine producers (look for his highly regarded Pinot Noir), Gerhard Markowitsch also seems to be at home with Austria's national grape. In the naturally warm climate of Carnuntum in the Danube valley east of Vienna, the Grüner can flourish into a ripe, full-bodied style while still keeping fresh acidity. This is a delicious wine, packed with citrus, pear and quince flavors. Drink as an aperitif or with salads or cold appetizers.
Name: Markowitsch 2004 Schanzäcker Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Light to medium in body, with subtle aromas of mineral smoke, apples and pears, this Grüner won't wow, just artfully impress. Crisp tree fruit and melon flavors echo on the mineral-laden finish. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2003 Loibner Federspiel Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Stony and minerally, with some nectarine and citrus scents that develop into grapefruit and stone fruit flavors on the palate. Clean and fresh without being hard or edgy, this is nicely balanced and nicely priced. Imported by Grape Expectations (CA).
Name: Felsner 2004 Gedersdorfer Moosburgerin Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Classically proportioned GV, with good balance and a plump mouthfeel that fills out the wine's celery leaf, mineral and apple flavors. Long and stony on the finish. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2003 Rotes Tor Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Weighty (14% alcohol) yet crisp and peppery, giving it a refreshing feel. Starts with some leafy greens and ripe aples, then adds honey balanced by white pepper.
Name: Högl 2003 Stammliegenschaften Schön Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Fairly big for a federspiel, with hints of honey and ripe apples on the nose, but then it turns less ripe on the palate, picking up intriguing spice drop flavors. Finishes crisp and clean.
Name: Machherndl 2003 Kollmütz Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Slightly nutty and a bit reductive at first, but it opens up to reveal flavors of citrus, peach and mineral and a soft, tender mouthfeel. Ends on an orangey note. Imported by Magellan Wine Imports.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2004 Hohenberg Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: Smells and tastes like a combination of sun-warmed stones and white peaches. It's round and ripe, showing just a touch of alcoholic warmth on the finish. Imported by Grape Expectations (CA).
Name: Felsner 2004 Gedersdorfer Vordernberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Round and plump in the mouth, with aromas of celery greens and flavors of white peaches, citrus and herbs. Soft and a bit warming on the finish. Imported by Grape Expectations (CA).
Name: Felsner 2004 Rohrendorfer Leithen Alte Reben Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A bit fat, but still varietally correct, with aromas and flavors of celery leaf and white pepper. Subtle hints of stone fruits round out the midpalate. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Rainer Wess 2003 Wachauer Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Pungent and a bit tropical on the nose; a bit Sauvignon in character. Passion fruit flavors flow easily across the midweight palate, finishing tart but not that crisp. Imported by Magellan Wine Imports.
Name: Pitnauer 2004 Hagelsberg Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)

Description: Schmid's cuvée of old vines exhibits exotic aromas that hints at bacon, pepper and citrus. Flavors continue the theme, with melon, citrus and pepper flavors accented by a smoked-meat note. Full-bodied and rich, yet balanced, with a long finish that features mingled citrus and melon. Imported by Tastings Import Company.
Name: Josef Schmid 2002 Alte Reben Priorissa Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: F.X. Pichler, one of the icons of Austrian wine, never shies away from power in his wines. This wine is seriously packed with concentration of fruit, rich spices and pepper, flavors of ripe apricots. But there is acidity there, along with a creamy vanilla character, which bring the wine to a harmonious finish.
Name: F X Pichler 2001 Dürnsteiner Kellerberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Nicely balanced for such a big, full-bodied wine, with enough peppery spice, minerally intensity and pink grapefruit to keep the bulk in check. Does have some baked-apple notes suggestive of a warm vintage, but also a long, peppery finish. Drink now. Imported by Winemonger.
Name: Högl 2003 Ried Schon Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: From his tiny valley above Krems, Martin Nigl seems to produce effortless wines with all the right intensity of flavor and richness. This Privat (which, for him, is the equivalent of a reserve wine), is intense, concentrated and packed with spice, pepper and yellow apples. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Nigl 2002 Privat Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Rich and full-bodied, with flamboyant aromas and flavors of honey, melon and spice that cascade across the palate in a powerful wave. Long and intense on the finish. Tastes great now, but with its impeccable balance and concentration it should age wonderfully, too. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Franz Hirtzberger 2003 Honivogl Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Very ripe and full-bodied, with baked apple and citrus aromas accented by oily-minerally notes reminiscent of corn oil and peppery spice. Shows superb concentration—enough to prolong the finish despite what seems to be pervilously low acidity. Drink now. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2003 Wösendorfer Kollmütz Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Gerald Malat is a seminal figure in winemaking in Krems, the first to match grape variety to soil type in a region previously dominated by small holdings and tiny vineyards. So it's fitting that this Grüner Veltliner should power through with ripe, peppery fruit and flavors of apples, pears and spice. It needs a year or two to age. Imported by Morandell Imports.
Name: Malat 2003 Dreigarten Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A lovely, complex wine that starts with tangerines and dried spices, then opens up slowly to reveal layers of honey, citrus and spice complexities. It's round in the mouth without being soft, finishing with good length. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Emmerich Knoll 2002 Ried Kreutles Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: While the Steinberg does produce delicate wines, this is an exception. Powered and peppery, it is rich, ripe and full-bodied. Karl Fritsch has developed almost an international style, emphasizing fruit intensity, but he has not lost all the fine balance of an Austrian Grüner Veltliner. Imported by Modern Food & Wine Concepts.
Name: Weinberghof Fritsch 2003 Steinberg Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: Like many of the wines from Austria's hot 2003 vintage, this is really ripe. Weighty and slightly viscous on the palate, with scents of nectarine that merge easily into flavors of stone fruits, mineral oil and a hint of white pepper. So rich on the finish it seems almost off dry. Imported by Tastings Import Company.
Name: Allram 2003 Gaisberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Shows good acidity for a 2003, with a crispness on the finish that belies the vintage. Peppery and a bit green-herbal-vegetal on the nose—classic GV. Then it delivers peach and mineral oil flavors on the palate and finish. Good value. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Wieninger 2003 Herrenholz Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: A mineral character dominates this wine, a product of the terraced vineyards above the Danube. It is spicy and peppery, with pure white peach flavors and crisp, finishing acidity. It's still young, and should develop over four to five years. Imported by Modern Food & Wine Concepts.
Name: Forstreiter 2003 Schiefer Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: The DAC (Districtus Austriae Controllatus) wines, designed for easy drinking but with a good character of terroir and character, have found just the right expression in this wine. It is made from old vines which give it beautiful integration, concentration and depth of fruit. Imported by Blue Danube Wine Co.
Name: Weinrieder 2003 Schneiderberg DAC Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: In the Salomon-Undhof range, Reserve wines are late-harvest wines, but that means rich, with honey flavors, rather than sweet. This Grüner Veltliner has all the right varietal character, pepper, spice and pure, ripe fruit. Age it for three or four years to balance the richness with the fruit. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2003 Lindberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This wine, from the Loibner vineyard near Dürnstein, is rich, packed with pepper and spice flavors, and also shows some smoky mineral characters. It is powerful and concentrated, a good expression of the intensity that Grüner Veltliner can attain in the eastern end of the Wachau. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Alzinger 2003 Loibner Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A bit dark in color—polished brass—but shows lovely aromas of white peaches, corn oil and green peppercorns. Oily and viscous in the mouth, with flavors of peppered peaches. Pronounced pepperiness on the finish, along with a hint of alcohol. Drink now. Imported by Tastings Import Company.
Name: Eichinger 2002 Strasser Gaisberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A great buy in GV, this offering shows more minerality that most GVs at any price, delivering scents of powdered stone, apple and citrus flavors. As the name suggests, it's light and dry, with a long, smoky, mouthwatering finish. If you like Grüner but think you can't afford to drink it every day, buy this one by the case. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Wieninger 2003 Leicht & Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

Description: The Senftenberg vineyard, which takes its name from the castle ruins above the village, is one of Kremstal's most illustrious sites. Franz Proidl makes a classically ripe, intense Grüner Veltliner from his vines. It is well balanced, with fine, crisp acidity. Imported by Select Wines.
Name: Proidl 2003 Senftenberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A rich, creamy wine from a master of Grüner Veltliner. Packed with pepper and ripe fruit, it is full of character, but also reflects the heat of 2003. Imported by Avatar Wine Marketing.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2003 Hundsleiten/Sandtal Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Fine, crisp, fresh fruit from a sand and loam vineyard close to the Danube, opposite Krems. It has is an attractive green streak, which gives the wine a lift and acidity. Imported by Modern Food & Wine Concepts.
Name: Forstreiter 2003 Kremser Kogl Bergwein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This plump, medium-weight Grüner doesn't have the weight and richness of many 2003s, but makes up for it with its juicy, fresh, lipsmacking finish. Apple, citrus and mineral notes don't show a lot of typical spice, but still satisfy. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Loimer 2003 Käferberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Wines like this rich wine from Rudi Pichler are the best expression of the granite and slate soil of the Wachau. The wine has just the right peppery character of Grüner Veltliner combined with the crisp acidity of the region. This is an excellent food wine. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2003 Hochrain Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This wine, from the first vintage of DAC (Districtus Austriae Controllatus) wines, is packed with great, ripe fruit, fresh acidity and delicious pepper and spice flavors. The aftertaste is crisp and vibrant. Imported by Avatar Wine Marketing.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2003 Haidviertel DAC Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A youthful wine, quite rich but not yet integrated, with good fresh fruit and crisp acidity. It should develop into an elegant, fruit-driven wine that will be great as an apéritif. Imported by Modern Food & Wine Concepts.
Name: Forstreiter 2003 Exclusiv Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Good Grüner doesn't come this well priced very often. Although this rendition shows the rich, oily weight of the vintage, it also retains a strong sense of varietal identity—aromas and flavors of pepper, pear and stone fruit, backed by a sense of minerality and depth. Imported by Tastings Import Company.
Name: Johann Topf 2003 Strassertal Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Smaragd wines, the top category in the Wachau, are intended to be rich and powerful. And this wine from the Frei Weingärtner Wachau fits this profile well. It combines this power successfully with a racy character, some mineral flavors and a good seasoning of pepper. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2003 Dürnsteiner Kellerberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Pear, melon and a hint of celery leaf mark the nose of Loimer entry-level GV. It's only 12.5% alcohol, yet comes across as honeyed and ripe; full-bodied yet tart and long on the finish. Honey, melon, lime and grapefruit flavors round out the package. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Loimer 2003 Grüner Veltliner (Langenlois)

Description: Nikolaus Moser, who currently runs this family winery, comes from one of Austria's most illustrious wine families. This is a fresh, clean style of Grüner Veltliner, but relatively light with some pleasant acidity. There is a good, racy, crisp undertone. Imported by Martin Scott Wines.
Name: Sepp Moser 2003 Breiter Rain Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A breezy, fresh wine, packed with fruit, flavors of pepper and spice that would work well as an apéritif, or with white fish. The wine comes from the Freie Weingärtner Wachau coop, probably the top cooperative in Austria. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2003 Loibner Loibenberg Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Another nice GV from Allram—and at an excellent price. Pear, pepper and mineral scents and flavors; a bit oily in the mouth. A bit short on the finish, but a nice intro-level Grüner. Imported by Tastings Import Company.
Name: Allram 2003 Strassertal Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The Czerny family, who have 27 acres of vines on the terraces of the Wagram, make long-lived, bone-dry wines, produced from an organic vineyard. This wine has years to go. It is still fresh, but yielding only grapefruit and spice flavors at this stage. Power and elegance should come later. Imported by Domaine Select Wine Estates.
Name: Wimmer-Czerny 2003 Fumberg Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: On the light side, but not lacking for concentration or flavor. Steely and minerally, with lime and tart cantaloupe flavors that finish with unusual freshness and zest for the vintage. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Prager 2003 Hinter Der Burg Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: A rich, spicy wine from a family winery near the Neusiedlersee, which has been in the wine biz since 1698. It's much richer than Grüner Veltliner usually is, but it has its own personality: it's spicy, with good acidity and plenty of varietal character. Imported by Austrian Specialty Wine Company.
Name: Leoplold & Silvane Sommer 2003 M Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

Description: The DAC, or Districtus Austriae Controllatus, is a new form of appellation applied to Grüner Veltliner in Weinviertel. This wine is typical of the taste profile of DAC wines: fresh and flowery, with crisp fruit and peppery spice. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Familie Zull 2003 DAC Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: A crisp, fresh, youthful Grüner Veltliner, which has a young, grapefruit character and fresh acidity. This shows all the earthy, peppery character of Weinviertel. Imported by Modern Food & Wine Concepts.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2003 Drei Kruezen Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: This is something of a curiosity, a Grüner Veltliner which has been matured in wood. It gives the wine extra spiciness and intensity of flavor, although some of the pepper character of the grape is lost in the process. This wine is big, ripe and full. Imported by Austrian Specialty Wine Company.
Name: Adolf & Heinrich Fuchs 2003 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: The loess slopes of the Hohenberg vineyard come through in the spicy character of this wine. It is still young, with grapefruit flavors, but should develop richness over the next two to three years. Imported by Legend Brands LLC Imports.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2003 Hohenberg Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: Lots of fruit here, blending tangerine, pear, grapefruit and melon. Missing are extra dimensions of richness and minerality. It's a clean, pleasant wine to drink over the next year or two. Imported by Vin Divino.
Name: Rudi Pichler 2003 Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: “Premium Reserve” to the Sommer winery means “wood aged,” and this Grüner has plenty of wood-derived toast and spice, to complement the spiciness and pepperiness of the grape. The aftertaste is creamy and rich. Imported by Austrian Specialty Wine Company.
Name: Leoplold & Silvane Sommer 2003 Premium Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

Description: Maximilian Hardegg's branded Grüner Veltliner is a hit with the smart set in Vienna. It is an easy-drinking wine, full of soft fruit and freshness. A touch of soft sweetness at the end adds to its mainstream appeal. Imported by Modern Food & Wine Concepts.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2003 Veltlinsky Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: This is full bodied, much bigger than the Grüner Veltliner of the Weinviertel in northern Austria. From the hot Burgenland, this is rich, with pepper and white fruit flavors, but only a slight touch of acidity. The aftertaste has hints of caramel. Imported by Austrian Specialty Wine Company.
Name: Adolf & Heinrich Fuchs 2003 Classic Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee)

Description: As Grüner Veltliner ages, it becomes more and more like mature Riesling. This wine has petrol flavors, along with light acidity, and a taste of vanilla and toast. Still lively, this has a bone dry aftertaste. It could certainly age longer.
Name: Nikolaihof 1990 Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: With its hints of honey on the nose and a rich, slightly viscous mouthfeel, it's immediately apparent that this is an ambitious effort. Melon and peach flavors are hung on a spine of black pepper, ending in a long, mouthwatering finish. It's dry, but lusciously ripe-tasting.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2001 Spitzer Point Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: This medium-weight GV carries plenty of almost fat, ripe peach flavors, but also a hard stony edge that sets it apart. Faint peppery notes chime in on the nose and palate, while the finish is long and minerally.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2003 Hohenberg Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: A riper, gentler style of Grüner, with trademark perfumy aromas of celery stalk and white pepper giving way to ripe peach and nectarine flavors. Soft and round in the mouth; there are no hard edges here.
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2003 Singerriedel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: White pepper and celery leaf aromas are pure Grüner; this would be a good example to throw in a blind tasting. Peppery, minerally flavors are carried on a slightly oily mouthfeel that finishes with just a bit of heaviness.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2002 Loibner Garten Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: As varietally true a GV as you'll find, with very peppery aromas alongside scents of celery leaf. On the palate, there's a blast of pepper, then some plump, slightly vegetal fruit. Not surprisingly, it's peppery on the finish.
Name: Johann Donabaum 2002 Spitzer Point Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Solid Grüner, with hints of peach and pear fruit alongside notes of smoke and minerals. Soft, round mouthfeel, hints of fresh green fruits and only a hint of pepper make this immediately approachable.
Name: Franz Mittelbach 2002 Tegernseerhof Bergdistel Dürnsteiner Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Made in a lighter, less ripe and less intense style, this is a typical quaffing Grüner, with modest pear and peach aromas and a hint of pepper. Underripe nectarine flavors join apple and herb on the palate before a tart, citrusy finish.
Name: Josef Ehmoser 2003 Von Den Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: Grüner Veltliner is Austria's own special white—it's fresh, but peppery, aromatic, spicy and flowery. This example has all those flavors, and is a bargain, too. It comes from one of the world's great cooperatives. The fruit comes from the terraced vineyards of the Wachau region in the Danube Valley. The term “Federspiel” is used in the Wachau to denote a good everyday wine, and this is exactly that.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2002 Federspiel Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: To avoid confusing American consumers, only the word “Lois” appears on the main label; the niggling details about grape variety, vintage and origin are in small print on the back. It's an attempt at creating a branded Austrian wine, which should succeed if the quality of what's in the bottle remains this high. It's light and minerally, with hints of celery stalk, underripe honeydew and green plums. Finishes tart and clean.
Name: Loimer 2002 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Langenlois)

Description: It's difficult to find inexpensive Austrian wines in the United States; importers (somewhat justifiably) seem to think that the demand for Austrian wines is further up-market. So it was refreshing to find this lithesome gem. It's light and fresh, with a rainwater-mineral aspect to it and a dollop of Grüner character. Fine for a springtime picnic, or as an apéritif.
Name: E. & M. Berger 2002 Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: This is a sensational wine. Bright apple and cream aromas set the scene. It is rich and concentrated with a fat, oily texture and spicy flavors. Spice and ripe fruit make it seem almost like an Alsatian Gewürztraminer. It is certainly powerful, but it has a layer of fine, elegant acidity as well.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2001 Spiegel Reserve Gruner Veltliner Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
R&A Pfaffl 2001 Goldjoch Gruner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: Aromas of ripe apples and cream on the nose make this an immediately appealing wine. On the palate there are full peppery flavors and very ripe, aromatic fruit. The final touch of light acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2000 Hundsleiten/Sandtal Gruner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
Leoplold & Silvane Sommer 2001 M Gruner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee)

Description: There is a wonderful fresh-fruit salad of aromas. The palate has a layer of acidity, plus full peppery flavors. The fruit is certainly ripe, but it has a firm sense of structure and a hint of greenness.
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2001 Hundsleien/Sandtal Trocken Gruner Ventliner Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
Nigl 2001 Privat Gruner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A crisp, fresh wine with light, fresh, open fruit. A touch of spice hints at the volcanic and granitic soil of the vineyard, while the fresh acidity highlights the fruit flavors and provides a crisp green aftertaste.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2001 Schenkenbichl Gruner Veltliner Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
Jurtschitsch 2001 Steinhaus Gruner Veltliner Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: A taut, vibrant wine with green fruits and immediate acidity on the nose. The palate is crisp, with fresh fruit flavors along with some spicy wood. The aftertaste is completely refreshing.
Name: Leoplold & Silvane Sommer 2001 Premium Reserve Trocken Gruner Ventliner Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee)

Description: Fresh fruit, with light green-apple flavors and a  refreshing streak of acidity give this wine lightness and poise. It shows the easy, simple side of Grüner Veltliner to great effect.
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg 2001 Altheiligenstiftung Gruner Ventliner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: The intensely mineral, steely character of this wine is classic Wachau Grüner Veltliner. Hints of pepper, herbs and spice act as a foil to the acidic and almost granite-like character of the wine. This should age well over 5 years.
Name: Freie Weingärtner Wachau 2001 Domaine Wachau Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: The fruit on the nose is reminiscent of hedgerow fruits—blackberries, alpine strawberries, plums and blueberries. The palate is very green with high acidity and light, fresh fruit flavors. The final impression is of a fresh, crisp wine, with just a touch of pepper.
Name: Adolf & Heinrich Fuchs 2001 Classik Trocken Gruner Ventliner Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

Description: Delightfully fresh, clean fruit on the nose, with aromas of green plums. This is a full, fat, slightly spicy wine, with good acidity as well. The palate is generous and rich, with touches of currants and spice.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2001 Ried Wiegen Trocken Gruner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Donauland)

Description: Herbs and spices dominate this wine, with citrus on the nose and elegant fruit and a mineral character on the palate. Attractive and fresh.
Name: Freie Weingärtner Wachau 2001 Domaine Wachau Terrassen Federspeil Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: Subtitled Mein Hausweine—my house wine—this is a light, fresh, slightly spritzy Grüner Veltliner. It has fresh and creamy apple aromas, crisp acidity and a light, poised palate.
Name: Jurtschitsch 2001 Troken Gruve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: This rich and full-bodied Grüner pulls no punches, hitting hard with smoke, green pear, honey and peppery spice notes that score big on the long finish. Despite impressive ripeness and 14% alcohol, there's no apparent heat, just great depth. —J.C.
Name: Sonnhof 2000 Schenkenbichl Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Oily and rich describe this GV's mouthfeel, while its aromas are all about gardenias, apples and honey. Clove and cinnamon accent the ripe apple and pear fruit. Minerally and intense on the finish. —J.C.
Name: Zull 2000 Odfeld Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

Description: At first the aromas bursting forth are warm and inviting, turning harder and sterner with air, finally becoming almost crystalline in their apple and pear character. Flavors of honey and clove, with a long, dry talc-like finish. —J.C.
Name: Bründlmayer 2000 Kamptaler Terrasssen Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: An interesting contrast to Sonnhof's Schenkenbichl bottling, this wine's alcohol content is about 2% lower, making it seem light in comparison. It's greener and less ripe-tasting as well, but still good, with pea and lime flavors layered over a base of white stone fruits. —J.C.
Name: Sonnhof 2000 Steinhaus Trocken Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: You can sense the extra ripeness in this wine's warm aromas of leather and spice. The scents are almost meaty. Dark and warm flavors of Moroccan spices burnish the palate. —J.C.
Name: Josef Jamek 2000 Smaragd Ried Achleiten Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

Description: An easy-drinking GV with the emphasis on grapefruit and white peach flavors accented by peppery spice and minerals. It's light, clean and crisp, but finishes short. —J.C.
Name: E. & M. Berger 2000 Zehetnerin Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: A low-end Grüner that provides just enough lime fruit and green pea character to make a pleasant before-dinner drink. —J.C.
Name: Erich Salomon 2000 Hochterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

Description: Sonnhof's entry-level GV is light, tasting of nothing more than lime and mineral water. It's clean and fresh, an apéritif wine without a lot of baggage. —J.C.
Name: Sonnhof 2000 Grüve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

Description: Celery-leaf aromas mark the nose, and there's a strong green edge to the sugary flavors of roasted root vegetables. Low acidity leaves the wine feeling a bit heavy in the mouth. —J.C.
Name: Walter Glatzer 2000 Kabinett Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)
